story:
Assalamu Alaikum,

From influencing musical genres such as blues, jazz, and rap to participation in the Black Arts Movement and beyond, Black Muslims in the United States have a rich artistic and literary tradition. 

The Drinking Gourd aims to continue on that path as a Black Muslim literary magazine. We will provide nuanced depictions of the Black Muslim Diaspora through various forms of media, including but not limited to: visual art, poems, non-fiction, and fiction. 

 

ABOUT 

Centered within the legacies of Black Muslim liberation theology and Afrofuturism, The Drinking Gourd will serve as space where Black Muslims can articulate our experiences, passions, and selves outside of appeals to authority or dogma — whether those are in relation to the larger Muslim community or the various colonial empires that make up the West.

The publication’s name comes from a Black American folksong referencing the Big Dipper and its use in locating the Northstar. We named ourselves in this way to bring in the memories of enslaved African Muslims and their pursuit of freedom throughout the Americas.

While our editorial calendar partially depends on the number of submissions we receive, The Drinking Gourd intends to publish new content at least 2-4 times a month. We plan to release themed series alongside our regular content. 

We must add that The Drinking Gourd exists for the entire Black Muslim ummah. With many of The Drinking Gourd’s creators being queer Muslims ourselves, we unequivocally acknowledge and validate the existence of other Black LGBT+ Muslims. 

 

FUNDING

For this project, we are fundraising $6,000. The Drinking Gourd's editorial team is entirely composed of volunteers and hosted on Medium to eliminate any costs associated with a website. All funding is intended for paying contributors. 

At The Drinking Gourd, we do not believe in starting a magazine and asking for contributors without offering any compensation. It is narrated from 'Abdullah bin 'Umar that the Prophet (PBUH) said: "Give the worker his wages before his sweat dries."

Our magazine will offer all of our contributors a $50 flat rate to start. We hope that The Drinking Gourd can grow and receive enough community support to increase this rate.

This fundraiser will permit our magazine to publish through at least October 2020. 

 

CONNECT

To stay connected with The Drinking Gourd, please follow us on Twitter and like our Facebook page. 

If you are interested in submitting to The Drinking Gourd, all information can be found here.

story:
Short Summary

Speaking of the Environment: What Your Science Classes Didn't Teach You About Effective Communication is a guidebook to help you connect your science and environmental goals with winning communication strategies. From understanding your audiences, identifying your key messages, visualizing data, and more, this book will help you become a better communicator to win over more hearts and minds. 

My name is Paula Jasinski and I am the coauthor of Speaking of the Environment: What Your Science Classes Didn't Teach You About Effective Communication. David Jasinski and I wrote this book because most environmental and scientific organizations lack the tools to effectively communicate with the audiences they need to engage with. In this book, we translate our years of experience in environmental communication into steps you can follow to identify your key audiences and effectively engage with them.

Our hope is that, in reading this book, you will be able to apply what we’ve learned in almost three decades of communicating about the environment. Ultimately, we want you to see this book as a tool to help you transition from spewing facts to telling stories, both verbally and visually.

In this book, you'll learn about Listening to Learn, Connecting Messages to Audiences, Avoiding Jargon, The Power of Story, and Techniques for Visualizing Information. You'll hear stories such as...

  • End points are often not selling points. What you think of as the end points for environmental work (e.g., water quality or species restoration) may not be selling points for those you need to influence. Learn how to identify the co-benefits and themes that will resonate with your audiences and help you reach your goals.
  • How listening to audiences can make you smarter and more effective. Listening is a super-power when you use it to understand what influences decisions and behavior changes.
  • How to apply lessons from the world of marketing and apply them to environmental restoration and protection. 

You will love this book if:

  • You want to supercharge your environmental outreach;
  • You’d like to develop communication products that align with your audiences to meet your goals;
  • You want to be inspired by creative data visualizations.

Speaking of the Environment: What Your Science Classes Didn't Teach You About Effective Communication is a nonfiction book that speaks to environmental professionals, students, and scientists who want to connect with broader audiences and reach environmental goals in new ways.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this in December of 2021.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Authors

Paula Jasinski is President of Green Fin Studio, an award-winning environmental communication and marketing firm. As a trained environmental scientist, she explored her curiosity of how lessons from the worlds of marketing, advertising, and entertainment could be used to build support for environmental programs instead of dividing people. For more than two decades, she has used science and data to build engaging storylines and successful communication strategies for a wide variety of clients. Outside of work, she loves to travel, hike, and kayak with friends and family.

Dave Jasinski is Vice President and co-owner of Green Fin Studio, an environmental communication and marketing firm. After more than two decades of helping clients in the non-profit and academic world turn their data into stories, Dave wanted to share some of his lessons learned. In his spare time, Dave can be found bouncing off trees on the local mountain bike trails.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page).

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

Please use #SpeakingOfTheEnvironmental and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag: 
Instragram - @GreenFinStudio / @newdegreepress
Facebook -@GreenFinStudio / @NewDegreePress 
Twitter -@GreenFinStudio / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Paula Jasinski

story:
Short Summary

“Toni Brooks only has one rule when it comes to relationships: do not get attached. The only thing worse than falling in love is losing yourself in the process. When choosing between fight or flight, Toni picks flight. Although she’s given up on love, professionally, she is a top contender for the Emerging Voice award from the Black Media Association. Life is good until she's forced to connect with the family she hasn’t spoken to in a decade and the man she should’ve fought for.

Forced home for the foreseeable future, Toni has to decide if she wants to repair her relationships before she loses the people she’d left behind for good.”

Hi, my name is Amber Tucker, and I write black romance novels under the pen name Shaii Wright. I’m self-publishing my debut novel, The Ones I Left Behind,  standalone novel that comes out this Fall. I started this book based on a radio prompt: What’s the worst thing you’ve ever done to someone? I can’t tell you the answer because it’s a spoiler :) BUT what started as a radio prompt and a short story in undergrad turned into an 85,000 word novel that I completed during a double masters program (MS in Publishing and MFA in Creative Writing) while working full-time and raising two kids with my husband.

This book is more than just a passion project. It is the catalyst for the new life I’m building for my family as an entrepreneur and an author. The Ones I Left Behind will be the first book published under my new publishing company, Just Write Publishing!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Releasing a book lasts longer than the launch party, and the goal is sustained success. I’m asking for $4,000 from all of you to help cover the cost of self-publishing my book. This includes:

  • Editing and designing the book
  • The release party
  • All marketing efforts leading up to and after the release.

There are several support levels available and I truly appreciate any support you're able to give.

HONEY HONEY $5

Shoutout on Instagram & Facebook.

BLUE GUITAR $25

Copy of the ebook, blue guitar sticker...

PLUS: Shoutout on Instagram & Facebook.

READERS CHOICE $50

Copy of the ebook, your name immortalized in the acknowledgements...

PLUS: Shoutout on social media, and blue guitar sticker, 

SIGNATURE $100

Signed copy

PLUS: Shoutout on Instagram & Facebook, blue guitar bookmark, and  your name listed in the acknowledgements.

OPEN MIC NIGHT $250

The Ones I Left Behind mug, admission to the invite-only book launch party...

PLUS: Shoutout on  Instagram & Facebook, blue guitar bookmark,  signed copy,  your name listed in the acknowledgements, .

EMERGING VOICES $500

Your name immortalized as a character in The Ones I Left Behind (4 characters available, listed below**), admission to the invite-only book launch party.

PLUS: Shoutout on Instagram & Facebook, blue guitar bookmark, The Ones I Left Behind mug, signed copy,  mention in the acknowledgements,

WINE & DINE $1,000

Admission to the invite-only book launch party & a private dinner for you and a guest with me.

PLUS: Shoutout on social media, signed copy, The Ones I Left Behind mug, mention in the acknowledgements, your name immortalized as a character in The Ones I Left Behind (4 characters available, listed below**).

BOOK RELEASE $3,000            

Admission for eight to the invite-only book release party, recognition during the program, naming rights to a signature cocktail.

PLUS: *Shoutout on social media, signed copy, name immortalized in the acknowledgements,

 

**AVAILABLE CHARACTERS 


Character 1 - Female
Ever wanted to host an open mic night? Select this character one to become a sassy, slightly cynical Open Mic night at a trendy downtown Detroit bar.
 
Character 2 - Male
Do you do your best work behind the bar? Select this character to serve up the perfect drink to Toni. You may even get to flirt a little.
 
Character 3 - Female
Select this character to be the sweet, bubbly, artist girlfriend of Toni’s best friend. She makes the best desserts.
 
Character 4 - Male
Select this character to get ghosted by Toni. She didn’t mean any harm, I promise. 
 

The Impact

I’ve wanted to open a publishing company and self-publish my own books since I was in middle school. I was the kid that spent most of her time at the library or blew her birthday money on books at Borders (RIP). The Ones I Left Behind is the fruition of a childhood dream. Adding my voice to the collection of black women authors is a privilege that I hold dear. 

The Ones I Left Behind is a story about forgiveness, finding your identity, and choosing love over fear. The main character, Toni, is flawed and makes bad choices, but she's also determined, ambitious and willing to grow.

Early review:

Reading The One's I Left Behind was like reading a guilty-pleasure romance novel, without the guilt. Each character has a complex history that has shaped the way they love their partners and live their adult lives. Shaii perfectly paints a picture of a modern woman, Toni, attempting to rewrite her destiny. Her relationship with her family taught her one thing - to leave. Toni is confident, strong, and intelligent. I was hooked from the start; I was rooting for Toni one second and shaking my head in disgrace the next. Complex characters, with drama and humor. A perfect mix for a fun read that will leave you breathless. 

- Rayna Ketchum

 

Risks & Challenges

Self-publishing is a risk. I don’t have a traditional publishing machine backing me. I am the writer, marketer, PR, creative director--it all starts and stops with me. I choose this, without regrets. BUT it’s still a lot of pressure. And there is the definite risk that for all of the hours I put into this book, it won’t sell. 

I didn’t sleep for five years! I laugh about it now, but while I completed the double masters program, I drank a lot of coffee and Red Bull. Most nights, I stayed up until three in the morning and had to wake up a few hours later to get the kids up and ready for school. I nursed my son while I wrote the book, or a paper. This was hard! But finishing it was the first challenge and I did it. I can say that I am beyond proud of my work and I’m ready to write book two.

I choose self-publishing, knowing the challenges because it was important that my first book be on my own terms. From the look and feel, to the release date--I didn’t want to be at the mercy of traditional publishing's timing and intent. I wanted to do it for myself so that I could help aspiring authors and storytellers do it too. 

While I may not have a big name to back me, I have a big support system. They have allowed me to pursue this dream with relentless energy. It is my hope that you’ll join my team. I’m ready to keep the momentum going and write books two and three.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate any help spreading the word about the book and the fundraiser. Please like, comment, share my post to your network. You can find me on Instagram, Facebook and  Twitter @IAmShaiiWright and on TikTok @ShaiiWright.

Do you know other people I can connect with? Event space, designers, do you post reviews? I'm especially interested in early reviews. Email me at iamshaiiwright@gmail.com if you're interested.

Thank you!

story:
Vegan Tantra is a non-fiction Trilogy dedicated to studying the history, philosophy, rituals, symbolism, applications and eternal relevance of Eastern Tantra including Yoga, Western Magic including Alchemy and their ancient, inseparable bond with the values of veganism.

Vol. 1, Introduction to Vegan Magic, after introducing Tantra discusses diverse themes such as tantric techniques of increasing sexual bliss, heightening creative/intuitive abilities, use of psychoactive substances to develop extra sensory perceptions, reincarnation, life after death, ancient alchemy, modern psychology, the science behind new age fields of music/sound therapy, colour therapy, Biomimicry and the pitfalls of black magic using animal sacrifice.

Using several quotes from Vedic and Hermetic literature, studying the life of one of its authors Vishwamitra and references to many anecdotes and archetypes from eastern and western mythology the book promises to be a roller-coaster ride through the fabled world of Tantra and Magic encountering celestial nymphs, dreadful monsters and orgiastic celebrations from our sexually brilliant past on a powerful journey of personal transformation for all its readers.

As of now, the writing for vol. 1 is complete and the artwork is being done. We are looking at releasing the book latest by end of October 2016. 

Vol. 2, A Practical Guide to Vegan Magic, delves deeper into Tantra exploring its Yin and Yang in more detail. The Yin of Tantra is to understand God and the Universe by looking within and studying ourselves. The Yang of Tantra is to look outside and study the universe, both at the micro sub-atomic level and at the macro astral level, to understand ourselves. It is this Yang aspect of Tantra that gave birth to the twin ancient sciences of Alchemy and Astrology. We will use the knowledge of both these sciences, drawing parallels between atoms in molecular structures, individuals on Earth and stars in space, to understand our own journey here.

This volume is a step-by-step guide for the initiate of pure or Vegan Tantra to accomplish the seven-step process of kundalini yoga and hermetic alchemy raising our levels of consciousness and addressing our existential needs until we are connected to the universal network of nature in a seamless two-way communication being guided to fulfill the purpose of our lives and along with it meeting our personal goals and desires as milestones along that journey.

As of now, the writing for vol. 2 is underway and the artwork is being done. We are looking at releasing the book latest by end of November 2016. 

Vol. 3, Past, present and Future of Vegan Magic, is divided into three sections. The first one is an in-depth study of the origins of Tantra starting from the days of the super-continent Pangaea, before its landmass split into distinct continents some 175 million years ago, to the Paleo-Siberian roots of Indian Tantra with Shiva as the original tantric of the Hindu pantheon up until the fall of Tantra at the hands of political empires and organized religion as discussed in Volume One.

The second section offers tantric interpretations of modern and contemporary phenomenon like Imperialism, Colonization, Slavery, World Wars, Industrial revolution, Capitalism, Communism, Socialism, Cold War, The War against Terror, Global Warming, New World Order, and the recent socio-economic and cultural revolutions in the world of governance, banking, housing, healthcare, education, agriculture, drugs, sex, internet, matrimony and porn. Adding up these tantric interpretations on many different subjects, or inverse realities as we call them, we develop a more wholesome vision of the cause and effect of our present circumstances.

In the third and final section we use our knowledge of the laws of Tantra, like principles of sacred geometry, to predict the possible outcomes of our destiny that stand in front of us and then chose the course of action which promises to fulfil the prophecy of a world free from hunger, poverty, pollution, disease, slavery, crime, violence and war with abundant, free and clean energy, education, healthcare and housing for all, the possibility of which is knocking at our doorstep right now in the form of Veganism.

As of now, the writing for vol. 3 is underway and the artwork is being done. We are looking at releasing the book latest by end of December 2016. 

We need $2400 USD to complete the  art, editing and formatting of the book.

Contributors of $24 USD or more become the owners of what we consider to be essential vegan literature as we will mail you the E-Books of the entire trilogy, complete with cover and art by Dec 2016.

story:
Moi, Clara ? 

Bonjour, je m'appelle Clara et j'ai 20 ans. 

Je suis ce type de personne qu'on qualifie de passionné. Vous savez ceux qui désirent tout comprendre, tout apprendre ? Dès mon plus jeune âge, j'ai vite été conscientisée à plusieurs réalités choquantes de notre époque. L'injustice et les inégalités m'ont alors toujours poussée à m'impliquer auprès de la communauté. Depuis plus d'un an, j'ai mis les pieds dans plusieurs pays ce qui m'a ouvert les yeux sur les programmes de solidarité internationale. C'est ainsi que les démarches afin de participer à un stage Québec sans frontières sont arrivées. Ayant fait un DEC en théâtre, j'ai toujours eu un intérêt marqué pour l'art. Je tenais alors à pouvoir mettre de l'avant  l'art comme moyen d'apprentissage. C'est en tombant sur le stage "La famille : garantie du développement des enfants et des jeunes. " offert par L'AMIE que j'ai su que celui-ci était fait pour moi.

                             

Le stage, lui ?

Le programme de stages Québec sans frontières est un stage de solidarité internationale. Il est offert par L'AMIE- aide internationale à l'enfance http://www.amie.ca . Cet organisme québécois travaille avec des partenaires locaux qui eux, œuvrent auprès des enfants. Tous deux me permettront de partir avec sept autres jeunes afin de vivre une expérience unique d’entraide, d’échange et de solidarité internationale. Nous aurons le privilège de partager le quotidien d’une famille d’accueil, d’approfondir notre connaissance de l'espagnol et surtout de participer à la réalisation d’un projet en faveur de la famille comme moyen de développement intégral des enfants. 

Plus concrètement, je travaillerai bénévolement toute l'été dans le Wiñay, qui est un endroit de rassemblement des enfants et adolescents des quartiers près de Sucre. Dans ces centres, les jeunes peuvent développer diverses habiletés par l'entremise d'activités artistiques et éducatives. L'aide aux devoirs est d'ailleurs offerte. Travailler auprès de ces jeunes a pour but de faire de ces centres un lieu de rassemblement afin que la famille s'inscrive aux coeurs de la vie des enfants. 

 

Et vous là-dedans ?

Vous là-dedans vous avez un plus gros impact que vous le penser. Il est certain que je fais appel à vous pour m'appuyer financièrement, car même si le stage est grandement financé, une levée de fonds de 2000$ est nécessaire pour participer au projet. Mon objectif est d'amasser la somme de 1000$. Ceci dit, tous les dons sont acceptés, peu importe le montant. Toutefois, en plus d'un impact financier, il vous est possible d'avoir un impact social. En effet, un don pour un projet de développement international, c'est un pas vers l'épanouissement d'une société. Je crois que chaque enfant mérite d'avoir accès  aux ressources nécessaires à son développement. Votre argent servira à cette cause. 

Si vous êtes dans l'impossibilité de donner, mais que vous êtes tout de même intéressé et sensibilisé à mon projet, je vous invite à faire la promotion de mon stage simplement en en parlant et en partageant cette publication. 

Un gros merci pour votre soutien, 

Pour toutes informations supplémentaires, n'hésitez pas à m'écrire !

story:
Short Summary

Greetings Everyone!

My name is Alfredo, and first allow me to thank you in advance for taking time in wanting to help me out. I sincerely felt compelled to launch this campaign to help my mother-in-law who is an Elementary School teacher and a first-time grandmother.

My mother-in-law is one who will never ask for anything, yet she will give you the world if she could. Many of us are aware that our teachers work hard but receive little pay.

I personally have seen my mother-in-law work awfully long hours, sometimes until midnight or longer. Most of her weekends she spends grading papers, filling out reports, working on lesson plans, etc., all the things teachers do to help our kids. At times, I have seen her sadness when she can’t join the family during those special occasions because of school deadlines and obligations.

 She seriously works very hard and is dedicated to meet the needs of all her students.

What I admire the most is how she always goes above and beyond to help students that are economically disadvantage. Numerous times, I have seen my mother-in-law spend her last $20 just to buy shoes, socks, jackets, or school supplies for students that are in more dire need. Year after year, she sacrifices so much for others and gives unselfishly of herself.

As a grandmother, there isn’t anything she wouldn’t do for my son, including writing a book for him.

So, when my mother-in-law mentioned how she wished she could publish “Jedi’s book,” and share it with others, and knowing how she always does so much for anyone in need, I knew I had to help.

For these reasons and more, I sincerely ask for your support. Please join my wife, son, and I in launching this campaign to promote and publish her book. I also ask that you please find it in your heart and help this well deserving teacher/grandmother and be a part of making her dream come true.

 

What We Need & What You Get


Fortunately, my wife and I were able to print a couple of proof copies of the book
Heartstrings. One book was for my mother-in-law and the other to promote this
campaign. We certainly want the quality of the books to look great for everyone. That is
why I am asking from the bottom of my heart to support this campaign, so that we can
publish more books. Rest assured that your generous donations will allow us to help
my mother-in-law. In addition, it will also help us “Pay it Forward” by donating to our
School Libraries, Children’s Hospitals, and the Children’s Advocacy Centers, all the
places my mother-in-law holds dear to her heart.
Our perks are incredibly unique, and there are several options you can choose. You
can simply select to receive the Heartstrings book, or select receiving a matching gift
card with the book, or choose the Heartstring book (signed by the author) and it will also
include a custom-made heartstring book marker made by the author herself (she loves
crafts). As you can see, each option is exclusive and unique.
I was able to print some proof copies to show for the campaign. We want to make sure
the quality is great for everyone who is able to support the campaign.  We need your
support so we can not only get Heartstrings in your hands but also donate Heartstrings
to school libraries to as many as we can reach. 
Our perks are very unique, you have many options to get not only a book but to also get
a gift card thanking a special person who pulled your heartstring. Another very special
perk which gets you a custom heartstring book marker made by the author herself (she
loves crafts).  Each one is unique and each will be different from another. 
If we are able to get funding we will work to get them in bookstores and libraries around
the world in hopes we can pull someones heartstring. My mother in-law loves helping
kids less fortunate so we will try to help as many kids this holiday season with your
donations. 


The Impact


We’ve all heard the phrase, “Pay it forward.”
Well, if you find it in your heart to help us fund this campaign, not only are you pulling
my family’s heartstrings, but you will also pay it forward to an individual that has
seriously done so much for others without ever asking for anything in return. I ask that
you become part of this schoolteacher’s dream, and also become part of my family’s
vision to pay it forward not only to my mother-in-law, but others around the world.

If we get fully funded you will be helping pull someones Hearstrings! Donating is big for
our family and once you support Heartstrings you will be come part of our family. Your
support will also help donate to someone around and helping us pull their heartstring. 
Risks & Challenges
Shipping is the only risk. Since this book can be a great gift for all your loved ones and
special friends, we certainly want everyone to receive a copy of Heartstrings before
Christmas. That is why we are ending our campaign on November 14 th . Thank
goodness the printing representative assured us that we can receive the published
books by the end of November. This will certainly give us plenty of time to package the
books and mail them out to you by the first week of December. We feel confident
enough that you will enjoy this adorable book and will want to share it with others, just to
pull their Heartstrings too.
.

The only risk is shipping. We want everyone to have Hearstrings in their hands before
Christmas time. We want you to share Hearstrings with your families this Holiday
season. The campaign ends on November 14th, Our printer assured us we could get
the books turned around fast enough to get them out the first week of December. 
This Christmas we can have all of our Heartstrings pulled. 


Other Ways You Can Help


My family and I completely understand that these are difficult times, and many may not
be able to afford buying the book but still would like to help. For this reason, that is why I
opened the donations at $1 with a Thank you perk!
I wholeheartedly appreciate any amount. In addition, I look forward in combining your
special gift with this adorable book to help my mother-in-law pull many Heartstrings
around the world.
Sincerely,
Alfredo


We know these are difficult times and some people cant afford to buy the book but want
to help. This is why we opened up donations for $1 with a Thank you perk!  Which ever
you can do is appreciated and we want you to know that even a dollar will help someone this holiday season.

Thank you

story:
A Gathering of the Tribes is proud to announce the upcoming publication of Tribes #16, The Black Lives Matter Issue, forthcoming in the winter/spring, with Ishmael Reed serving as the Editor, and Danny Simmons serving as the Art Editor for this vital issue. 

 

Tribes #16, the Black Lives Matter Issue will be a full color, 8’x 10’ print journal, featuring visual art, poetry and prose, from emerging and established revolutionary artists of our time, celebrating the Black Lives Matter movement and speaking to the issues that propelled its formation and growth. 

 

Statement from Tribes #16 Editor, Ishmael Reed:

The death of Steve Cannon meant the end of an era of an art movement that began in the late 1950s and ended in 2019. This was a period of artistic flowering that began with painters, musicians, writers, poets who rose from obscurity to be included in the canon. If a series of revolutions have led to a more inclusive arts scene, Cannon was one of those who was in the midst of them. He earned the title of “Emperor of the Lower East Side,” as he mentored a generation of younger artists. It is a tribute to Steve’s legacy that the work that he left continues as a new generation led by Chavisa Woods and aided by the generosity of David Hammons, has stepped in to continue the Tribes culture. The formidable Quincy Troupe has come aboard as poetry editor. It is also a recognition of Cannon’s outstanding contribution to the arts that when I summoned writers to contribute to a special issue of Tribes, which would address the issue of Black Lives Matter. Pulitzer Prize winners, National Book Award and American Book Award winners and a former poet laureate answered the call. With Danny Simmons as a graphics editor, this special issue will demonstrate that Tribes lives!

 

About Tribes:

Founded in 1993, A Gathering of Tribes 501(c)(3) is a non-profit whose mission is to  provide a platform for diverse, traditionally under-represented artists and writers, amplifying the emerging and established revolutionary voices of our time. Tribes is also committed to honoring and memorializing our founder, Steve Cannon’s life and legacy.

The formidable Quincy Troupe has come aboard as poetry editor. It is also a recognition of Cannon’s outstanding contribution to the arts that when I summoned writers to contribute to a special issue of Tribes, which would address the issue of Black Lives Matter. Pulitzer Prize winners, National Book Award and American Book Award winners and a former poet laureate answered the call. With Danny Simmons as a graphics editor, this special issue will demonstrate that Tribes lives! About Tribes:Founded in 1993, A Gathering of Tribes 501(c)(3) is a non-profit whose mission is to  provide a platform for diverse, traditionally under-represented artists and writers, amplifying the emerging and established revolutionary voices of our time. Tribes is also committed to honoring and memorializing our founder, Steve Cannon’s life and legacy.

story:
My Dream 

Imagine that you had a dream and that dream was to turn your thought into a published novel and that novel into a TV series. Imagine that there were people out there who would love to help that dream come true because they would become part of that dream.

That's my dream. 

Help me finish my book project by investing a small amount into my project. You will become a VIP member of my book club and receive special rewards such as free physical copies of my novel, special mentions, advertising rights and more.

 I have written a science fiction novel that I believe can be a best seller and be turned into a TV series. Not a movie. A TV series. I believe that this can come true because I have the passion a writer needs and the guts to dream.

Please help my main characters come to life in book 1 and make it to book 2.

I have written 31 chapters in rough draft form and have self edited 3 chapters which I have released on www.bouncepen.com .

Here is a link to my 3 chapters

https://www.bouncepen.com/book-editor-pdf/?book...

How can you help?

Please read my chapters and leave comments at the bottom of the page.

I want your feedback.

I want to know what you think will happen in the next chapters and beyond. I want you to guess.

To do this you can also participate in my forum topics which I will post on Bouncepen.com

Please go to the following links and read my chapters:

Graphic Art for the Novel

As mentioned in the recent update.

As part of my project I would like to incorporate art into my novel and turn it into a graphic novel. 

Also I would use to this create a storyboard that will work towards the goal of turning it into a TV series.

Each character is unique and therefore needs an original drawing.

For this, I will have to employ artists to create the art for my novel.

Please open the following links to read my chapters separately or go to the end for a link to all 3 chapters :

Blurb for The Room (chapter 1)

Two children grow up in a room and only have a voice from the walls and devices to guide them. This voice is their father and companion. As they grow one becomes more curious about their existence and yearns to explore. What they don't know may or may not set them free.

Blurb for The Waste Disposal (chapter 2)

An era of wasteful consumption has come to an end and now it is time for a clean-up mission that will change the world. Off in the distance behind the centuries old mountains of waste a government meeting takes to discuss concerns over the government's handling of its projects.

Blurb for Slab City (chapter 3)

Welcome to Slab City, a horrid beach of cement slabs where the helpless wait out their dying days. A special government project utilises these poor souls into action to create a new complex for the world. Two government officials walk amongst lethargic ‘slabbers’ and demonstrates the effects of a life energising elixir. Decisions have to made as to the running of the project and heads have to roll.

Outcomes of your Donations

What will you gain for supporting me?

We will basically become partners in promotion and build a community together.

You will gain my support by promoting your name and projects on a personal website.

I will support your book projects and TV projects.

You will gain VIP membership and receive free copies and other benefits.

The Goal?

Gain enough funds to pay for proof readers, editors, physical book production, filmmakers, set equipment, and money for advertisement.

The End

Help these stories come to life in novel and TV form.

Become a part of the journey and help build a community and team of innovators in the sci-fi world.

Here is a link to full 3 chapters all together as one book:

https://www.bouncepen.com/book-editor-pdf/?book...

story:
Why Fund this Book?

1.  It is about you:  This book concerns you, personally.  Just ask yourself whether you have any formal education on how to go about doing your savings or growing your personal income.  If your answer is "yes" then you are one of the few exceptions but if your answer is “no” then your perception and practice of how you go about your savings and growing your income is NOT based on a professional knowledge obtained in school but on common sense and assumption, raising questions about the effectiveness of the knowledge itself.  Could that be the reason why you probably find saving money (or growing your income) a battle you rarely win and often  ends up in a personal-income-stagnation or financial failure?  It is this challenge that the book addresses, demonstrating how your wrong perception/practice in personal finance create barriers that cripple your ability to grow your income into a financial success story.  The book is also about overcoming the personal-income-stagnation particularly common among most people in employment, about the "design flaws" in our perception of the subject (responsible for most of our financial failures), and about creating the "environment" which makes growing personal income into a financial success story achievable.

2. It is about your community:  According to a recent study by Standard & Poor, only 33% of the world's adult population is financially literate (results similar to the findings of the research work on which the book is based).  The book promotes public awareness about the massive ignorance that overshadows the subject of Personal Financial Security and about the major cause of the financial failures most people experience, in their quest to grow their income into a financial success story.  It suggests solutions and alternatives that can make savings and growing personal income achievable by the vast majority of people.  In addition, it presents the suggestion that policy-makers consider introducing key aspects of Personal Finance as a compulsory subject of study in public schools (to foster values of savings and personal financial security) in order to help guard against a general sliding into the poverty circle by individuals dropping out of the education mainstream.

3. It is about charity:  The book is meant to be used for presentation of fund-raising seminars to raise money for supporting orphans & vulnerable children (OVC) programs, operated by I-CCO.  In addition, part of the proceeds from the sales of this book will be donated to the OVC support programs.  See www.i-cco.org.uk  

                                         I-CCO – a commitment to holistic orphan-care support

 

Why Self-Publish The Book?

I prefer to self-publish the book because its contents are a culmination of many years of research, personal experience, and experimentation.  I am not prepared to surrender all that valuable information to a publisher because I want to control the information so that I keep improving on it, through subsequent research work.

Background

Have you ever wondered why saving money or growing personal income into a personal financial success story is so difficult for the vast majority of people in the world today?  There may be various reasons that may explain the failure but studies done on this subject highlight “ignorance” as the primary cause of problem.  Just ask yourself whether you have any formal education on savings or growing your personal income.  If your answer is “yes” then you are one of the few exceptions, but if your answer is “no” then your perception/practice of how you go about your savings and growing your income is not based on a professional knowledge obtained in school but on common sense and assumption, raising questions about the accuracy and effectiveness of the knowledge itself.  Similarly, if you ask ten people to define Personal Financial Security the chances are that you will get ten different definitions or even none at all.   That just indicates how much this important subject is scarcely understood!  Is it any wonder then that the vast majority of the people in the world today end up trapped in personal financial ruin, personal-income stagnation, or even poverty? 

My work in orphan-care not only includes helping to provide holistic support to needy orphaned children but also to help to foster micro-enterprises and orphan-related poverty alleviation initiatives.  It was the experiences in these activities, over the years, that sparked the observation that the common perception people have on savings/growing personal income and the methodologies they apply are not based on a professional financial knowledge obtained in school but on common sense and assumption, thus, resulting in the massive personal financial failures and (partly) the poverty we see in the world today.  This observation, and other factors, prompted me to undertake a study on the subject and the results, inadvertently, led to the writing of the book I now want to publish. 

About The Author

                                                         

                                                   Charles C. Chilemu, Author

The author is a micro-savings/orphan-care activist, working for the orphan-care organisation,  In-Community Care for Orphans (I-CCO) Zambia, as Chief of Party.

Will This Book Really Succeed?

Surveys conducted on this subject indicate that the term "Personal Financial Security," which the book is largely all about, just doesn’t attract most people’s curiosity nor sufficiently draw their attention, and yet the subject represents the very financial progressiveness in life which the vast majority of people crave for.  This is the major weakness a book on this topic carries with it, but this is like the question of the honey and the honeycombs.  The honeycombs don’t appeal much to anyone’s appetite yet inside it lies the sweetest of all syrups.  So my strategy is to “get the honeycombs out of the way, and get people to taste the honey.”  Besides, the book addresses and seeks to meet a human need; a common need which almost every person strives for -- a formidable personal financial security.  On that score, yes, the book will be a success – it will be self-advertising once “tasted” by the market.  

 

                             I-CCO – a commitment to giving them “a future and a hope”

Book Costs - Where Will The Money Go?

When I started writing the book I had no idea that self-publishing can be a costly venture until I begun looking around for publishers.  However, I opted to settle for the average publishing cost good enough to ensure quality print and efficient distribution.  Here is an approximate breakdown of where the money will go:

   Perk Fulfilment: $2,310

   Publishing Costs : $2,419 (includes cover design, interior layout, formatting, digital conversion, reviews, and marketing/distribution).

Other Ways You Can Help

Another way you can help, dear friends, is by getting the word out about this campaign through social media or simply by talking to your friends about it.  It will be helpful to use the Indiegogo share tools when sharing information about this campaign.

story:
Hello and thank you for visiting my campaign.

I’ve been working on this book for 2 years now

And it’s almost finished and now I feel is the time

To get some investors on board.

I have a part of the budget ready it’s just that

This way the book would be published faster.

 

And as you know it all goes into producing,

Publishing and distributing the book.

 

It’s based on a true story

of a soul that pushed through life

 in spite of the ruthless curse

that chased her to the last breath.

 

I tell everyone that it’s a book that will make you cry, laugh and cry again.

 

Have a look in the description.

I shared one chapter to get a taste of it.

Heres’s the set up:

Her life was getting better and now she was married with a lovely man, they settled in a nice apartment and just brought home their new born. Things just turned the right way and they were enjoying their two sons.

 

 

Thank you for willing to support this novel.

Please check the packages and get the one you’re more comfortable with.

I would love to have you on board on this journey and maybe future ones.

 

Read the chapter!

 

 

 

Double trouble

 

"Daddy, daddy, wake up!"

The little boy was so excited that you'd swear he has rocket boots. He was jumping around the bed trying to get the man to come back to life and enjoy every second of it. He pulled the curtain open to let the sunshine flood the room and right on the man's face.

"Daddy! Come on! It's morning! Look how beautiful it is! Let's play!"

The man barely opened his eyes. The light was blinding him. In spite of the perpetual tired feeling he had, he managed to pull the covers up

"Hop in"

The boy jumped in and under cuddling to his father. The man hugged him and left the covers to land over their heads.  They were still. He felt that now they can go back to sleep. But the feeling vanished in a split of a second when the little one just jolt and started to move around looking for a playful time. Knowing that he will not be able to snooze, the man went in play mode and start tickling the boy. He filled the room with sharp and loud laughter. Right in the same moment they heard from the other room the cry of a baby.

"Oh. You woke him up..."

"Sorry daddy. You tickled me"

"Yes, you're right. It's my fault. I should've thought that mom is sleeping in the other room with the little one. Can you believe you have a brother? How should we name him? I know we'll have to ask mom, but how would you like to call you brother?"

"Hmmm... Daniel?"

"That sound good, my little thinker."

"Who named me? Otty...?"

"Mom did. Your name is Attila, but we like to call you Otty because is cute and it fits you just now."

"Ohh..."

"Hey boys... thank you for the wakeup call. I could've used another hour of sleep. This little one woke me up almost every hour last night."

"Mommy!!!" the boy ran to her and hugged her thighs.

The woman was holding the newborn in her arms, but she lowered her hand to grab Otty and caress his hair.

"Good morning, sweetie. Did you have a good night? Good dreams?"

"Yes mommy, I dreamed that me and him went up and flew over the clouds and we were able to see the entire world from there."

"Wow, my little pilot. How about daddy flies you to the kitchen and makes a coffee. I will go fuel this little airplane." and she switched the little one from a hold to a floating position and started to move towards the bedroom while humming an engine sound. The little one giggled.

Dad went on her lead and picked up Otty, lay him flat on his hands and flu him into the kitchen. They still don't know who came up with the flying game, but it looks like it was the family tradition. When they got to the kitchen, dad started to alternate the engine buzz with an alarm sound.

"Mayday, mayday. We're losing power. Prepare for emergency landing. Landing gear down. Lower the landing gear". The boy bent his legs.

"Hit the brakes and cut the engine. That looks like a good spot to land with minimum casualties. Prepare for impact!" and he sat him on the counter. They both laugh because of the while imagination that was making their time together so much fun.

"Now I need to save some lives"

"Oh. Is anyone in danger?"

"Yes, us. Mommy needs coffee. If we're not providing the essential fuel, we might lose our lives at the wrath of the morning monster."

The boy smiled and opened a cabinet pulling the sugar out. He knew the drill and he knew that as much as they were playing and joking... it was a seed of truth in that.

The man grabbed the pot, poor the water, turned on the gas and put it on the stove like a well-practiced lifesaving maneuver. It was in the making and their lives were about to be spared. Another successful mission.

"Honey! The coffee is ready. Do you want me to bring it to you or you want it in the kitchen?"

 

"Just leave it there, honey. I am still taking care of this little one. It's been four days since we brought him home and he didn't let me be a second. He's hungry all the time." she said from the bedroom and turned to the little sucker with a sweet tone "who gonna be a big strong boy? who's gonna take mommy on dates and bring home a nice girl to be his wife? who's gonna give mommy some nice grandchildren? Who? You tell me you little cutie."

The man conformed and left the coffee on the counter. She took a whiff and felt the aroma all the way from the bedroom. It was such a good feel flowing in the home. The morning was perfect. She was feeding the little one in the bedroom, her husband that she loves so much was playing with their first born in the living room, it was a nice sunny day, the spring was on its way finally after the long gloomy winter, the air was fresh, the little one was home, everything was just great. All this made her close her eyes and let a big smile flourish with joy. The sun was warming up her face. It was such a good feeling.

"Mommy.." Otty appeared in the door frame.

"Yes sweetie" the woman barely mumbled trying to come back from her dreamy stance.

"Daniel"

"Who?"

"Daniel. This is how we should call him" the boy said entering the room and coming closer to the bed to see his brother's face.

"Oh. You mean to name him Daniel? That's a nice name. Hmmm... Sounds like a good idea. We'll need to ask daddy to see if he wants too."

"Daddy said yes!" the boy replied enthusiastic while the man showed up in the frame. She looked at him with wondering eyes and he nodded.

"Then Daniel it is! Welcome home Daniel!" she said with no fear that the baby will wake up. She knew he's sound asleep. He usually does after a good meal.

"Otty, go in the living room and find some nice cartoons on TV. I have to do something and I'll come to sit with you. Honey, I'll let you have a nap if you need one. We'll be quiet for a while."

"Thank you sweetie. You're the best husband ever. No wonder I chased you down like a lamb at Easter time. Ok. I think this time I will just snuggle with... Daniel. You know what? I like it. It sounds good. Otty's a smart kid and he has a big heart. I love that boy. What a blessing. Ok. I will just lay back here with him."

"No problem. That's why I am here and that's why... I let you chase me. I wanted you to catch me."

"You're funny... “the woman said with a whisper that almost dissipated in the air before it reached him.

He got closer, caressed her and kissed her forehead.

"Sweet dreams. I'll go take care of some business. Make you a little surprise. You know... for my girl." He straighten up, took a moment to take in the beautiful picture of mother and baby, tilted his head with an emotional smile and slowly backed out of the room.

"Ok Otty. Watch these cartoons until I come back."

"Where are you going daddy? You're going to work?"

"No. It's Saturday. It's week-end. Why do you think we had time to play the morning? You know usually you don't see me in the morning because I am at work long before you're even waking up. No. I just need to prepare a little surprise for mommy when she wakes up. You know, it's nice to do nice things for the ones you love..."

"And you love mommy! Yey!"

The man made the boy a sign to tone it down so the other half of the family can get some well-deserved rest.

"I will not be long. Watch the cartoons."

He shuffled the boy’s hair and left the room smiling. Yes, it felt so good to be with his family, with his lovely wife that he's adoring from the first moment he saw her, with his son that is growing up and, at just two years old, he's so loving and smart and cares so much of the world and his family, with his newborn that just came home a couple of days ago and made his family a whole. His smile was an involuntary one, a smile that was stubborn to stay on his face  for a long time. That's the smile that he was wishing that everyone would experience and keep it for as long as they live.

Ho opened the door to the garage and head to the car, popped the trunk and pulled out a plastic garbage bag. It didn't look too heavy but it was pretty bulky. He brought the bag in and head to the laundry room, opened the washing machine and poured the contents in it, switched the dial of the machine, poured some detergent and CLOROX and got it going. The feel good smile slightly morphed in a satisfaction one knowing that she will be pleased with what he just did.

"Hey Otty, I'll make some breakfast. What do you want to eat?" he asked once he got in the living room. He knew already he made a mistake asking a toddler what he wants to eat for breakfast. He almost lip synced what the boy said: “peanut butter and jelly sandwich with milk".

"Can we eat here, daddy?" the boy added quickly to be sure his daddy heard him and that he will agree on bringing the breakfast in front of the TV.

"You know what? It's Saturday. For sure! We need to feel like week-end"

"Yeeeeeeeeeeeeeey!" the boy whispered pretending to be loud from his body language.

The man's smile morphed again, but this time in an amused one. He always wondered where he is coming up with all these behaviors and ideas. He was proud of his son. He always wanted boys and God gave him two now. Yes, he had double trouble...

 

*

 

"Ok. Here it is. Peanut butter and jelly sandwiches for the royal pilots. After such a rough landing I think we are entitled to treat ourselves from the royal kitchen with the best chef's specialty."

"You forgot the milk daddy" the boy said laughing at his dad's silliness.

"Oh, my dear commander, you're right. I will go fetch it right now. But before I go, may I ask how you would like your milk? In a cup or in a bottle?"

"Daddy, you're funny" the boy said and slipped into the character "Please bring me a cup, Sir! I am not a baby anymore. I am a royal commander air-force pilot and I deserved to be treated like a man!"

The boy's reply made the man burst in a suppressed laughter. He was trying to keep quiet, but the boy was way too funny. He loves him so much. He wished his father would've been that goofy with him when he was a kid, but it didn't happen. Now he seized the opportunity and he made the best of it and it paid off. These moments are priceless.

 

*

 

She opened her eyes slowly like being afraid that the air moved by her eyelashes will wake the little one. Such a cozy feeling. The coffee smell was still lingering around the home and she wanted one so badly. Daniel was still sleeping. Quiet. Peaceful. Just seeing his face brought her a smile. She couldn't believe that her life turned around so good and in such a good direction. Here she was lying down with her precious newborn, in the living room was the man that rescued her, her knight with shiny helmet because he didn't have an armor at the time, with her first born which, in her eyes, was a genius. What more could she ask from life? Oh. Coffee. Right.

 

*

"Hey, I'll go check on the laundry. I'll be right back"

"Ok daddy." the boy barely mumbled chewing on the peanut butter sandwich.

While Otty was absorbed by the funny cartoons that they were watching, Attila went in the laundry to check on the load. Opened the washing machine. Everything was looking good and white. He put a little more Clorox to make sure they will be bright when she sees them.

 

*

His face was so peaceful. His eyes were closed but his eyelashes were so fragile, so delicate, his nose was so tiny and squishy, his lips were like sculpted by an artist. Here she was, falling in love again. For the third time. This time with Daniel, the little baby that was starting his life in such a loving family. She couldn't stop staring at him, at every details of his face, at every little hair on his tiny head, at the almost see trough tiny ears, at the little chicks that were budging every time when he would cry or smile. She's lucky. He did smile sometimes to her and not because he was gassy.

The peace in the room was so comforting. It’s the first time she felt like that since the birth. She really needed a break like this so she can regain herself and her mind, herself.

She would like to wake him up so she can get her well-deserved coffee, but she didn’t want to spoil the moment. It was too precious to be selfish. Now she was sharing this with him just how she will share her whole life with him. She is his mother until her last breath.

He was lying there so still and so peaceful, so quiet and so calm.

She couldn’t help herself and she needed to caress him. Her finger gently touched his hair and sled down on his temple, down on his ear and on his chick. He was sleeping. She was hoping to not wake him up. Because he didn’t react to her touch, she felt accomplished. She was able to love him without disturbing him. And again she got lost in staring at his little being lying there resting: his eyes, his nose, his mouth… so cute and fragile, his little body cuddled up under the thing blanket. Not a sound, not a move. Not a move?

She pulled her head back to be able to have a full view of him, touched his forehead, sled her fingers on his chick. Nothing. She didn’t want to freak out. It might just be an illusion. She softly pinched his ear… Nothing. She let a desperate scream out of her lungs which, like a thunder, filled and shook the house in a split second.

“What?” the husband appeared in the door with big eyes and his heart pumping.

“The baby!” the woman barely made sense of her mumbling

“What?!” he came closer while she got the little one in her arms. He wasn’t responsive.

“I think he’s dead” she cried and looking around with desperation tried to find ways to cater to the newborn.

“No. It can’t be.”

The man approached to look closer and see how he can help. Both of them were panicked. Otty showed up and joined the emotional whirlpool not understanding exactly what’s happening, but being influenced by the cry that flood the house.

Her tears we’re blurring her vision. She was lost. She took Daniel and snuggled him in close to her heart to keep him comfortable. Maybe he can hear her heart beating and that will get him to know that mommy is there for him. Attila picked up the phone and called the Emergency. Otty was crying holding to his leg. While he was waiting for an answer, the man picked him up and held him in his arms. The toddler was crying on his shoulder and hugging him strong with his little arms. The operator picked up.

 

"911, what is your emergency?"

"Quick! My newborn is not moving. We need an ambulance fast!"

"Sir, did you check for pulse?"

"I don't know how. It's a newborn. He's small. Where do I do that?"

"Sir, did you listen for a heartbeat?"

"No..." turning to her "can you please listen for a beat?"

She was holding the little one as cozy as a mother can hold her precious baby and she was afraid to disturb him. She went to the bed, lay him there and put her ear close to his chest. She was hoping. Even that the tiny chest wasn't really moving, she was hoping to hear something. Nothing. Her cry intensified and looked around not knowing what to do. Even that she was a strong women, this was a blow that she couldn't take. Right now she wished she was six feet underground or never born. The pain was tearing every cell of her body and it came out in a yell that wished to crush the injustice.

He was standing there with the phone to the ear and his son in his arms. He was speechless. The hope left him and now he was realizing that the one that they just brought from the hospital a couple of days ago, was gone, that their new addition to the family wasn't anymore, that the little sparkle of joy that brought her laughter and hope, died.

"Sir?... Sir? Are you still there?"

The man grabbed his son stronger in his arms trying to calm him down. Even that he didn't really knew what's happening, Otty was feeling the atmosphere in the room, he was picking up from his mother and he was bulging.

"Sir?!? I need you to talk to me."

"Yes..." he answered in between the desperate voices that were letting out the anger, the anxiety, the sorrow and the forsaken feelings all combined in a mash of rage.

"I am here... Please send an ambulance. I think it's too late..."

He put down the phone and, trying to keep strong in front of his family, held his tears and went to his wife to comfort her. When he got closer and watched the little one lying on the bed, knowing the he's gone, he just burst in a man cry. He loved his family and as much as he tried to be strong for them in those moment he couldn't hold back his feelings. Fell on his knees beside his wife, put his arm around her and leaned over the little baby. They were all crying. The air was filled with hurt.

A strong and rushed knock on the door threw him out of the morning stance. The loud bangs were covering the cries. He left Otty by his mom and went to open.

"Hello Sir. We received an emergency call from you. Where is the baby?"

"This way" he rushed to show them to the bedroom.

"Ma'am, please step back. We need to assess the baby".

The paramedic started the procedure while the family was watching helplessly.

"Can I please ask to go in the living room? I need some space and get to some procedures that don't look too good from outside. Thank you"

They got out of the room and head to the living room. Their faces were red and hot. The mixture of feelings was so confusing that they felt drained.

The man kept working around the baby trying to find ways to find out if he's really gone or he can do something to bring him back, to wake him up. He didn't get a pulse or a heartbeat, a breath, or any vital sign so he moved to CPR.

"Come on, you little one, help me out here. I can't do it myself. I need your will to live. You have a full life in front of you. You need to live it. Don't just go out" the man was thinking while he was continuing the procedure.

The family was trying to calm down in the living room. The other paramedic was trying to help with some cold compresses for their foreheads and with some water to, at least, take their toughs away from the worst case scenario.

Finally the officer came out of the bedroom.

"I am really sorry... He's gone"

Elena burst again in a wild cry and fell on the floor crawling in the fetus position. Her husband grabbed the toddler and sled down by her trying to comfort her.

"Sir? What's this smell?"

"What smell?" the men answered wiping his tears.

"This is ammonia. Sir! This is ammonia! Open all the windows! Now!" the paramedic jumped over a couch right to the main window of the room and opened it wide after that ran to the entrance and opened the door. In the meantime Attila went in the back and opened the other door and every window he found in his path.

"Why does it smell like ammonia in the house? What were you doing?" meeting in the hallway.

"I think it smells like chlorine too" the other paramedic yelled from the other room.

" I don't know... I didn't know it smells like ammonia. I work with it at the factory and I don't smell it anymore."

"Quick, we need to assess the toddler"

"Otty? Otty!"

Both men rushed in the living room and their worst fear was in front of them: the boy was lying on the floor hardly breathing.

"Otty!" the father yelled and kneel by him.

The scream brought back from the mourning trance the mom which froze with her eyes on what was happening a couple of feet away from her.

"Nooooo!" the mom let out an angry yell.

The second paramedic just came from the bedroom after he took care of the baby and embraced her to restrain and comfort her.

The two men were down on the floor and trying to not panic.

"Hey buddy, what's your name?" the paramedic asked.

"Otty..." the father answered whispering.

"I asked him. Please..."

"Oh. I am sorry."

"So, what's your name?"

"Otty..." the boy answered with a fainted voice.

"And how old are you?" the man asked while he was caring on taking everything that would restrain the boys breathing off.

"Two..." the boy let the word out not moving his lips.

Elena calmed down for a second and when she felt that the paramedic's grip relaxed, she jumped and joined the men on the floor.

"Otty, come on, baby, don't do this. Stay with mommy. Please baby. Stay with mommy." She was trying to be strong for him. She wiped her tears and showed her face with a forced smile so the boy can grab on the hope and stay lucid.

"Ma'am..." the paramedic looked at her, but the look he got back showed him that she's determined to be there and face the situation.

"My little pilot... we'll buy you a real plane so you can fly high in the sky just as you dreamed." She was trying to encourage him to stay with them, to think of beautiful things and to not let the situation conquer him.

"Mommy... I'm flying..." the boy smiled.

"What? What did you say, sweetie?" the woman tried to make him speak louder while the paramedic was running a quick PH test on his saliva.

"I'm flyin'..." the boy let the whisper out with a last breath.

Even that she was exhausted, she let a scream out that made everyone cringe. Her face darkens and her veins were bursting through her skin.

"No! No no no no no! Otty! Not you too! Aaaaaaaaah! No! This is not happening! This is not happening!"

The paramedic put his ear on the boy's chest while he grabbed his wrist to check for pulse. No vital signs. Even he couldn't believe the situation. When he started his shift he was prepared for everything but not for this.

Attila cringed his teeth and tilted his head trying to not do the same thing like his wife. Muffled, he let out a grown like a lion in pain. He got up and went to his wife, got her in his arms and held her tight. Their family was gone. Now they were just two of them. They were crying in each other’s arms while the paramedics were caring the little ones to the ambulance. She barred her face in his chest looking for comfort, but in these moments nothing and no one could comfort her. His shirt was soaked in her tears. He was caressing her hair and holding her tight, leaning his forehead on her head.

"Sir, I am sorry" the lead paramedic approached them wiping his tears. Even that he was trained to deal with any situations, this touched him deeply. "You will need to come with us at the hospital for paperwork and wait for the authorities to take a deposition at their office"

He lifts his head up and nodded while his eyes stopped on the washing machine. The thought that settled that moment in his mind made him cringe. His face was petrified.
story_txt: Hello and thank you for visiting my campaign.I’ve been working on this book for 2 years nowAnd it’s almost finished and now I feel is the timeTo get some investors on board.I have a part of the budget ready it’s just thatThis way the book would be published faster. And as you know it all goes into producing,Publishing and distributing the book. It’s based on a true story of a soul that pushed through life in spite of the ruthless curse that chased her to the last breath. I tell everyone that it’s a book that will make you cry, laugh and cry again. Have a look in the description.I shared one chapter to get a taste of it.Heres’s the set up:Her life was getting better and now she was married with a lovely man, they settled in a nice apartment and just brought home their new born. Things just turned the right way and they were enjoying their two sons.  Thank you for willing to support this novel.Please check the packages and get the one you’re more comfortable with.I would love to have you on board on this journey and maybe future ones. Read the chapter!   Double trouble "Daddy, daddy, wake up!"The little boy was so excited that you'd swear he has rocket boots. He was jumping around the bed trying to get the man to come back to life and enjoy every second of it. He pulled the curtain open to let the sunshine flood the room and right on the man's face."Daddy! Come on! It's morning! Look how beautiful it is! Let's play!"The man barely opened his eyes. The light was blinding him. In spite of the perpetual tired feeling he had, he managed to pull the covers up"Hop in"The boy jumped in and under cuddling to his father. The man hugged him and left the covers to land over their heads.  They were still. He felt that now they can go back to sleep. But the feeling vanished in a split of a second when the little one just jolt and started to move around looking for a playful time. Knowing that he will not be able to snooze, the man went in play mode and start tickling the boy. He filled the room with sharp and loud laughter. Right in the same moment they heard from the other room the cry of a baby."Oh. You woke him up...""Sorry daddy. You tickled me""Yes, you're right. It's my fault. I should've thought that mom is sleeping in the other room with the little one. Can you believe you have a brother? How should we name him? I know we'll have to ask mom, but how would you like to call you brother?""Hmmm... Daniel?""That sound good, my little thinker.""Who named me? Otty...?""Mom did. Your name is Attila, but we like to call you Otty because is cute and it fits you just now.""Ohh...""Hey boys... thank you for the wakeup call. I could've used another hour of sleep. This little one woke me up almost every hour last night.""Mommy!!!" the boy ran to her and hugged her thighs.The woman was holding the newborn in her arms, but she lowered her hand to grab Otty and caress his hair."Good morning, sweetie. Did you have a good night? Good dreams?""Yes mommy, I dreamed that me and him went up and flew over the clouds and we were able to see the entire world from there.""Wow, my little pilot. How about daddy flies you to the kitchen and makes a coffee. I will go fuel this little airplane." and she switched the little one from a hold to a floating position and started to move towards the bedroom while humming an engine sound. The little one giggled.Dad went on her lead and picked up Otty, lay him flat on his hands and flu him into the kitchen. They still don't know who came up with the flying game, but it looks like it was the family tradition. When they got to the kitchen, dad started to alternate the engine buzz with an alarm sound."Mayday, mayday. We're losing power. Prepare for emergency landing. Landing gear down. Lower the landing gear". The boy bent his legs."Hit the brakes and cut the engine. That looks like a good spot to land with minimum casualties. Prepare for impact!" and he sat him on the counter. They both laugh because of the while imagination that was making their time together so much fun."Now I need to save some lives""Oh. Is anyone in danger?""Yes, us. Mommy needs coffee. If we're not providing the essential fuel, we might lose our lives at the wrath of the morning monster."The boy smiled and opened a cabinet pulling the sugar out. He knew the drill and he knew that as much as they were playing and joking... it was a seed of truth in that.The man grabbed the pot, poor the water, turned on the gas and put it on the stove like a well-practiced lifesaving maneuver. It was in the making and their lives were about to be spared. Another successful mission."Honey! The coffee is ready. Do you want me to bring it to you or you want it in the kitchen?" "Just leave it there, honey. I am still taking care of this little one. It's been four days since we brought him home and he didn't let me be a second. He's hungry all the time." she said from the bedroom and turned to the little sucker with a sweet tone "who gonna be a big strong boy? who's gonna take mommy on dates and bring home a nice girl to be his wife? who's gonna give mommy some nice grandchildren? Who? You tell me you little cutie."The man conformed and left the coffee on the counter. She took a whiff and felt the aroma all the way from the bedroom. It was such a good feel flowing in the home. The morning was perfect. She was feeding the little one in the bedroom, her husband that she loves so much was playing with their first born in the living room, it was a nice sunny day, the spring was on its way finally after the long gloomy winter, the air was fresh, the little one was home, everything was just great. All this made her close her eyes and let a big smile flourish with joy. The sun was warming up her face. It was such a good feeling."Mommy.." Otty appeared in the door frame."Yes sweetie" the woman barely mumbled trying to come back from her dreamy stance."Daniel""Who?""Daniel. This is how we should call him" the boy said entering the room and coming closer to the bed to see his brother's face."Oh. You mean to name him Daniel? That's a nice name. Hmmm... Sounds like a good idea. We'll need to ask daddy to see if he wants too.""Daddy said yes!" the boy replied enthusiastic while the man showed up in the frame. She looked at him with wondering eyes and he nodded."Then Daniel it is! Welcome home Daniel!" she said with no fear that the baby will wake up. She knew he's sound asleep. He usually does after a good meal."Otty, go in the living room and find some nice cartoons on TV. I have to do something and I'll come to sit with you. Honey, I'll let you have a nap if you need one. We'll be quiet for a while.""Thank you sweetie. You're the best husband ever. No wonder I chased you down like a lamb at Easter time. Ok. I think this time I will just snuggle with... Daniel. You know what? I like it. It sounds good. Otty's a smart kid and he has a big heart. I love that boy. What a blessing. Ok. I will just lay back here with him.""No problem. That's why I am here and that's why... I let you chase me. I wanted you to catch me.""You're funny... “the woman said with a whisper that almost dissipated in the air before it reached him.He got closer, caressed her and kissed her forehead."Sweet dreams. I'll go take care of some business. Make you a little surprise. You know... for my girl." He straighten up, took a moment to take in the beautiful picture of mother and baby, tilted his head with an emotional smile and slowly backed out of the room."Ok Otty. Watch these cartoons until I come back.""Where are you going daddy? You're going to work?""No. It's Saturday. It's week-end. Why do you think we had time to play the morning? You know usually you don't see me in the morning because I am at work long before you're even waking up. No. I just need to prepare a little surprise for mommy when she wakes up. You know, it's nice to do nice things for the ones you love...""And you love mommy! Yey!"The man made the boy a sign to tone it down so the other half of the family can get some well-deserved rest."I will not be long. Watch the cartoons."He shuffled the boy’s hair and left the room smiling. Yes, it felt so good to be with his family, with his lovely wife that he's adoring from the first moment he saw her, with his son that is growing up and, at just two years old, he's so loving and smart and cares so much of the world and his family, with his newborn that just came home a couple of days ago and made his family a whole. His smile was an involuntary one, a smile that was stubborn to stay on his face  for a long time. That's the smile that he was wishing that everyone would experience and keep it for as long as they live.Ho opened the door to the garage and head to the car, popped the trunk and pulled out a plastic garbage bag. It didn't look too heavy but it was pretty bulky. He brought the bag in and head to the laundry room, opened the washing machine and poured the contents in it, switched the dial of the machine, poured some detergent and CLOROX and got it going. The feel good smile slightly morphed in a satisfaction one knowing that she will be pleased with what he just did."Hey Otty, I'll make some breakfast. What do you want to eat?" he asked once he got in the living room. He knew already he made a mistake asking a toddler what he wants to eat for breakfast. He almost lip synced what the boy said: “peanut butter and jelly sandwich with milk"."Can we eat here, daddy?" the boy added quickly to be sure his daddy heard him and that he will agree on bringing the breakfast in front of the TV."You know what? It's Saturday. For sure! We need to feel like week-end""Yeeeeeeeeeeeeeey!" the boy whispered pretending to be loud from his body language.The man's smile morphed again, but this time in an amused one. He always wondered where he is coming up with all these behaviors and ideas. He was proud of his son. He always wanted boys and God gave him two now. Yes, he had double trouble... * "Ok. Here it is. Peanut butter and jelly sandwiches for the royal pilots. After such a rough landing I think we are entitled to treat ourselves from the royal kitchen with the best chef's specialty.""You forgot the milk daddy" the boy said laughing at his dad's silliness."Oh, my dear commander, you're right. I will go fetch it right now. But before I go, may I ask how you would like your milk? In a cup or in a bottle?""Daddy, you're funny" the boy said and slipped into the character "Please bring me a cup, Sir! I am not a baby anymore. I am a royal commander air-force pilot and I deserved to be treated like a man!"The boy's reply made the man burst in a suppressed laughter. He was trying to keep quiet, but the boy was way too funny. He loves him so much. He wished his father would've been that goofy with him when he was a kid, but it didn't happen. Now he seized the opportunity and he made the best of it and it paid off.
