Otty!"Both men rushed in the living room and their worst fear was in front of them: the boy was lying on the floor hardly breathing."Otty!" the father yelled and kneel by him.The scream brought back from the mourning trance the mom which froze with her eyes on what was happening a couple of feet away from her."Nooooo!" the mom let out an angry yell.The second paramedic just came from the bedroom after he took care of the baby and embraced her to restrain and comfort her.The two men were down on the floor and trying to not panic."Hey buddy, what's your name?" the paramedic asked."Otty..." the father answered whispering."I asked him. Please...""Oh. I am sorry.""So, what's your name?""Otty..." the boy answered with a fainted voice."And how old are you?" the man asked while he was caring on taking everything that would restrain the boys breathing off."Two..." the boy let the word out not moving his lips.Elena calmed down for a second and when she felt that the paramedic's grip relaxed, she jumped and joined the men on the floor."Otty, come on, baby, don't do this. Stay with mommy. Please baby. Stay with mommy." She was trying to be strong for him. She wiped her tears and showed her face with a forced smile so the boy can grab on the hope and stay lucid."Ma'am..." the paramedic looked at her, but the look he got back showed him that she's determined to be there and face the situation."My little pilot... we'll buy you a real plane so you can fly high in the sky just as you dreamed." She was trying to encourage him to stay with them, to think of beautiful things and to not let the situation conquer him."Mommy... I'm flying..." the boy smiled."What? What did you say, sweetie?" the woman tried to make him speak louder while the paramedic was running a quick PH test on his saliva."I'm flyin'..." the boy let the whisper out with a last breath.Even that she was exhausted, she let a scream out that made everyone cringe. Her face darkens and her veins were bursting through her skin."No! No no no no no! Otty! Not you too! Aaaaaaaaah! No! This is not happening! This is not happening!"The paramedic put his ear on the boy's chest while he grabbed his wrist to check for pulse. No vital signs. Even he couldn't believe the situation. When he started his shift he was prepared for everything but not for this.Attila cringed his teeth and tilted his head trying to not do the same thing like his wife. Muffled, he let out a grown like a lion in pain. He got up and went to his wife, got her in his arms and held her tight. Their family was gone. Now they were just two of them. They were crying in each other’s arms while the paramedics were caring the little ones to the ambulance. She barred her face in his chest looking for comfort, but in these moments nothing and no one could comfort her. His shirt was soaked in her tears. He was caressing her hair and holding her tight, leaning his forehead on her head."Sir, I am sorry" the lead paramedic approached them wiping his tears. Even that he was trained to deal with any situations, this touched him deeply. "You will need to come with us at the hospital for paperwork and wait for the authorities to take a deposition at their office"He lifts his head up and nodded while his eyes stopped on the washing machine. The thought that settled that moment in his mind made him cringe. His face was petrified.

story:
BE A PART OF THE LEGEND

By supporting this project and placing an order, you can be a part of the legend!  You can help us reach our goal to have this legend be enchantingly represented in a keepsake hardcover rhyming children's book for all to read and enjoy. If you love myths, mermaids, books that spark the imagination, and empowering children, you'll love this project.

We envision this book to be on children's bookshelves, in libraries, and in classrooms everywhere!  The stories of old are meant to be shared and treasured, imparting wonder to all who read them. 

In addition to producing this keepsake book, we are excited to support Variety’s Sirena Fest with donations received through our campaign. Named for the beloved bronze sculpture by Troy Kelley, Variety's Sirena Fest in Salado, Texas is currently working to raise funds for a much needed all-abilities playground for the children of Salado, Texas and those that visit the Village each year.

HOW TO ORDER

Ordering a book now through Indiegogo means you will receive Maiden Mermaid - The Tale of Sirena BEFORE everyone else. You'll also get extras that won't be available when the book is sold later online. You can also feel good about knowing YOU helped to produce this book!

There is an option to back this campaign in any amount without a perk by clicking on the hot pink BACK IT button in the upper right. You can also select a PERK to place an order,  and depending on which you choose, you may receive:

  • Hardcover Books: Each copy of Maiden Mermaid-The Tale of Sirena will be a high-quality approximately 32-page hardcover book signed by the author and sculptor.  Books will be distributed as soon as they are printed after the campaign ends.
  • Kindle E-book Access: Everyone who contributes will have the opportunity to download the Kindle e-book for free directly from Amazon on select dates. 
  • Activity Sheets: Printable PDF pages of a variety of activity sheets will be available to backers to use as needed.
  • Souvenir Stickers:  Keepsake stickers are from Maiden Mermaid's concept debut at Sirena Fest 2018.
  • Sirena Temporary Tattoos: Likened after Sirena's book character.
  • Momento 8x10 Signed Photograph: A beautiful color photograph of Sirena the Mermaid bronze sculpture from one of her locations in Salado, TX, suitable for framing.
  • Maiden Mermaid Bookmarks: Uniquely designed with art from the book.
  • Read Aloud by the Author: For Central Texas folks, the author will read to your gathering.
  • Gratitude for a donation to Variety's Sirena Fest: Be a part of bringing imaginative play and movement to children through an all-abilities playground planned in Salado, Texas.

Not all items available in all areas. No added shipping fees on most perks to the US and Canada.  If you need shipping outside of the US and Canada, please email sheri@amatterofrhyme.com, for a custom calculation. If you'd like an author/sculptor visit outside of the Central Texas area, please let us know, and we will see what we can do!

WE NEED YOU

Our goal is $9000. Your support and early order will allow us to:

  • Publish and print the first run of Maiden Mermaid - The Tale of Sirena books in high-quality hardcover binding. Approximate cost $6500
  • Pay for illustration, digital design, and marketing costs. Approximate cost $2000
  • Pay for marketing, distribution, and fulfillment. Approximate cost $500
  • Support  Variety’s Sirena Fest. Donations are based on the perks you select. The full amount of $5, $10, or $15 goes to Variety's Sirena Fest. We are absorbing all processing fees.

If we exceed our goal, our initial print run will be increased accordingly, making more books available for more people!

GET REWARDED TOO

When you contribute, you have the opportunity to join Indiegogo. Then you can share the campaign using the Indiegogo tools, with your very own special link.  you will receive a free copy of the book for every $100 of contributions made through your special link. How awesome is that? Read more about  Indiegogo tools and how they help you get free stuff!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

The more folks who are in the know,  the better the chance of reaching our goal! Hey, that rhymes!

  • Share, share, share this campaign through email, text or social media with everyone you know! There are easy tools on this site to help you share on social media by the pink BACK IT button near the top.
  • If you know a media outlet that would run a story on this campaign, please send us a message.
  • Contact us at scoop@amatterofrhyme.com if you have any ideas, or if you would like the author and sculptor to make a visit to your organization or classroom to talk about the campaign.

FROM THE AUTHOR

I loved the idea of writing the legend of Sirena the Mermaid in a rhyming children’s book, not only for the lyrical quality of rhyme, but because it is also so beneficial for children's cognitive development. I have included extra features like vocabulary words and discussion themes to help enrich the reading and bonding experience. I feel so honored telling Sirena's story in a new way.  - Sheri Wall

FROM THE ILLUSTRATOR

I've illustrated several of Sheri Wall's books and couldn't be more excited when she told me she wrote a book about a mermaid! Sheri turned this native American tale into a clever rhyme and I was honored to add the artwork to this project. The story has a lovely and mystic ambiance, which I wanted to portray in vibrant watercolor. - Ilona Stuijt

FROM THE SCULPTOR

One of my favorite sayings is "art begets art." Art's transformative power is accomplished through many forms, whether it be storytelling, sculpting, painting, or poetry.  This children’s book project truly exemplifies that saying. I'm thrilled to have Sirena's legend transformed in rhyme. Growing up in Texas, I would beg my Grandmother Kelley to tell me the story of Sirena over and over again. That story inspired me to create the life-size bronze sculpture of Sirena the Mermaid and place her in Salado Creek. I’m delighted folks are still excited to come see her. - Troy Kelley

RISK & CHALLENGES

As we have taken our time in preparing beautiful art, carefully editing text, and getting various printing quotes, we don't foresee many risks or challenges. However: 

  • Printing could be delayed due to circumstances beyond our control, although our goal is to begin printing as soon as the funds from the campaign are received.
  • Timely delivery of your book in July 2019 is our goal. If there's a delay, we will contact all supporters to keep you informed. 
  • There's always a level of uncertainty with any endeavor, somewhat like the outcome of Sirena's deal with a catfish.

story:
The Project

My daughter Emma and I are currently working on our second film together, KOANS, a video poetry short telling the story of my mother, Janet Gilmore's life long struggle with anorexia/bulimia. Our script is edited from her essay/journal on living with the disease. Weaved throughout is my mother’s short "mood" poetry that she used to express her state of being and yearning for health/peace.

I shared this poetry with Emma the Summer of 2017 when she was 15 and she surprised me by creating illustrations to poems that particularly spoke to her. Janet passed away at 70-years old when Emma was 6-months old. The poetry and illustrations have been a profound connection between a grandmother and granddaughter who only met once and inspired the film along with the aim of my mother and myself to support awareness of the impact of eating disorders and connect those suffering to support.

Step 1: Poetry Book & Audio Production

We are currently in production of an audio podcast/version of the book featuring an amazing group of readers who  graciously offered their voices to bring my mom’s story to life. Each of our talented voice actors have a personal connection to themes within Janet's writings and chose poems that have personal relevance adding to the emotion and sincerity to their interpretation and expression of Janet's words.

We invite you to partner in this important project and consider helping us finance recording studio time, license music and support publication costs of the poetry and illustrations. From those productions, we hope to obtain further funding to make the film a reality.

All profits beyond production costs for the book will be donated to The Diatribe, an incredible West Michigan organization using performing arts to empower young people to share their stories, raise awareness of social issues, and create change within their communities.

Thank you for following this project and we look forward to keeping you all updated of our progress! Brian & Emma

 

A Few of Koan's Voices

 

Anneliese Floyd

...is a family physician with North Sound Family Medicine in Bellingham, WA. She loves family medicine because it allows her to care for the whole person – and often their family members as well. She finds that the trusted relationship between physicians and patients sets family medicine apart from other specialties. She cares for people of all ages and walks of life, including caring for  several patients facing their own battles with eating disorders.  It is a continuous learning and growing experience, and especially because of these strong people, Anneliese has developed a drive and dedication to supporting individuals with eating disorders.

Anneliese also has a passion and talent for community theater and can be frequently seen on stage at local productions. She was immediately drawn to audition for the project because of her commitment to support health and recovery for individuals suffering from eating disorders.  After reading the audition script, she sensed the urgency and importance of this project as she strongly felt her patients voices within Janet's words. 

Anneliese at Alpenglow Sound Studios in Bellingham, WA giving voice to Janet's raw account of her six decade struggle with eating disorders. 

 

 

Rachel Gleason

...is a dynamic spoken word artist whose performance style is described as a balance between humor-an understated wit- and gospel/evangelical inspired charisma. Rachel’s poetry has been commissioned by both local and national organizations, published in Chicago magazine “Curbside Splendor” and has been featured on WYCE’s Electric Poetry several times. Raised in a strict fundamentalist church, much of her art stems from the intersection of faith and sexuality. Her coming out story was highlighted on NPR in a series about identity, acceptance, and forgiveness in West Michigan’s LGBT community. Rachel is also a singer/songwriter with a simplistic style and a unique, powerful voice. She performs stand up comedy and acts in sketches with Grand Rapids’ beloved all female comedy collective, Funny Girls, LLC.  She is also the Director of Education and co-founder at The Diatribe, a non-profit organization in Grand Rapids dedicated to uniting and inspiring the youth through spoken word poetry.

Rachel also provided amazing support and direction as Koans poetry coach for our Grand Rapids recordings at Mackinaw Harvest Studios last Fall.

Rachel (front) in the recording booth during Melissa's powerful readings of Janet's Poetry.

 

 

Marcel “Fable” Price

…is a Bi-racial North American writer, teaching artist, community advocate, motivational speaker, and executive director of non profit organization The Diatribe.

Fable is the 2016 recipient of a Community Advocate Award, a 2017 40 Under 40 Honoree, and is the currently holding the title of Poet Laureate.

He is the author of “Adrift in a Sea of M&M’s” (2016) and is currently working to finish his second collection of poems titled Metamorphosis; an extroverted caterpillars guide to becoming an introverted butterfly (2019).

Fable is the first person under the age of 40, and the first person of color to have earned the title of poet laureate of Grand Rapids Michigan; a three-year tenure with already measurable successes achieved within the first year. Fable is highly noted for his work with the youth through his non profit The Diatribe; using his own stories to consume the audience and is making a huge effort in lifting up youth across the country encouraging them to unpack their own struggles.

He is known across the nation for crowd-interactive features that leave those attending enlightened and empowered.

Fable's powerful readings at Mackinaw Harvest Studios, Grand Rapids, MI

 

Rachael Steil

...is an eating disorder in sports recovery advocate and the author of Running in Silence (Koehler Books, 2016). She is also the founder and speaker for the Running in Silence nonprofit to break misconceptions and raise awareness for eating disorders in sports, and serves on the board for the Michigan Eating Disorder Alliance (MiEDA). Rachael was 6th and 7th place NAIA All-American in cross country and track, and now coaches high school cross country. Her story has been featured in U.S. News and World Report, Fox17, WoodTV8, Women’s Running, and more.

Rachael speaks publicly about eating disorders to share her recovery story, create awareness, and bring hope to coaches and athletes.

Rachael was instrumental in reaching out and bringing an amazing group of West Michigan individuals to read Janet's poetry, all who in some way have a personal connection to the story.

Rachael not only brought her heartfelt voice to the project but reached out and connected a beautiful group of individuals who gave their hearts and voices to make this project a reality.

Shelley Irwin

...is the host and producer for The WGVU Morning Show, a newsmagazine talk-show format on the local NPR affiliate.  The show, broadcast from 9 a.m. to 11 a.m. features a wide variety of local and national newsmakers, plus special features. She also hosts several public affairs program on the TV side, including Family Health Matters and Kalamazoo Lively Arts. Shelley is award winning in her profession, including five consecutive Gracie Allen Awards from American Women in TV and Radio for excellence as a program host.  She was awarded the 2016 Athena Award  honoring an individual who has demonstrated leadership in their profession, mentored and opened new opportunities for women and contributed time and talent to the community. This year Shelley will receive the Rotary of Grand Rapids’ Service Above Self award, given in recognition of Frederik Meijer, whose humanitarian acts of selfless service made an enduring difference in the lives of others. Her community involvement extends from the Kent County Park Foundation to the  Michigan Women’s Foundation, Hope Network and the Cherry Health Foundation, among others. She has been twice nominated for a Michigan Emmy in Special Documentaries from the Society of Professional Journalists. She has been named one of the “50 Most Influential Women in West Michigan” twice by Gemini Publications, and has represented the U.S. in the Long Distance Triathlon and Duathlon World Championships.

So honored to have Shelley Irwin lend her voice to this project. Her advocacy and talent to tell important stories in our community has been a gift and we are thrilled to have her participation. Pictured here with director, Brian Gilmore (left) and sound engineer/Mackinaw Harvest Studio Owner, Michael Crittenden.

Bob Becker

Bob has over 25 years’ experience as an actor in theater in West Michigan performing most recently in Willy Wonka in the Jack Albertson’s role as Charley’s Grandpa Joe. Others include The Music Man, Brigadoon, Christmas Carol and It’s a Wonderful Life. Bob has over 56 years of radio experience in West Michigan. He is currently on the air with Real Oldies on WGVU. Other stations include Star 105.7, WODJ, WLAV, and WGRD. Bob has extensive voice over experience as well as performing on radio drama shows for the Children’s Bible Hour. Bob is delighted to be a part of this important production.

So thankful for Bob's amazing heartfelt voice! My mom and I listened to Bob's show on WGRD in the 1970's and she would be honored to know of his contribution. 

Veronica Kirin

...is a Forbes notable graduate of Grand Valley State University and a 40 Under 40 Business Leader.  An Anthropologist turned Serial Entrepreneur, her career has taken her from Disaster Relief through the Startup world.  She is founder of the award winning GreenCup Website Services, author of Stories Of Elders, Executive Producer on two films, and Entrepreneur Coach to Audacious Empire Builders who want to scale their businesses so they work less, grow faster, and earn more.  Her work as a coach was the first to be certified by the National LGBT Chamber of Commerce in her city and is known for her trademarked Self Care Through Scaling™ program.  She is also the founder of the Audacious Entrepreneur’s Sandbox, where Entrepreneurs can build community and get Coached in workshops and Live Q&As.

 

About The Author

Janet Gilmore was a lifelong resident of East Grand Rapids, MI. She was the daughter of Wilheimina Small and Dr. Carl Sigtenhorst. Janet was a talented artist who enjoyed painting and sculpting. She helped design and build three of her family’s homes in the 1960’s-1970’s. She attended the University of Michigan after graduating East Grand Rapids High School in 1950. She completed a B.S. in Environmental Studies at Aquinas College in 1976.

A loving free spirit, skier, swimmer, rock and roller, basset lover, MG car enthusiast, superb cook, rule breaker and so much more. She is missed but may her suffering and expression find purpose as a helping and healing voice.

About The Producers

Emma Gilmore lives with her family in Bellingham, WA. She has been creating art from the moment she picked up her first crayon. She began illustrating interpretations of her Grandmother’s poetry at age 15.

Emma is currently a high school junior with interests in pursuing a college education and possible career in Psychology. She loves to travel, paint, listen to music, play her violin and run.

Brian Gilmore attended Boston University as a graduate student in Film Production before pursuing a career in youth advocacy. He is an award winning filmmaker and school counselor. His first feature documentary, Dog Days Of Winter, tells the story of the birth and boom of the sport of freestyle skiing in America in the early 1970's. The film was an official selection worldwide in over 20 festivals and received the 2015 Film Award from the International Skiing History Association for outstanding creative contribution to skiing history.

 

What We Need

If we can raise $2500, we will have the necessary funds to self-publish 50 copies of Koans, license music for our audio production and pay for the studio time of the incredible voice talent that we have already recorded.

We are in a fantastic position to make this production a reality. Over 100 hours have been put into the production including: arranging the poetry and journal essay with Emma's poignant and heart-wrenching illustrations completed for each poem, all readings have been recorded, the music is selected and our first draft of the audio production is completed.

Immediate costs include: 

  • $1000 dollars to license music from Audio Network.
  • $500 to pay for our studio time (reduced fees from our engineers) to cover all readings and additional music.
  • $700 to Village Books for our ISDN and 50 copies of the book (plus additional support services).
  • $300 for digital images of artwork and additional misc. costs

The Impact

We feel the presentation of Janet's writings about her lifelong struggle with anorexia from the 1940's through her loss with this battle in 2002 represents an incredibly raw and sincere look at an individual's experience with an eating disorder. With what was originally an assignment from her therapist, she has left a gift of her expression, allowing a glimpse from the inside out into a lifetime battle with an eating disorder. It is Emma’s and my hope that by sharing these poems and illustrations, my mother’s expression may provide some insight, empathy and understanding for those suffering from an eating disorder.

Furthermore, by supporting our production costs, you help the project to move into an immediate profit generating opportunity with all proceeds from the book going to The Diatribe which is making incredible impacts with youth and young adults.

https://thediatribe.org

Risks & Challenges

It's happening! Your support is invaluable and we welcome you to be a part of this important project!!

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize not everyone can make a financial contribution. However, please help us spread the word out about this production. Sharing project links and encouraging support from your social network is invaluable to our efforts to bring this story to life and support health and recovery.

Thanks so much! Brian & Emma

Rachel’s poetry has been commissioned by both local and national organizations, published in Chicago magazine “Curbside Splendor” and has been featured on WYCE’s Electric Poetry several times. Raised in a strict fundamentalist church, much of her art stems from the intersection of faith and sexuality. Her coming out story was highlighted on NPR in a series about identity, acceptance, and forgiveness in West Michigan’s LGBT community. Rachel is also a singer/songwriter with a simplistic style and a unique, powerful voice. She performs stand up comedy and acts in sketches with Grand Rapids’ beloved all female comedy collective, Funny Girls, LLC.  She is also the Director of Education and co-founder at The Diatribe, a non-profit organization in Grand Rapids dedicated to uniting and inspiring the youth through spoken word poetry.
Rachel also provided amazing support and direction as Koans poetry coach for our Grand Rapids recordings at Mackinaw Harvest Studios last Fall.

Rachel (front) in the recording booth during Melissa's powerful readings of Janet's Poetry.
 
 

Marcel “Fable” Price
…is a Bi-racial North American writer, teaching artist, community advocate, motivational speaker, and executive director of non profit organization The Diatribe.
Fable is the 2016 recipient of a Community Advocate Award, a 2017 40 Under 40 Honoree, and is the currently holding the title of Poet Laureate.
He is the author of “Adrift in a Sea of M&M’s” (2016) and is currently working to finish his second collection of poems titled Metamorphosis; an extroverted caterpillars guide to becoming an introverted butterfly (2019).
Fable is the first person under the age of 40, and the first person of color to have earned the title of poet laureate of Grand Rapids Michigan; a three-year tenure with already measurable successes achieved within the first year. Fable is highly noted for his work with the youth through his non profit The Diatribe; using his own stories to consume the audience and is making a huge effort in lifting up youth across the country encouraging them to unpack their own struggles.
He is known across the nation for crowd-interactive features that leave those attending enlightened and empowered.

Fable's powerful readings at Mackinaw Harvest Studios, Grand Rapids, MI
 

Rachael Steil
...is an eating disorder in sports recovery advocate and the author of Running in Silence (Koehler Books, 2016). She is also the founder and speaker for the Running in Silence nonprofit to break misconceptions and raise awareness for eating disorders in sports, and serves on the board for the Michigan Eating Disorder Alliance (MiEDA). Rachael was 6th and 7th place NAIA All-American in cross country and track, and now coaches high school cross country. Her story has been featured in U.S. News and World Report, Fox17, WoodTV8, Women’s Running, and more.
Rachael speaks publicly about eating disorders to share her recovery story, create awareness, and bring hope to coaches and athletes.
Rachael was instrumental in reaching out and bringing an amazing group of West Michigan individuals to read Janet's poetry, all who in some way have a personal connection to the story.

Rachael not only brought her heartfelt voice to the project but reached out and connected a beautiful group of individuals who gave their hearts and voices to make this project a reality.
Shelley Irwin
...is the host and producer for The WGVU Morning Show, a newsmagazine talk-show format on the local NPR affiliate.  The show, broadcast from 9 a.m. to 11 a.m. features a wide variety of local and national newsmakers, plus special features. She also hosts several public affairs program on the TV side, including Family Health Matters and Kalamazoo Lively Arts. Shelley is award winning in her profession, including five consecutive Gracie Allen Awards from American Women in TV and Radio for excellence as a program host.  She was awarded the 2016 Athena Award  honoring an individual who has demonstrated leadership in their profession, mentored and opened new opportunities for women and contributed time and talent to the community. This year Shelley will receive the Rotary of Grand Rapids’ Service Above Self award, given in recognition of Frederik Meijer, whose humanitarian acts of selfless service made an enduring difference in the lives of others. Her community involvement extends from the Kent County Park Foundation to the  Michigan Women’s Foundation, Hope Network and the Cherry Health Foundation, among others. She has been twice nominated for a Michigan Emmy in Special Documentaries from the Society of Professional Journalists. She has been named one of the “50 Most Influential Women in West Michigan” twice by Gemini Publications, and has represented the U.S. in the Long Distance Triathlon and Duathlon World Championships.

So honored to have Shelley Irwin lend her voice to this project. Her advocacy and talent to tell important stories in our community has been a gift and we are thrilled to have her participation. Pictured here with director, Brian Gilmore (left) and sound engineer/Mackinaw Harvest Studio Owner, Michael Crittenden.
Bob Becker
Bob has over 25 years’ experience as an actor in theater in West Michigan performing most recently in Willy Wonka in the Jack Albertson’s role as Charley’s Grandpa Joe. Others include The Music Man, Brigadoon, Christmas Carol and It’s a Wonderful Life. Bob has over 56 years of radio experience in West Michigan. He is currently on the air with Real Oldies on WGVU. Other stations include Star 105.7, WODJ, WLAV, and WGRD. Bob has extensive voice over experience as well as performing on radio drama shows for the Children’s Bible Hour. Bob is delighted to be a part of this important production.

So thankful for Bob's amazing heartfelt voice! My mom and I listened to Bob's show on WGRD in the 1970's and she would be honored to know of his contribution. 
Veronica Kirin
...is a Forbes notable graduate of Grand Valley State University and a 40 Under 40 Business Leader.  An Anthropologist turned Serial Entrepreneur, her career has taken her from Disaster Relief through the Startup world.  She is founder of the award winning GreenCup Website Services, author of Stories Of Elders, Executive Producer on two films, and Entrepreneur Coach to Audacious Empire Builders who want to scale their businesses so they work less, grow faster, and earn more.  Her work as a coach was the first to be certified by the National LGBT Chamber of Commerce in her city and is known for her trademarked Self Care Through Scaling™ program.  She is also the founder of the Audacious Entrepreneur’s Sandbox, where Entrepreneurs can build community and get Coached in workshops and Live Q&As.

 
About The Author

Janet Gilmore was a lifelong resident of East Grand Rapids, MI. She was the daughter of Wilheimina Small and Dr. Carl Sigtenhorst. Janet was a talented artist who enjoyed painting and sculpting. She helped design and build three of her family’s homes in the 1960’s-1970’s. She attended the University of Michigan after graduating East Grand Rapids High School in 1950. She completed a B.S. in Environmental Studies at Aquinas College in 1976.
A loving free spirit, skier, swimmer, rock and roller, basset lover, MG car enthusiast, superb cook, rule breaker and so much more. She is missed but may her suffering and expression find purpose as a helping and healing voice.
About The Producers

Emma Gilmore lives with her family in Bellingham, WA. She has been creating art from the moment she picked up her first crayon. She began illustrating interpretations of her Grandmother’s poetry at age 15.
Emma is currently a high school junior with interests in pursuing a college education and possible career in Psychology. She loves to travel, paint, listen to music, play her violin and run.
Brian Gilmore attended Boston University as a graduate student in Film Production before pursuing a career in youth advocacy. He is an award winning filmmaker and school counselor. His first feature documentary, Dog Days Of Winter, tells the story of the birth and boom of the sport of freestyle skiing in America in the early 1970's. The film was an official selection worldwide in over 20 festivals and received the 2015 Film Award from the International Skiing History Association for outstanding creative contribution to skiing history.
 
What We Need

If we can raise $2500, we will have the necessary funds to self-publish 50 copies of Koans, license music for our audio production and pay for the studio time of the incredible voice talent that we have already recorded.
We are in a fantastic position to make this production a reality. Over 100 hours have been put into the production including: arranging the poetry and journal essay with Emma's poignant and heart-wrenching illustrations completed for each poem, all readings have been recorded, the music is selected and our first draft of the audio production is completed.
Immediate costs include: 

$1000 dollars to license music from Audio Network.
$500 to pay for our studio time (reduced fees from our engineers) to cover all readings and additional music.
$700 to Village Books for our ISDN and 50 copies of the book (plus additional support services).
$300 for digital images of artwork and additional misc. costs


The Impact
We feel the presentation of Janet's writings about her lifelong struggle with anorexia from the 1940's through her loss with this battle in 2002 represents an incredibly raw and sincere look at an individual's experience with an eating disorder. With what was originally an assignment from her therapist, she has left a gift of her expression, allowing a glimpse from the inside out into a lifetime battle with an eating disorder. It is Emma’s and my hope that by sharing these poems and illustrations, my mother’s expression may provide some insight, empathy and understanding for those suffering from an eating disorder.
Furthermore, by supporting our production costs, you help the project to move into an immediate profit generating opportunity with all proceeds from the book going to The Diatribe which is making incredible impacts with youth and young adults.
https://thediatribe.org

Risks & Challenges
It's happening! Your support is invaluable and we welcome you to be a part of this important project!!

Other Ways You Can Help
We realize not everyone can make a financial contribution. However, please help us spread the word out about this production. Sharing project links and encouraging support from your social network is invaluable to our efforts to bring this story to life and support health and recovery.
Thanks so much! Brian & Emma

story:
On the night of May 10, 2018, I was out in the streets of New York City - homeless. 

That night I recounted the struggles of growing up in a poor household. 

I also recounted an article that I had read during my time at Harvard. It was about a man who had resorted to living inside his family car.  

This sparked a crazy project in my mind. I decided that I wanted to create a mobile-home. I soon became obsessed with the idea.

After much research, I realized that I needed a sprinter to make my idea into reality. A sprinter is a car/van that is often used to convert into mobile-homes because of its versatility. 

On February 9, 2019, I finally purchased a sprinter so that I could convert it into a mobile-home!

 

So what exactly am I doing?!

I am building a mobile-home by converting my sprinter into a mobile-home and writing a book about it! 

Many of you may think that this is unusual, even crazy, but it's actually more common than you would think!

Since deciding to move on with this project, I found various articles and website detailing the process. I have also watched numerous conversion videos on Youtube.

Conversions are not easy and costly! But I believe that the experience will be totally worth it!

I intend to document my life, the good and the bad, converting and living inside my sprinter so that others can see the process in bite-size pieces.

 

My 2nd Book: Harvard to Home-Less

I am very lucky to be able to imagine this project in the first place.

On October 20, 2017 I published my first book, The Art of Napping: The Sleeping Samurai and the Dormant Dragon, through the New Degree Press. 

During the launch week, the book was as an Amazon Bestseller for 2-3 weeks.

Since the success of my first book, I have been in talks with my publisher (New Degree Press) for my second book, Harvard to Homeless, which will document my journey converting my sprinter and then going on to live my van-life!

They have been very supportive of my next project and I am excited that they are helping pave the road for my next journey!

 

My Ask

Initially, I was hoping to cover all costs for the sprinter-renovations and the publication costs independently. However, as I moved forward, I came across many financial constraints that made my life difficult. 

My ask from you today is to help cover the renovation costs of my sprinter. In exchange, I promise to update you regularly about my journey! Please take a look at the different tiers and see if there are rewards that interests you - I spent a lot of time thinking about how I could make your support be meaningful for everyone. 

Sprinter conversions cost vary. After thinking through the process multiple times, I realized that the minimum I need to start is $8000. Below is a breakdown from a sprinter-conversion that I want to closely mirror.

 

Timeline

June 2019    Sprinter Conversion

July 4, 2019    Launch of bimonthly e-newsletter (until publication of book – exp. publication date 12/2020)

August 2019    Car-Welcoming Party 

October 2019    Custom Vinyl Decal stickers posted inside Mobile-Home     

March 2020    Compile all documents, journals, newsletter to organize in book

June - November 2020     Review with publishers for edits and other necessary preparations

December 2020    Book Launch Party

June 2021    Road Trip with Mobile-Home

 

For more information, you can check out my website: <www.harvardtohome-less.com>

story:
Book Summary

This book will be a collection of fine art portraits of the (over 30) musicians I have 'interviewed' and there will be three main segments "Our Music, Our Mountains, Our Memories". So I will also be sharing the landscape of our mountains and essays of local farmers, coal miners and just good mountain folk.

  • I have been an portrait artist literally since I was a child. I sketched faces on my etch-a-sketch, in school, and anywhere I could find a clean sheet of paper! As I grew older and began using the camera as a reference tool, folks began to compliment me on my photography! When digital hit and I had a way to combine my art skills with photography , via Photoshop. I met my passion ! I have also loved to write , since I was a child, so I guess you could say this book has been hiding dormant in me since my early years and now I have a chance to release it to grow into full realization !
  • This project is very special to me because of my memories as a child , when I first heard my Grandmother, Helen Hunley, singing at the clothesline. (Which is the main title for my book ). She always sang, as she worked and I recall how spellbound I was, as I stood beside her, as a little girl, handing her clothespins and seeing her smiling up at the heavens and belting out old hymns, such as "The Old Rugged Cross" and "Amazing Grace". It struck a chord in me that I will never forget. How , she would hum to herself as she 'snapped peas' on the porch and wistfully look out the window, as she did the dishes, always humming her favorite tunes, as though a she was the embodiment of a living prayer and her singing was her personal church. It taught me to enjoy my chores, with music in my head, and to see the blessings in our every day life and routine. 
    This to me, is how our early music was passed on through the generations and how it is still alive today. From Clothesline to clothesline , porch to porch and from the old timers to the new youth of today!
  • How can you help me achieve my goal of completing and publishing this book? 
    I have been working hard on this book since 2010. I have traveled and visited many folks and have conducted over 30 interviews. (Many at the Reed Creek Farm in Wytheville, so special thanks to the Wassum family ). I have given a gift of prints to all those I have interviewed as a way of saying "Thanks " . I sincerely do appreciate all the musicians, who have contributed their time and those who lent a song for the CD to accompany this project.
    Your contribution will enable me the time and space to get down to the business of transposing all the interviews and get the entire writing process done (Now that the portraits, landscape photography and 'most' of interviews have been completed ) . The funds will pay for the many expenses of travel, time off to write, and of course the actual cost of publishing a high quality photography book !
    I want to make every one of you very proud that you helped to make this happen and I want you to be able to hold the actual completed book and feel as fulfilled as I am , that this project produced a book rich in stories, antidotes, and poignant memories that we can all connect to and feel a sense of family and belonging that we all came together and made happen!
    I could not ever do this without your encouragement, inspiration and kind assistance and I am very grateful for your help !
    With humble appreciation , I thank you all sincerely!
    Susi

What This Project Needs & What You Get

Breaking it Down:

  • The estimate cost I received for photo quality printing of 200 books will be around $15,000
  • I am offering a lot of cool perks, if you are not ready to buy the book, then purchasing a perk will still help me fund the cost of printing and , of course also help me pay for the cost of the perks! Some of the perks are : Original posters, pertaining to the subject of the book theme!
    T-shirts with the book title, subtitle and graphics ! A CD with 12-15 songs of some of the awesome musicians I have interviewed for the book ! My 2009 Kodak Award winner book of portraits "'Simple Wisdom'! A solid Mahogany Baby Taylor guitar , signed by all the musicians in the book !!
     
  • If I do not reach my goal, you will still get any perks you ordered and you will still receive any books you ordered , because I will find a way to make it happen! Yes, I am a positive thinker and doer !

The Impact

Why this project matters !

  • I believe in this book project, because I believe in Our Music, Our Mountains and Our Memories ! I know that the conversations with our area musicians and other folks, are one of great connections and a positive reinforcement of our life, here in the Appalachian Mountains. We are a unique blend of organic, hard working, good solid folks here and I think this book will be a great reminder of that and something to return to , flip through and revisit the portraits, landscapes and memories so dear to us all. You don't have to know the folks in the pages , to feel a sense of kinship, good will and a sense of family that we have and feel here.
  • It has taken me many years to seek out all the musicians, with travel and timing around my occupation as a portrait photographer. But, I now have everything completed, but the writing ! That part will come to me and flow along fine in the coming months. (Especially Winter , when my photography business slows to a crawl. This will give me the solitude and time I need !) This project, of course, is also a very personal one. I have always wanted to create a beautiful book of photography and text and now, I am finally seeing this dream come to fruition! It's a fantastic feeling and my daughter is very proud of me! As a single Mom, of  26 years, that makes me feel pretty darn good!
  • My Photography motto is , "You can trust me with your memories " and that's also how I feel about this book. You can trust that this book will be completed , printed, published and mailed to your kind hands!

Risks & Challenges

  • I do not perceive any risk to any of my perks ! I plan to print the posters, screen print the t-shirts myself and the music for the CD has been emailed to me and a studio has agreed to create the 'master' for the CD. I designed the CD cover myself and will have those printed online ! The guitar is in my possession and is ready to mail. So, there are no risk for any of the 'extra perks', unless there is an unforeseen calamity !
  • If I do not receive enough funding to print 200 books, I will use whatever funding I do receive to print the amount that is ordered. Less books cost more, but I will still honor any orders that I receive to the best of my ability. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not afford to contribute by purchasing a perk or a book, you can help a lot simply by sharing and posting the link to my funding site on any social media platform that you choose! I thank you for this !

  • You can tell folks about my project !
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
    For more info, you can go to my project site www.singingattheclothesline.com 

Special Thanks !

  1. I want to thank Kay Justice and Quinten Boyles for appearing in the intro video (They are both dear friends ,excellent vocalist and musicians and are included in this project)
  2. Thank you to Drew Robinson for coming out to the Reed Creek Farm and recording the intro video exactly as I had envisioned it ! You did a beautiful job!
  3. ​Thank you to Tim White who allowed me to come to the Lincoln Theatre and meet and photograph our area musicians , which inspired this project ! Also, Thanks to Tim for the wonderful endorsement video !
  4. Thank you to the owners of the Reed Creek Farm , Tom and Teresa Wassum, who granted me permission to do most of my interviews and portraits at their beautiful home place! I honestly don't know what I would've done without this beautiful location and their kindness ! I love y'all !
  5. Thank you to all the musicians, who agreed to be in my book and took the time, from their busy schedules and share with me a glimpse of their life in which to share with all the readers ! Some of you drove all the way to Wytheville to spend some time at the farm , with me, and you all did so with a glad heart and a warm spirit and I truly thank you for that!
  6. Thank you to the musicians, who sent me their original songs to add to the audio CD perk "Soft Songs for Hard Times" I love every song or tune you sent and I appreciate this generosity! I know this CD will be loved by all who hear it !
  7. Thank you to my 'models' Kassie and Lisa Hackler, Cassa Marie Smith, and Alyssa Kenneley for your help in creating the T-shirt, cover of the book and CD and all the poster perks ! I appreciate your time and natural ease in front of the camera !
  8. Thank you to Debbie Larson for kindly inviting me, into her home, to interview Larry McPeak , before his passing. He was not feeling well, but shared his heartfelt memories for many hours and he truly touched my heart. As I went to leave he said to me "This is going to be a great book and I hope I get to see it before I am gone." It was then I knew , I would dedicate this book to him and his beautiful legacy. Thank you ,Larry, for all the inspiring music you left behind. You will never be forgotten.
  9. Thank you , to my daughter, Cassidy Joy, of whom I am so proud , and who always brings me joy! She has told me, several times , how proud she is that I am working on this book ! It is her loving presence in my life that propels me forward and reminds me of my worth in this world .
  10. Thank you, to all of you, who have encouraged me and kept me going! I feel this project is finally off the runway ,and now that I am in flight , I can focus on the trip towards landing this book in the laps of all of you who helped pave the runway and are now keeping me aloft !

    More thanks !
    Thank you to Peter Figen, who donated his 1986 portrait of Doc Watson!
    Thank you to my friend 'Q-tip' for donating the Fiddlers Convention Knife and for your kind encouragement !
    Thank you to Marty Tatum ,who will be doing the 'Master' work on the CD !
    Thank you to Wayne and Jayne Henderson ,who allowed me to hang out at their shop and conduct interviews, take a lot of pix and always made me feel like family ! I hope to come visit y'all again soon !
    Thank you to my friend , David Harvey, (now passed) whom I met in 1999 and who helped me to understand how my investment in good gear would improve my portrait photography. He was a portrait master, and I will always miss his advice and friendship.
    If I failed to mention anyone ,who has made this project possible , please know you are in my heart and I am grateful for you!
    I hope to make you all proud !!! Love y'all !

Risks & Challenges

I do not perceive any risk to any of my perks ! I plan to print the posters, screen print the t-shirts myself and the music for the CD has been emailed to me and a studio has agreed to create the 'master' for the CD. I designed the CD cover myself and will have those printed online ! The guitar is in my possession and is ready to mail. So, there are no risk for any of the 'extra perks', unless there is an unforeseen calamity !
If I do not receive enough funding to print 200 books, I will use whatever funding I do receive to print the amount that is ordered. Less books cost more, but I will still honor any orders that I receive to the best of my ability. 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can not afford to contribute by purchasing a perk or a book, you can help a lot simply by sharing and posting the link to my funding site on any social media platform that you choose! I thank you for this !

You can tell folks about my project !
You can use the Indiegogo share tools!For more info, you can go to my project site www.singingattheclothesline.com 

Special Thanks !
I want to thank Kay Justice and Quinten Boyles for appearing in the intro video (They are both dear friends ,excellent vocalist and musicians and are included in this project)
Thank you to Drew Robinson for coming out to the Reed Creek Farm and recording the intro video exactly as I had envisioned it ! You did a beautiful job!
​Thank you to Tim White who allowed me to come to the Lincoln Theatre and meet and photograph our area musicians , which inspired this project ! Also, Thanks to Tim for the wonderful endorsement video !
Thank you to the owners of the Reed Creek Farm , Tom and Teresa Wassum, who granted me permission to do most of my interviews and portraits at their beautiful home place! I honestly don't know what I would've done without this beautiful location and their kindness ! I love y'all !
Thank you to all the musicians, who agreed to be in my book and took the time, from their busy schedules and share with me a glimpse of their life in which to share with all the readers ! Some of you drove all the way to Wytheville to spend some time at the farm , with me, and you all did so with a glad heart and a warm spirit and I truly thank you for that!
Thank you to the musicians, who sent me their original songs to add to the audio CD perk "Soft Songs for Hard Times" I love every song or tune you sent and I appreciate this generosity! I know this CD will be loved by all who hear it !
Thank you to my 'models' Kassie and Lisa Hackler, Cassa Marie Smith, and Alyssa Kenneley for your help in creating the T-shirt, cover of the book and CD and all the poster perks ! I appreciate your time and natural ease in front of the camera !
Thank you to Debbie Larson for kindly inviting me, into her home, to interview Larry McPeak , before his passing. He was not feeling well, but shared his heartfelt memories for many hours and he truly touched my heart. As I went to leave he said to me "This is going to be a great book and I hope I get to see it before I am gone." It was then I knew , I would dedicate this book to him and his beautiful legacy. Thank you ,Larry, for all the inspiring music you left behind. You will never be forgotten.
Thank you , to my daughter, Cassidy Joy, of whom I am so proud , and who always brings me joy! She has told me, several times , how proud she is that I am working on this book ! It is her loving presence in my life that propels me forward and reminds me of my worth in this world .
Thank you, to all of you, who have encouraged me and kept me going! I feel this project is finally off the runway ,and now that I am in flight , I can focus on the trip towards landing this book in the laps of all of you who helped pave the runway and are now keeping me aloft !More thanks !Thank you to Peter Figen, who donated his 1986 portrait of Doc Watson!Thank you to my friend 'Q-tip' for donating the Fiddlers Convention Knife and for your kind encouragement !Thank you to Marty Tatum ,who will be doing the 'Master' work on the CD !Thank you to Wayne and Jayne Henderson ,who allowed me to hang out at their shop and conduct interviews, take a lot of pix and always made me feel like family ! I hope to come visit y'all again soon !Thank you to my friend , David Harvey, (now passed) whom I met in 1999 and who helped me to understand how my investment in good gear would improve my portrait photography. He was a portrait master, and I will always miss his advice and friendship.If I failed to mention anyone ,who has made this project possible , please know you are in my heart and I am grateful for you!I hope to make you all proud !!! Love y'all !

story:
Hi everyone, I am Mercedes Blair from Truro, Nova Scotia, Canada. I am a photographer with an amazing dog! We go on great adventures and I've always wanted to write a book, so I am combining my photography with writing, and self publishing my new book - Adventures with Jazzy. Jazzy is my German Shepherd/Husky dog who goes on some amazing adventures in NS. Our favourite is hiking in the woods, on the way to the next waterfall. Never knowing what - or who - we will find along the way! Help support bringing this book to life to find out what is waiting for you in Adventures with Jazzy! All illustrations will be done from my real photos that I take - the funds from this will help me be able to pay my illustrator, editor, and all other costs that come with self publishing. Thanks so much for your support to bring this project to life! We also have the option to pre-order if you want to have a copy of the book instead of donating! Please go to www.facebook.com/MercedesBlairPhotography for more info :) 

All donations will count as an entry for a draw to win a 30x20 ready to hang canvas of your choice of any of my photos on my photography page! 

Follow Jazzy on facebook to learn more about her and her unique adventures! www.facebook.com/JazzyBlair7

story:
EYES THAT HAVE SEEN GOD: RELIGIOUS ENCOUNTERS OF MODERN DAY MEN AND WOMEN


Self-publishing a book such as this requires a big financial investment which we're unable to cover on our own, meaning we won't be able to publish this book without your help! Please continue to read to see if this book interests you and why your help is crucial in order to get it published. Thank you!


ABOUT THE BOOK

More than 85% of all people worldwide identify themselves as either religious or spiritual, meaning that they believe in some form of "cosmic order of existence" and carry belief in a  "Higher Power", often known under the names of God the Father, Great Mother Goddess, Jehovah, El, Allah, Krishna, The Great Spirit, Cosmic Consciousness, Void, and many other.

Although many religious and spiritual notions of God are entirely belief based, there exists a great number of people, born in the 20th and 21st centuries, who have experienced God directly, much in a similar fashion as mystics and prophets of the ancient times did. As Carl Gustav Jung said after his own encounter with the Divine: "I don't need to believe, I know."

This book which we titled "Eyes That Have Seen God" will be an anthology of those experiences, as told by people on various walks of life, sharing their often shattering encounters with the Divine, that happened either through a spontaneous experience, a near-death, prayer, meditation, or psychedelic drug use. In sharing their encounters, they will also convey the metaphysical truths that were revealed to them regarding the meaning of life, love, suffering, good and evil, death, and the afterlife.

 

THE VALIDITY OF MODERN DAY SPIRITUAL EXPERIENCES

Accepting the validity of these experiences is somewhat difficult, since modern Western individual is caught between two extreme positions.

The rational, scientific, atheist position denies the existence of any "Higher Power", and sees God as a relic of our superstitious past that should be entirely replaced by findings of modern science. Experiences of the Divine are seen exclusively as delusions of a faulty brain.

On the other hand, the religious position argues that God revealed himself to a number of prophets and mystics more than two millennia ago, and has since remained mostly hidden and inaccessible. According to this doctrine, the task of the religious life is not to re-experience Divine for oneself, but to take words of these ancient prophets on blind faith and hope to encounter God in the afterlife.

A third position has emerged recently that is nothing short of remarkable. A great number of consciousness and near-death researchers and depth psychologists came to the conclusion that even in the 20th and 21st centuries God not only exists and remains present, but continues to reveal himself to healthy and normal people from all walks of life. Although profound in their positive effects, these type of experiences are often pathologized by modern psychiatry and therefore only rarely talked about - a trend which we hope this book will help change. 


MODERN DAY ENCOUNTERS WITH THE DIVINE

As the experiences described in this book will show, modern day mystical encounters with the Divine take place not just in places of worship, but in secular places too, including cities, homes and deep inside of nature.

Although a great number of these encounters can bring profound comfort, peace, and a sense of meaning, some of them can also be profoundly  shattering, since the experience is so overwhelming that it often threaten preconceived notions of  a comforting, all-loving God as a father- or mother- figure. "Higher Power" as encountered personally is often much larger, profound, and complex than people ever imagined and may even be in conflict with the pre-existing religious doctrines one was taught to accept on blind faith.

Even so these experiences eventually do confirm the existence of a "Higher Power" and its everyday presence in this world, as well as the ultimate recognition of Love as an intrinsic force that is ever present behind the world's material mask and the ultimate goodness and redemption of each and every human being.

These discoveries, which you will be able to read about in the book, will hopefully bring a renewed sense of purpose both to your life and to your on-going spiritual quest.


ABOUT THE AUTHORS AND THE EDITOR

Authors whose often shattering experiences of the Divine will be found in "Eyes That Have Seen God," will depend on the combined amount of donations raised through this crowdfunding campaign.

So far, we were able to secure contributions from Stanislav Grof, M.D., Ph.D., a Professor of Psychology at CIIS and one of the founders of the field of transpersonal psychology, Christopher M. Bache, Ph.D., a Professor of Religious Studies at Youngstown State University and Mark Seelig, Ph.D., transpersonal psychotherapist, theologian and musician. We plan to include many other authors as the project unfolds.

This book is being co-authored and edited by Marko Vide, a transpersonally oriented psychotherapist in residency. He holds a degree in Psychotherapy Science and currently works for a private institute conducting psychotherapy and research of non-ordinary states of consciousness. He also holds a profound interest and passion for not just psychotherapy, but also mysticism and religious studies. He has been exploring these avenues in various contexts for almost 20 years.


WE NEED YOUR HELP: PLEASE MAKE A PRE-ORDER,  A DONATION OR SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN WITH YOUR FRIENDS

Self-publishing a book such as this requires a big financial investment, which we're unable to cover on our own. This means that we won't be able to publish this book without your help!

So if this project caught your attention and you think this book should get published, please consider making a donation or placing a pre-order of the book (starting $15 for an eBook or $25 for paperback), by choosing one among the perk options from the right column. If you're on mobile, simply click on "perks" at the bottom of your screen.

No matter how small or big your donation will be, all your contributions are significant and every single one of them will help us get this book out on the shelves - including your own!

If you can’t pre-order the book or contribute financially to the project, you can still support the campaign by telling your friends; simply click on one of the share buttons in the top right area of the screen.


THANK YOU!

story:
Are you passionate?

Let's keep history alive and real and leave a legacy for everyone. SPLINTERED, the second novel in the Asunder trilogy is set to come out, but I need your help. Without your help, it may not happen. 

PERKS  TA DA!

Every donation gets a shoutout on Facebook and Twitter

$50 Signed copy of Splintered, the Civil War Songs CD and letters written by Sara and Cyntha on fine paper (not in the book.)

$25 Signed copy of Splintered mailed to you or handed to you. Plus a copy of the professionally recorded CD of songs of the Civil War. 

$5 A shoutout on Facebook and Twitter plus a clever, fun poem about you. Original and not insulting. (See below for examples)

$12 A poem plus the Compelling Civil War Songs CD

$75 Signed copies of Splintered and Asunder, the Civil War CD and the letters from Cyntha and Sara

$125 Signed copies of both books and your choice of the Civil War mugs offered

$500 I go to your home anywhere in the continental US and give an intimate banjo and guitar concert to you and friends, plus you get both signed books, the CD, a travel mug and the letters in an elegant box. Plus a DVD copy of the Surrender of Lee filmed at Liendo Plantation. 

$1000 A personally guided tour by yours truly of both battle sites - Pea Ridge and Wilson Creek with specifics of where the characters were (plus bonus sites), a night's stay in an elegant bed and breakfast in Fayetteville, Ark., a dinner out and a $50 travel voucher.

BRAG POEM SAMPLES BELOW

There once was a great man named Jim

Who was neither heavy, nor slim

Admired by his peers

He was a man without fear.

In fact, he could chase a bear up a limb.

 

There once was a woman named Karen

Whose ability to dress well with a flare-en.

She could dress in such finery

And code computers in binary,

At her beauty it was hard not to stare- en.

 

There was a reenactor named Abel.

Who you always liked to share his table.

He was a really good rider

I sure must confide’r

And he could ride any horse in the stable

 

The big publishers, for the most part, only publish established authors. I don't blame them, but, for them, it's dollars. So publishing is rapidly changing. The bulk of the work and expenses now falls on the author. I am self-published, which gives me more control over where the book goes and I get to meet the readers in person. 

However, it is expensive. I'm up for the challenge but I would enjoy your help. Plus - you get fun perks, and you get bragging rights that you helped publish an awesome book. Every keeps asking "When are they going to make it into a movie?"'See below.

FUNDING NEEDED

I need about $7500. 

Publishing, printing, book cover art, reviews, getting into stores and on Amazon -$4875

Beginning advertising $600 (minimum)

Travel to promote the book $800

Book Launch $1250

story:
Resumen

 

Soy Ricardo Solís, un novel escritor costarricense que busca publicar su primer libro, un poemario de estilo e ideas libres. Es un libro desenfadado, rabioso y roto, pero es el reflejo de una constante búsqueda de paz y respuestas en medio de años difíciles y convulsos para su autor.

Después de una postergación y una travesía igualmente largas, "Tomografía del Desencanto" está a las puertas de publicarse, pero requiere de la ayuda de lectores como usted, que crean en su potencial y colaboren económicamente con la causa.
story_txt:
Resumen Soy Ricardo Solís, un novel escritor costarricense que busca publicar su primer libro, un poemario de estilo e ideas libres. Es un libro desenfadado, rabioso y roto, pero es el reflejo de una constante búsqueda de paz y respuestas en medio de años difíciles y convulsos para su autor.
Después de una postergación y una travesía igualmente largas, "Tomografía del Desencanto" está a las puertas de publicarse, pero requiere de la ayuda de lectores como usted, que crean en su potencial y colaboren económicamente con la causa.

story:
IWA Islamic World of Art is an independent magazine on the incredibly rich artistic and cultural output of the Islamic world. Our aim is to provide insightful contents aimed at anyone interested in this magical world. We do not want to be too academic but we also wish to change the perspective that the Islamic world is only beautiful, as we genuinely feel that there its history is deep in interesting facts. This is why IWA mag is aimed at a wide public: both specialists and amateurs can enjoy our contents.
So far, the magazine has been published exclusively online, open access. What we want to do is to reach a wider public and start to print out the future issues.

WE ARE TWO YOUNG PROFESSIONALS, SURROUNDED BY GREAT COLLABORATORS. Our names are Giulia Gallini and Sara Ibrahim: based in Amsterdam and Milan. Giulia is an expert in Islamic history of art, and Sara is a professional in the editorial world. We met in Venice (Italy), at the University, where we studied Arabic language together but specialized in different fields. With our combined passion we naturally became friends and decided to join forces to create IWA Islamic World of Art.
Over the years we have worked with many talented individuals on this project: graphic designers, web geeks, editors, authors and photographers.

WE NEED YOU because so far IWA Islamic World of Art has been a completely self-funded magazine. We and our collaborators have invested our time (and savings) in the magazine, and we want it to flourish.
We are proud to be independent and not to be affiliated with any bigger editorial corporation, and we want to remain so. This is why we want to raise the seed capital that will allow us to grow with a crowdfunding campaign.

WITH THE MONEY WE RAISE WE WILL first of all start to print and distribute the magazine in bookshops and museums. Also, we are proud that our authors and collaborators have used their own time to share their passion and enthusiasm on this project, however as life persists, we feel it’s time for their work to be paid in order to ensure we can not only maintain a great quality, but invest in diving deeper into the topic to be the best source of IWA.
The money raised will pay also the social media campaign, the maintenance of the website and the future investments for the growth of the project. 
Considering this, 13,500 is not a lot to ask for.

NOT ONLY OBJECTS BUT ALSO EXPERIENCES is what you can get funding this campaign. 
We believe in the need of culture to be spread and shared: this is why our perks include the opportunity to curate an article and to become part of the editorial board for one edition! If you do not have enough time to curate an article, you can sponsor it.
But of course, you can also get a beautifully designed tote bag, based on the mesmerizing videogame Engare by Mahdi Bahrami. Of course, limited edition for the crowdfunding.
Our favourite perk is the limited edition copy of the magazine: so far you’ve read our articles online. For the very first time we are printing the best of the last issues, for a crowdfunding campaign limited edition.
