story:
Who Are We?
MEOW is being founded by Katy Gierlach and Jared McKinley, who are no strangers to publishing. Having participated on many levels in local magazines, including the launch of one of the more successful periodicals in Tucson, we know what it takes to get a new publication going. However, we are aiming to do it a bit differently than it has been done in the past.

All of us at MEOW are lovers of this region. We live here because of the border, not despite. This place is special not just because of its rich history and culture; the modern borderlands is a place imbued with a creative and innovative spirit. And we feel that the region has been misrepresented, our problems embellished and exaggerated for political purposes at the cost of our local economies. We want to push back, and profile the region for what it really is.

TESTIMONIALS
Frank Williams, FWD Design
“Jared and Katy are two of the hardest working and creative, yet grounded, entrepreneurs I have met. Never afraid to shake things up, their passion and love for everything in our community is ever present and their love for food, gardening and sustainable practices are unmatched. It is truly refreshing to be with like-minded folks and I am blessed to have them as friends, and business colleagues. Their newest venture will prove to be just what we need in the Southern Arizona community with a fresh perspective that will appeal to the masses…they are as real as it gets.”

Ben Nisbet, Orchestra and Operations manager of TSO, Artistic Director of St Andrews Bach Society, and Concertmaster of True Concord, Voices and Orchestra
"I am thrilled that Jared and Katy, two people who have tirelessly explored seemingly every facet of Southern AZ's community and culture, have decided to take on a media concept that promises to enrich and enhance our already vibrant experience.  As a member of the culture community here in Tucson, I am excited about the possibility of an outlet that exists firmly in the 21st century."

Rebecca Safford, Owner of Tap & Bottle
"Tap & Bottle has been lucky to work with Katy and Jared over the past few years in event promotion, advertising and video work. As a business, they have pushed us to think of stories and experiences that go beyond what is already being done in Tucson. Meow Magazine will bring a unique and FUN voice to explain, inspire and express the amazingness of Arizona."

Curtis McCrary, executive director of Rialto Theatre, 191 Toole, and R Bar
"I have worked with Jared and Katy in various capacities over many years, and have been continually impressed by their dedication to making fun things happen in Tucson, and their carnival-barker-like ability to attract interest and attendance. I have no doubts that this will translate into a scenario where Meow Magazine will pack the house to such a degree, we're going to get in trouble with the fire marshal! Just kidding, we will comply with all laws and regulations, and turn people away IF WE MUST."

THE MAGAZINE
MEOW Magazine promises to be different than anything out there right meow. For starters, we are investing in our digital presence FIRST -- this means more than having a few blog entries, reposts of our print stories, and a smattering of postings on Facebook. For MEOW Magazine, taking our digital presence seriously means developing a program set up specifically to finance and publish regular multimedia posts: not just articles, but video, podcasts, photo essays, and more. And we believe in paying our contributors fairly for the work they produce.

And we aren’t leaving print behind. In fact, we think we have made some innovations in our print products as well. We will be producing lots of smaller publications focussed on specific subjects and targeted at specific audiences. There will also, eventually, be a full quarterly publication, distributed statewide.

We have restructured our advertising program to get away from the distracting, noisy nature that traditional advertising environments are, to become something more entertaining, useful, and congruent with the editorial. We are curating those advertisers, and designing the ad environment to be a service to the reader, rather than an hassle. Ads don’t have to suck.

MEOW Magazine, as the name might also imply, aims at having a younger, more edgy and fun tone. If you want the younger audience, you should speak in a way that resonates with them, use technology that they respond to, and you should hire a lot of young people.

Many people ask us, “Why MEOW Magazine?” It’s simple. MEOW is fun, lends itself to lots of language play, and is visually suggestive and memorable.

MEOW Magazine is a product of MEOW MEOW Media, LLC. We believe in implementing our marketing triumvirate plan for all we produce, which involves print media, digital media, and event production.

THE EDITORIAL
We are covering a wide range of subjects, separated into 6 categories:

Prowl
This is everything in the hood, outside the home: dining out, nightlife, stories on local retail shops, profiles of local movers and shakers, events, and calendars that help you find all the fun stuff happening in town.

Casa
Local lifestyle is unique because of our climate and our multicultural influences. In this section we cover cooking, gardening, home improvement, self care, and give tips on living well in the desert, all with a regional emphasis.

Arts
Arizona is rich in art and we aim to cover the gamut: visual arts, music (both modern and classical), dance, performance art, stage, and the literary arts.

Tour
Outside of Tucson there is a lot to do: we want you to explore your backyard, see all the beautiful towns in Arizona and just beyond, explore the wonderful nature we have, and find all the outdoor activities that enrich our lives and improve our health and mental well-being.

Region
There is much to cover when it comes to history, culture, natural history, and all the things that really define who we are. The stories about this region, whether they occurred a hundred years ago or a decade ago, are always fascinating. And who has more a more iconic landscape than we do, with our saguaros, ocotillos, and prickly pear?

Civics
We hope to guide our readers toward being good citizens: we want to help our audience be aware of local political issues, community stories, provide opportunities for civic engagement and volunteerism, and more. We hope to help our readers make educated decisions when voting, and help them understand all the current issues that require citizen input, support, or resistance. And we encourage our readers to watch where they put their money. 

THE BUSINESS
We have designed our magazine not only to succeed, but to reward the right people. All too often local media companies are top-heavy. When profits accrue, they usually go upward to pay for overhead, please shareholders, and the first elements to get cut when things get tough are the people who contribute the actual content.

We think this is wrong. So, we intend on staying independent -- we will not use traditional investors to fund this magazine nor take out big loans. Instead, we are content to grow slowly and surely. So far this has been beneficial to us because it has given us more time to plan, to budget, and to consider everything we are doing.

This is also why we decided to use crowdfunding. At first, like many, we were leery of crowdfunding. But we realized that our aim to be devoted to our audience (not shareholders or investors) makes us a perfect match for crowdfunding -- which is quite literally going to our audience for support. We are beholden to you.

We will be funding our company through our innovative ad program, which we have designed to be, as stated above, useful to the reader as much as it is useful to the advertiser. We have an extensive menu of products that we will draw upon to create packages, customized for each advertiser or advertising group. And we have created products for everyone: from the smallest to the largest local businesses. And we are always local first!

We are a modern, mobile company. Technology enables us to eschew the needs for an office, a needless expense that can drag on media companies. When needed, we have collaborators that can provide studio spaces for video and photo shoots. Most of our work is done in cafes, or in our living room.

Our profits will always be applied to the people who create the content. Everyone in MEOW Magazine works hard. There are no big bosses, no shareholders draining away profits while contributing little to our output. And as we grow, we will increase the wages of those contributors. Our largest expenses will be paying for our content, and marketing it through social networks, google, print products, events, and other marketing products driving traffic to our website -- all of which also produces profit. Our belief is that the success of our company should go toward the people who create the editorial. After a year of operation, those who have shown adherence to our mission, and have produced consistently, will become shareholders.

OUR IMPACT
Our mission is to connect our audience to the region: the landscape, culture, history, community, arts, people, businesses, events, and opportunities for experience. MEOW is for everyone who lives here, young and old. We are here to present the real borderlands (the historic and the contemporary), and aim to have a positive effect on our local economy, encouraging our audience to spend locally, travel locally, and live locally.

With every project we have been involved with before, we have aimed at bettering our community. We believe regionalism is the only future. And we believe in investing back into our community -- promoting local businesses, using local businesses, we even bank locally with Tucson Federal Credit Union. We use local printers and designers, we shop at local office supply companies, and we work daily to inspire our audience to do the same. Localism and regionalism is perhaps one of the most important movements happening in the 21st century; putting our money toward the businesses and organizations that give back to the local community. Put simply, we are Arizona’s most enthusiastic cheerleaders.

OUR CHALLENGES
Being independent comes with its challenges, which we have prepared for: because we are not relying on investors for our needed boost, we have had to grow slowly. However, maintaining this slower pace has not been without advantages -- we have had more time to carefully orchestrate our business.

As we go public with our ideas, we expect some imitation. We have already experienced this. But while people can borrow ideas, inspiration is impossible to steal, and we never rest on our laurels. We are always working to evolve our products and concepts, staying acutely aware of the changes and needs of the audience. With all that we have already produced, there are always new ideas and products being developed, constantly. The website, magazine, and event designs are never finished.

Katy and Jared have extensive experience and success in creating and selling ad products. But if our ad sales don’t take off right away, we have structured our business to continue to produce, regardless; our overhead is low, and our budget is malleable. We can do a lot with a little bit of money and can respond quickly to changes in sales. Just take a look at what we have done already on our website: everything you see there was done on a shoestring budget. 

WHAT WE NEED
We are asking for a boost to help us get out there. This is what the money will do:

  • Assist the transition of our webpage from beta mode into full production
  • Pay for printing cost on our first print products.
  • Help us launch our advertising program (digital and print).
  • Pay for our content as we transition into full production.
  • Begin our own marketing program with the use of print products, social media, web marketing, and events.
  • Help us purchase the needed tools: new computers, cameras, lighting, office supplies, etc.
  • Pay for materials and tools needed for selling ads.
  • Pay for needed software used for production, business organization, bookkeeping, and internal and external communication.
  • Pay for startup web and graphic design and editing.
 

Whether or not we reach our goal, the money we raise will still be used on all of the above items, scaled down to accommodate a modified budget that will prioritize paying contributors and selling advertising products.

 

WHAT ELSE CAN YOU DO TO SUPPORT US
Besides supporting us with campaign dollars, you can support MEOW Magazine in a number of other ways:

  • Share our IndieGoGo Page and help us get the word out.
  • Read MEOW. Every day.
  • Follow us on social media, and share our social media pages with your friends.
  • Advertise with MEOW. Contact KittyKatt@MeowMeowMedia.com for more information on advertising with us.
  • Come to our events.
  • Support the advertisers that support MEOW Magazine.
  • Share our editorial.
  • Join our team.

However, we are aiming to do it a bit differently than it has been done in the past.
All of us at MEOW are lovers of this region. We live here because of the border, not despite. This place is special not just because of its rich history and culture; the modern borderlands is a place imbued with a creative and innovative spirit. And we feel that the region has been misrepresented, our problems embellished and exaggerated for political purposes at the cost of our local economies. We want to push back, and profile the region for what it really is.

story:
About this Project:

Green Card ENTREPRENEUR Voices: Inspiring How-To Stories from Minnesota Immigrants is a collection of personal essays, videos, and podcasts from immigrant entrepreneurs living in Minnesota. This is the fourth in a series of books featuring immigrant stories recorded by Green Card Voices (GCV). Through this project, we lift up immigrant voices and offer insight into the resources and expertise that these immigrant entrepreneurs have to offer. We have already recorded 15 of the entrepreneur stories and are ready to work on the book and podcasts!

Today's political climate is charged and the future of immigration in the United States is in flux. What is certain however, is that those immigrants who are here are among the most entrepreneurial individuals in our nation. They create new companies, provide jobs, and contribute to their communities in countless ways. This project will not only highlight their contributions, it will be an inspirational resource for anyone who has a desire to know what it takes to succeed as an entrepreneur in our nation. 

Why a book, video and podcast?

Since the publication of Green Card Voices’ award-winning, first book “Green Card YOUTH Voices: Immigration Stories from a Minneapolis High School,” we have seen the value of having these stories accessible in a written format. Our first book is being used in classrooms, is required reading at universities, and graces the bookshelves of bookstores around Minnesota! For our impact to be as broad as it can be, it is critical that we use all the types of mediums available.

We want to expand our book + video project to include a podcast series as well. With a podcast, people can learn from these entrepreneurial experts on the go! 

The book, videos, and podcasts will inspire and educate other entrepreneurs as they embark on their own journeys!

The project will include:

  • 30 narratives written by immigrant entrepreneurs
  • Full page, color portraits of each immigrant
  • A link to the entrepreneur’s VIDEO interview on the GCV website
  • A link to the entrepreneur’s PODCAST interview
  • A highlighted quote from the personal essay

Revenue earned through the sales of the books will be used to contribute to the long-term sustainability and programming of Green Card Voices.

 

See a sneak peek of the interior below:

 

Why entrepreneurs?

Here are the facts:

“From 1996 to 2011, the business startup rate of immigrants increased by more than 50 percent, while the native-born startup rate declined by 10 percent, to a 30-year low. Immigrants today are more than twice as likely to start a business as native-born citizens...Despite accounting for only about 13 percent of the population, immigrants now start more than a quarter of new businesses in this country.” - Inc.com “The Most Entrepreneurial Group in America Wasn't Born in America”, 2015.

In Minnesota specifically:

“Immigrants comprise 7% of the state’s population but 9% of the workforce. In six industry sectors and 17 occupations, both higher- and lower- skilled, immigrants comprise more than one quarter of the workforce” -  Minnesota Chamber of Commerce “The Economic Contributions of Immigrants in Minnesota”, 2013.

What about immigrants makes them such successful entrepreneurs? Researchers cite immigrants’ risk propensity, unique knowledge, and access to transnational resources and networks. Immigrant entrepreneur Des Deshpande of India attributes immigrants’ entrepreneurial propensity to “out-of-the-box” thinking, which he says is natural from someone who is “out-of-the-box.”

We have so much to learn from their drive, and we believe the podcasts, videos, and book will go a long way towards sharing that knowledge.

 

Why now?

This past year has seen some of the most negative immigrant rhetoric to date. In the current climate, it is more important than ever to use individual accounts to highlight the lives lived and contributions made to our nation. At Green Card Voices, we believe stories are a critical part of this movement.

Why you?

We can’t make this book without your support.

By helping fund this project, you are joining us in creating a culture of empathy that will work to build a nation where all voices are heard and valued.

What We Need:

Green Card Voices is a small 501(c)3 nonprofit with a limited budget. Funds raised in this campaign will go towards:

  • Recording the 15 remaining immigrant entrepreneur stories
  • Printing the first 1,500 full-color books
  • Video editing and podcast creationg
  • Copy editing
  • Video Editor/Book Designer
  • Managing Editor
  • Marketing

Our first priorities are recording the remaining stories, the printing costs, and copy editing. These costs are non-negotiable and 100% necessary to make the book happen. If we don't reach our goal, we will raise the funds for staff time and marketing through other avenues.

 

About Green Card Voices:

Launched in 2013, Green Card Voices utilizes digital storytelling to share personal narratives of America’s immigrants, fostering tolerance and establishing a better understanding between immigrant and nonimmigrant populations.

Using web-based video storytelling, touring exhibits, and now launching a brand new book series, Green Card Voices aims to help people see the ‘wave of immigrants’ as individuals, with interesting stories of family, hard work, and cultural diversity. Our dynamic, multimedia platform is designed to empower individuals, community groups, and educational institutions alike.

As participants in a movement calling for increased representation of real immigrant stories in the media, we provide immigrants with a platform to tell their own stories, in exactly the ways they want them to be heard.

 

We really can’t do this without you!

 

Every dollar counts, so we appreciate whatever contribution you are able to make! If you can’t donate financially, there are many other ways to get involved.

We’d love to hear from you, so go ahead and leave us a comment if you like what we’re doing. Most importantly, please share this campaign with your friends, families, coworkers, and social media networks! You can find us on Facebook and Twitter to stay updated with the campaign and other events. And be sure to check back here over the next 60 days— we’ll be posting updates every step of the way.

 

Past Successful Projects:

  • “Green Card YOUTH Voices” Book Series: Minneapolis, MN; Fargo, ND; and St. Paul, MN editions.
    • GOLD MEDAL- Multicultural Nonfiction Chapter Book - Moonbeam Children’s Book Awards
    • Sold over 1,500 copies in 6 months
    • Successfully funded through an Indiegogo campaign!

  • “Voices of Immigrant Storytellers: Teaching Guide for Middle and High Schools”
    • Teaching resource using 11 of Green Card Voices’ online video stories

  • 5 Traveling Exhibits of immigrant stories from​: Fargo, ND; Minneapolis, MN; St. Cloud, MN; and Willmar, MN
  • Recorded over 300 stories from immigrants from over 100 different countries

What people have said about Green Card Voices:

“I just wanted to express my gratitude for giving me the opportunity to interview with you and share my story. I really enjoyed meeting you and the rest of the group. You made me feel very welcomed. I really appreciate the work that you all are doing and I am very happy that I could help.”— Irma Marquez Trapero, Paralegal, immigrant from Mexico

“Every story held powerful life lessons for me—and I think all readers may have the same experience. This fantastic collection of memories, hopes, and dreams will inspire readers to never forgot that we all are truly “in this together.” —Mark Ritchie, former secretary of state of Minnesota

“You have succeeded in moving the discussion to a very human level, which is where it should be. People and their pictures tell their stories, not some hothead on TV or radio. Well done.” — Anonymous, Hosmer library visitor Minnesota

“As an immigrant to this country I’m happy that someone is documenting immigrant stories regardless of their ethnic or national origin, as immigrants should be considered as “ambassadors of wealth” to their adopted communities." —Ramón León, Founder, President, and CEO, Latino Economic Development Center

 

www.greencardvoices.org

A highlighted quote from the personal essay
Revenue earned through the sales of the books will be used to contribute to the long-term sustainability and programming of Green Card Voices. See a sneak peek of the interior below: Why entrepreneurs?Here are the facts:“From 1996 to 2011, the business startup rate of immigrants increased by more than 50 percent, while the native-born startup rate declined by 10 percent, to a 30-year low. Immigrants today are more than twice as likely to start a business as native-born citizens...Despite accounting for only about 13 percent of the population, immigrants now start more than a quarter of new businesses in this country.” - Inc.com “The Most Entrepreneurial Group in America Wasn't Born in America”, 2015.In Minnesota specifically:“Immigrants comprise 7% of the state’s population but 9% of the workforce. In six industry sectors and 17 occupations, both higher- and lower- skilled, immigrants comprise more than one quarter of the workforce” -  Minnesota Chamber of Commerce “The Economic Contributions of Immigrants in Minnesota”, 2013.What about immigrants makes them such successful entrepreneurs? Researchers cite immigrants’ risk propensity, unique knowledge, and access to transnational resources and networks. Immigrant entrepreneur Des Deshpande of India attributes immigrants’ entrepreneurial propensity to “out-of-the-box” thinking, which he says is natural from someone who is “out-of-the-box.”We have so much to learn from their drive, and we believe the podcasts, videos, and book will go a long way towards sharing that knowledge. Why now?This past year has seen some of the most negative immigrant rhetoric to date. In the current climate, it is more important than ever to use individual accounts to highlight the lives lived and contributions made to our nation. At Green Card Voices, we believe stories are a critical part of this movement.Why you?We can’t make this book without your support.By helping fund this project, you are joining us in creating a culture of empathy that will work to build a nation where all voices are heard and valued.What We Need:Green Card Voices is a small 501(c)3 nonprofit with a limited budget. Funds raised in this campaign will go towards:
Recording the 15 remaining immigrant entrepreneur stories
Printing the first 1,500 full-color books
Video editing and podcast creationg
Copy editing
Video Editor/Book Designer
Managing Editor
Marketing
Our first priorities are recording the remaining stories, the printing costs, and copy editing. These costs are non-negotiable and 100% necessary to make the book happen. If we don't reach our goal, we will raise the funds for staff time and marketing through other avenues.

 About Green Card Voices:Launched in 2013, Green Card Voices utilizes digital storytelling to share personal narratives of America’s immigrants, fostering tolerance and establishing a better understanding between immigrant and nonimmigrant populations.Using web-based video storytelling, touring exhibits, and now launching a brand new book series, Green Card Voices aims to help people see the ‘wave of immigrants’ as individuals, with interesting stories of family, hard work, and cultural diversity. Our dynamic, multimedia platform is designed to empower individuals, community groups, and educational institutions alike.As participants in a movement calling for increased representation of real immigrant stories in the media, we provide immigrants with a platform to tell their own stories, in exactly the ways they want them to be heard. We really can’t do this without you! Every dollar counts, so we appreciate whatever contribution you are able to make! If you can’t donate financially, there are many other ways to get involved.We’d love to hear from you, so go ahead and leave us a comment if you like what we’re doing. Most importantly, please share this campaign with your friends, families, coworkers, and social media networks! You can find us on Facebook and Twitter to stay updated with the campaign and other events. And be sure to check back here over the next 60 days— we’ll be posting updates every step of the way. Past Successful Projects:
“Green Card YOUTH Voices” Book Series: Minneapolis, MN; Fargo, ND; and St. Paul, MN editions.
GOLD MEDAL- Multicultural Nonfiction Chapter Book - Moonbeam Children’s Book Awards
Sold over 1,500 copies in 6 months
Successfully funded through an Indiegogo campaign!


“Voices of Immigrant Storytellers: Teaching Guide for Middle and High Schools”Teaching resource using 11 of Green Card Voices’ online video stories


5 Traveling Exhibits of immigrant stories from​: Fargo, ND; Minneapolis, MN; St. Cloud, MN; and Willmar, MN
Recorded over 300 stories from immigrants from over 100 different countries
What people have said about Green Card Voices:“I just wanted to express my gratitude for giving me the opportunity to interview with you and share my story. I really enjoyed meeting you and the rest of the group. You made me feel very welcomed. I really appreciate the work that you all are doing and I am very happy that I could help.”— Irma Marquez Trapero, Paralegal, immigrant from Mexico“Every story held powerful life lessons for me—and I think all readers may have the same experience. This fantastic collection of memories, hopes, and dreams will inspire readers to never forgot that we all are truly “in this together.” —Mark Ritchie, former secretary of state of Minnesota“You have succeeded in moving the discussion to a very human level, which is where it should be. People and their pictures tell their stories, not some hothead on TV or radio. Well done.” — Anonymous, Hosmer library visitor Minnesota“As an immigrant to this country I’m happy that someone is documenting immigrant stories regardless of their ethnic or national origin, as immigrants should be considered as “ambassadors of wealth” to their adopted communities." —Ramón León, Founder, President, and CEO, Latino Economic Development Center www.greencardvoices.org

story:
Scroll down for English!

 

Završena kampanja! 

2 načina skupljanja donacija
30 dana kampanje
107 donatora

19 435 kn skupljenih za tiskanje Reaktora ideja :)

S tim ćemo sredstvima u sljedećoj godini tiskati otprilike 1000 Reaktora ideja!

Nastavit ćemo se prijavljivati na natječaje i tražiti sredstva kojima se nadamo da ćemo učiniti ovaj projekt održivim!

Hvala svima!

 

 

 

Zašto smo pokrenuli Reaktor ideja i zašto ga tiskati?

Časopis je pokrenut zato što postoji mnogo informacija koje nam svakodnevno promiču. Studenti dobivaju pohvale; profesori započinju milijunske projekte;
održavaju se zanimljiva predavanja i radionice.

Šteta je da, kada se nešto divno događa u našoj okolini, ne čujemo za to. Tek kada dobijemo informaciju, onda biramo načine kako raspolagati tom informacijom - hoćemo li se javiti i pokušati sudjelovati u nečemu ili ćemo dobiti inspiraciju za napraviti nešto vlastito.

Časopis je odličan način za organiziranje i širenje pozitivnih informacija.
Neka se vidi da se u Hrvatskoj događaju pozitivne stvari,
a ne samo negativne koje se promoviraju putem nacionalnih medija.

Da ne bi i naš časopis bio jedna od onih informacija koja samo promakne u moru informacija, potrebno ga je tiskati i tako doprijeti do šire publike; tako tražiti potporu; tako promovirati kemijsko-inženjersku struku; tako tražiti još ljudi koji bi bili zainteresirani za pisanje i sudjelovanje u stvaranju časopisa.

 

Kakav je ovo časopis?

Reaktor ideja studentski je časopis kojim se promiče znanost, izvrsnost studenata i profesora, a promoviraju se i događaji vezani uz kemijsko-inženjersku struku i slične struke. Pišu ga studenti Fakulteta kemijskog inženjerstva i tehnologije Sveučilišta u Zagrebu (FKIT), Prehrambeno-biotehnološkog fakulteta Sveučilišta u Zagrebu (PBF) i Prirodoslovno-matematičkog fakulteta Sveučilišta u Zagrebu (PMF), ali i Kemijsko-tehnološkog fakulteta (KTF) u Splitu kao i asistenti, profesori i umirovljeni profesori s navedenih fakulteta.

 

Malo više o časopisu...

Časopis se sastoji od četiri dijela. Svaki dio ima svog urednika.

 

Kemijska posla sadrže novosti s fakulteta iz tehničkog područja 

  • izvještaje s događaja značajnih za znanstvenike i inženjere poput "Materijali u automobilskoj industriji" (FSB) ili "Dani vina na PBF-u" (PBF)
  • priče studentima i profesorima poput "Jednogodišnje iskustvo u zemlji izlazećeg sunca" ili "Izdavanje knjige  Uvod u nanotehnologiju", 
  • izvještaje s konferencija poput "Simpozij studenata kemičara" (PMF) ili "Hranom do zdravlja" (PTF Osijek),
  • izvještaje sa stručnih putovanja na koje idu studenti poput "Posjet Nuklearnoj elektrani Krško",
  • pa i poneke motivacijske članke poput "Kako se motivirati i uživati u studiranju"

Urednica Kemijskih posla je ujedno i glavna urednica časopisa, Ines Topalović.

Znanstvenik na jednostavan način prikazuje znanstvene teme kroz znanstveno-popularne članke. Studenti se prvi put susreću s nečim što će im jednog dana biti važno u znanstvenoj karijeri, a to je objavljivanje članaka.

  • Objašnjavaju se stvari za koje svi znaju, a rijetki znaju kako funkcioniraju u člancima poput "Princip rada klima uređaja" ili "Katalizator u automobilima"
  • Donosi se pregled novosti iz svijeta znanosti i industrije člancima poput "Slatki uspjeh biobaterija"
  • Objašnjavaju se fenomeni u prirodi kroz članke poput "Mpemba efekt"
  • Donose se priče iz života znanstvenika u člancima poput "Thomas Midgley - izumitelj olovnog benzina i freona"
  • Izlažu se teme za koje su studenti osvojili Rektorove nagrade u člancima poput "Ilegalno pranje goriva" ili "Razvoj i optimizacija one-pot metode"

Urednik Znanstvenika je ujedno i predsjednik Studentske sekcije HDKI-ja, Stjepan Džalto

Boje inženjerstva donose teme iz sveučilišnog sporta.

  • Objavljuju se izvještaji sa sveučilišnih prvenstava iz svih sportova
  • Pišu se izvještaji o uspjesima na natjecanjima poput Tehnologijade člancima poput "FKIT šesti put za redom pobjednik Tehnologijade"

Urednica Boja inženjerstva bila je do sada naša grafička urednica Barbara Farkaš, a trenutno tražimo novog sportskog urednika.

Stand-up kemičar je zabavni dio u kojem se mogu pronaći sadržaji za opuštanje:

  • Šale poput "Koju pjesmu sluša polimer kad prekine s curom? - Pokidat ću lance sve",
  • Osmosmjerke,
  • Križaljke,
  • Zabavne činjenice,
  • Nagradni zadaci i slično

Urednica Stand-up kemičara je Iva Pavičić

 

Čitanost

Časopis se do sada objavljivao isključivo u elektroničkom obliku jednom mjesečno na stranicama FKIT-a, na društvenim mrežama Studentske sekcije HDKI-ja te na stranici HDKI-ja. Planirano je izdavanje 10 brojeva časopisa po akademskoj godini (jednom mjesečno).

Prvi broj časopisa objavljen je 4. travnja i čitan je preko 500 puta.
Drugi broj objavljen je 4. svibnja i čitan je preko 700 puta.
Treći broj objavljen je 5. lipnja i čitan je preko 1100 puta.
Četvrti broj objavljen je 6. studenog i do sada je čitan 1200 puta. 

Osim u Lijepoj našoj, Reaktor ideja se čita i u Australiji, SAD-u, Španjolskoj, Portugalu, Francuskoj, Njemačkoj, Češkoj, Nizozemskoj, Latviji, Bosni i Hercegovini, Irskoj, Ujedinjenom kraljevstvu pa čak i u dalekoj Indiji. U Indiji nije pročitan sasvim slučajno. Ostvarena je suradnja sa studentima kemijskog inženjerstva u Indiji i o njima je bio napisan članak u trećem broju Reaktora ideja.

 

Što će nam 3000 $ omogućiti?

Otkad je pokrenut časopis, cilj uredničkog tima je tiskanje časopisa i dopiranje do šire publike. Zbog toga smo se prijavili na:

  1. natječaj Studentskog zbora Sveučilišta u Zagrebu na kojem smo dobili 4395 kn.
  2. natječaj Zaklade Adris, ali nažalost nismo prošli.
  3. natječaj Hrvatskih voda, odgovor se čeka.

 3000 $ (otprilike 20 000 kn) dostatno je za tiskanje 100 primjeraka časopisa u boji svaki mjesec, sljedećih 10 mjeseci tj. cijelu 2018. godinu. Trenutno je u postupku odlučivanje je li isplativije tiskati veći broj crno-bijelog časopisa (jeftinije verzije). O tome će svi donatori biti obaviješteni.

U slučaju da ne dobijemo zadovoljavajuća financijska sredstva postoje tri ishoda:

  1.  Časopis će se tiskati crno-bijelo s koricama u boji;
  2. Morat ćemo uvesti pretplate i plaćanje časopisa (napominjemo da je časopis besplatan)
  3. Nećemo moći tiskati časopis.

Ako dobijemo više, to će omogućiti

  1. Tiskanje većeg broja časopisa
  2. Financiranje održavanja radionica Studentske sekcije i drugih projekata

Dodatna financijska sredstva nastojat ćemo dobiti kroz druge natječaje i objavljivanje oglasa u časopisu. Za oglašavanje se možete javiti na inestop1012@gmail.com.

 

Tko smo mi i zašto nas podržati?

Reaktor ideja najveći je projekt Studentske sekcije Hrvatskog Društva Kemijskih Inženjera i tehnologa.

Studentska sekcija osnovana je krajem 2016. godine, a počela je s radom u ožujku 2017. godine. Nadamo se da smo potaknuli pozitivne promjene na Fakultetu kemijskog inženjerstva i tehnologije jer to i jest naš cilj. Rado bismo utjecali i na nacionalnoj razini, ali nismo dovoljno jaki za to.

Ostvarili smo mnogobrojne uspješne projekte:

Predavanja

  1. Kako napisati projekt (15.03.2017.) uz 45 prisutnih studenata. Na krilima ovog predavanja osvojili smo 8000 kn za 3 projekta (Reaktor ideja 4395, Međusmjerovske igre 3000 i Ciklus predavanja o 3D printanju 600 kn)
  2. FKIT-ovci na razmjenama studenata (24.04.2017.) uz prisutnih 77 studenata. Nadamo se da će ovo predavanje rezultirati povećanjem broja FKIT-ovaca koji idu na razmjene studenata.
  3. Što nakon faksa? (17.05.2017.) uz prisutnih 160 studenata. S ovog predavanja dobili smo znanja o tome što rade kemijski inženjeri i čuli smo vrijedna iskustva bivših FKIT-ovaca.
  4. CIKLUS PREDAVANJA I RADIONICA 3D PRINTANJA (21.11.2017. - 19.12.2017.). Ovo je projekt koji upravo počinje i interes za predavanja i radionice iskazalo je preko 250 studenata.

Stručne ekskurzije

  1. Posjet tvornici Drava International d.o.o. u Osijeku (11.05.2017.). Otprilike 25 članova Studentske sekcije putovalo je u Osijek uz potporu prof. dr. sc. Zlate Hrnjak-Murgić.
  2. Posjet Nuklearnoj elektrani Krško u Krško (12.10.2017.). 48 članova Studentske sekcije posjetilo je NEK uz sponzorstvo Elektrane. 

Buddy projekt za brucoše
Od ove godine, po prvi put na FKIT-u, provodimo buddy projekt za mentorstvo brucošima. otprilike 50 starijih studenata uključeno je u projekt i svaki od njih dobio je 4-5 brucoša koje cijelu godinu treba savjetovati oko kolegija i davati im upute za razne nedoumice koje se javljaju na prvoj godini studija: "Kako koristiti iksicu", "Kako prijaviti ispit", "Gdje je koja učionica" itd.

Međusmjerovske igre 2017.
Održali smo prvi sportski dan Fakulteta kemijskog inženjerstva i tehnologije 23.10. po lošem vremenu. Kiša nije onemogućila održavanje sportskih natjecanja s mnogobrojnim prisutnima i uz opće veselje. Prvih troje u svakom sportu, a igralo se 10 sportova, dobilo je medalje i druge sponzorske nagrade, a najbolji smjer (studij) osvojio je pehar. Ove je godine pobjednik bio KI.

Radionice
Osim navedenih radionica o 3D printanju koje se održavaju od 21.11. do 19.12., pripremaju se još dvije radionice (radionica o Matlabu i radionica o EU projektima).

Projekti promocije znanosti
U pripremi su tri različita projekta promocije znanosti.

Djed Božićnjak na FKIT-u
Super tajni projekt u pripremi.

 

Kako pomoći na drugi način

  1. Donacija može ići direktno na račun: 
    Hrvatsko društvo kemijskih inženjera i tehnologa,
    Berislavićeva 6/I, 10000 Zagreb. 
    IBAN: HR5323600001101367680, Zagrebačka banka
    opis plaćanja "Donacija za Studentsku sekciju"
  2. ​Recite svojim prijateljima za kampanju
  3. Dijelite objave preko društvenih mreža
  4. Širite glas putem medija
  5. Pišite za naš časopis
  6. Reklamirajte svoje tvrtke u našem časopisu! U četvrtom broju časopisa objavljene su tri reklame, neka Vaša bude sljedeća. Za informacije o oglašavanju javite se na inestop1012@gmail.com

......................................................................................................

Reactor of Ideas – the initial motivation and what stands behind the desire of putting it in the press

 

Purpose of magazine Reactor of Ideas (Reaktor ideja), initiated and being run completely by students from Student Section of Croatian Society of Chemical Engineers, is to provide simple path to approach important information which people often overlook, or are not familiarized with them at all. We talk about secial prizes and acknowledgments, different lectures and workshops, and even new projects worth millions of dollars.

 

We usually fail to observe and listen what is happening around us while in the same time we are forgetting that, in order to utilize the advantages of different information, firstly we have to be aware they exist. If we don’t know for a specific lecture, we cannot know if we want to attend it and moreover, we can miss a great opportunity to meet influential people and get the inspiration to create something of our own.

 

A magazine is among the best ways for organizing and spreading useful information. Our goal is to do as much as possible to bring the positive news closer to the broad public and eventually overcome all the negative reports national media serves on a daily basis.

 

We don’t want Reactor of Ideas to get lost in the myriad of everyday publications, we want it to make an impact, to be heard, and that is where putting it in press could make a difference. That way it would reach wider audience, attract new imaginative individuals for further growth and even better ideas, and, the most important, the success in the promotion and support of science would be inevitable.

 

What kind of a magazine is this?

Reaktor ideja is a magazine written by students, but intended for everyone involved in science. It promotes science, excellence of students and professors, and events connected to chemical engineering and similar fields of science. It is written by students and professors of Faculty of chemical engineering and technology, University of Zagreb, Croatia and by students of related Faculties (PBF Zagreb, PMF Zagreb and KTF Split).

 

A little more about this student magazine...

The magazine is divided into four parts. Each part has an editor in charge.

Kemijska posla (Chemical business) contains articles from faculties of technical studies

  • We bring reports from events important to scientists and engineers like “Materials in automobile industry” (FSB) or “The days of wine on PBF” (PBF)
  • It includes  inspiring stories from lives of students and professors like “One year experience in the Land of the rising sun” or “Publishing of the book Nanotechnology 1.01”
  • Here you can find reports from conferences like “Symposium of chemistry students” (PMF) or “With food to health” (PTF Osijek),
  • Reports from trips to Nuclear power plants, refineries etc.
  • And also motivation articles like “How to motivate yourself and enjoy studying”

Ines Topalović is the editor of Chemical business.

Znanstvenik (Scientist) presents scientific topics in a way everyone can understand through popular articles. Here, students meet with a concept very important for their careers – publishing scientific articles.

  • Here we explain the science behind things familiar to everyone in articles like “How does air conditioning work?” or “Catalyst in automobiles”
  • We bring news from science and industry in articles like “Sweet success of biobatteries”
  • We explain natural phenomena in articles like “Mpemba effect”
  • We bring stories from lives of scientists in articles like “Thomas Midgley – inventor of lead gasoline and freons”
  • We show scientific researches carried out by students in articles like “Illegal gasoline washing” and “Development and optimization of one-pot method”

Stjepan Džalto is the editor of Scientist.

Boje inženjerstva (Colors of engineering) bring university sport closer to people.

  • Reports of university championships are brought to you by Colors of engineering
  • Articles about competitions like Tehnologijada in articles like “FKIT, winner of Tehnologijada for the 6th time in a row”

Editor of Colors of engineering is Barbara Farkaš.

Stand-up kemičar (Stand-up chemist) is the part for relaxation where you can find content like

  • Jokes like “What is the chemical version of the song from the movie Lion king? – HCOONa matata”
  • Cross-word puzzles
  • Fun facts
  • Reward assignments

Editor of Stand-up chemist is Iva Pavičić

 

Readership

This magazine is being published monthly on web pages of FKIT, Student section of HDKI and HDKI. 10 issues are planned every year.

First number of the magazine was published 4th April and was read over 500 times.
Second number was published 4th May and was read over 700 times.
Third number was published 5th June and was read over 1100 times.
Fourth number was published 6th July and was read over 1200 times.

Reactor of ideas is read (besides in Croatia) in Australia, USA, Spain, Portugal, France, Germany, Czech Republic, Netherlands, Lithuania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Ireland, UK and also India.

It is not a coincidence India made the list. Cooperation with Indian chemical engineering students was established and an article about them was written in the third issue of Reactor of ideas.

 

What will 3000 $ provide?

From the beginning, editorial team’s goal was “throwing” it in the press to reach wider audience. Because of that, we applied Reactor of ideas project to:

  1. Student council of UNIZG Fund and got around 500 $
  2. Adris Grup Fund and were unfortunately declined
  3. Croatian waters Fund and we are waiting for the answer.

3000 $ will be enough to provide 100 copies of the magazine every month for the next 10 months (the whole 2018.).

In case we don’t reach the goal, there are three possible outcomes:

  1. Magazine will be printed black and white
  2. We will need to start charging for the magazine (magazine is free now!!)
  3. We will not be able to print the magazine

If we get more than 3000 $, it will enable us to:

  1. Print more magazines
  2. Finance our workshops, lectures and other projects

We are continually trying to get additional funding through other sources, like through publishing advertisements in our magazine. For publishing advertisements, contact inestop1012@gmail.com

Who are we and why support us?

Reaktor ideja (Reactor of ideas) is the biggest project of Student section of Croatian society of chemical engineers.

Student section started with its work in March 2017. We hope that we initiated positive changes in the chemical engineering community because that is our goal. We would love to have a global impact, but we are not strong enough.

We accomplished many successful projects:

Lectures:

  1. How to write a project (15th March 2017.) – lecture with 45 participants. On the wings of this lecture, we won around 1200 $ for three of our projects (Reactor of ideas, 1. Sport day of Faculty of chemical engineering and technology and Cycle of 3D printing lectures
  2. Chemical engineering students on student exchange (24th April 2017.) with 77 participants. We hope this lecture will result by increasing the number of students going on student exchange programmes.
  3. What do chemical engineers do? (17th May 2017.) with 160 students present. On this lecture, we heard experiences from 5 graduated chemical engineers
  4. Cycle of lectures and workshops for 3D printing (21st November 2017. – 19th December 2017) – these lectures will be posted on YouTube and you will be notified

Buddy project for freshmen
This year, we started a buddy project for mentoring freshmen. Around 50 older students are buddies for 4-5 freshmen each. They are giving them advice on how to solve many obstacles that students have on their first year: “How to use student ID”, “How to apply for an exam”, etc.

1st sport day of Faculty of chemical engineering and technology
This October, we held the first sport day of Faculty of chemical engineering and technology. It rained but that didn’t stop us. We moved the contest indoors and held every sport as planned. It was a new experience for us, but it went great.

Workshops
Beside from Cycle of lectures and workshops for 3D printing, we are preparing Matlab and EU project workshops.

Promotion of science projects
We are preparing three different projects to promote science in high schools.

Santa Claus on Faculty of chemical engineering and technology
This super-secret project is being prepared.

 

How to help in other ways

  1. Donation can go directly to our account:
    Croatian society of chemical engineers (HDKI),
    IBAN: HR5323600001101367680, Zagrebacka bank
    SWIFT: ZABAHR2X
    Berislaviceva 6/I, 10 000 Zagreb,
    with note "Dontion for Student section"
  2. Tell your friends about the campaign
  3. Share our campaign on social networks
  4. Spread the voice into every media
  5. Write for our magazine
  6. Put your company’s advertisement in our magazine! By putting adds, you help us to print this magazine

 

Perks:

5 $ - Thank you for your contribution: We owe our each backer extreme gratitude! With every penny we come closer to our goal!

10 $ - Reactor of ideas - Our magazine is free, and we will share it among our contributors, but if you want to make sure one of the free copies comes to you, take this perk :)

45 $ - 6x Reactor of ideas - With this perk, you get Reactor of ideas till the end of academic year 2017./18

100 $ - Advertisement in Reactor of ideas - Your company gets a chance to put an advertisement in our magazine - Size A4, color printed, and with this, you get 3 copies of the magazine.

More perks will be discovered soon...

story_txt:
Scroll down for English!
 
Završena kampanja! 
2 načina skupljanja donacija30 dana kampanje107 donatora
19 435 kn skupljenih za tiskanje Reaktora ideja :)
S tim ćemo sredstvima u sljedećoj godini tiskati otprilike 1000 Reaktora ideja!
Nastavit ćemo se prijavljivati na natječaje i tražiti sredstva kojima se nadamo da ćemo učiniti ovaj projekt održivim!
Hvala svima!

 
 

 
Zašto smo pokrenuli Reaktor ideja i zašto ga tiskati?
Časopis je pokrenut zato što postoji mnogo informacija koje nam svakodnevno promiču. Studenti dobivaju pohvale; profesori započinju milijunske projekte;održavaju se zanimljiva predavanja i radionice.
Šteta je da, kada se nešto divno događa u našoj okolini, ne čujemo za to. Tek kada dobijemo informaciju, onda biramo načine kako raspolagati tom informacijom - hoćemo li se javiti i pokušati sudjelovati u nečemu ili ćemo dobiti inspiraciju za napraviti nešto vlastito.
Časopis je odličan način za organiziranje i širenje pozitivnih informacija.Neka se vidi da se u Hrvatskoj događaju pozitivne stvari,a ne samo negativne koje se promoviraju putem nacionalnih medija.
Da ne bi i naš časopis bio jedna od onih informacija koja samo promakne u moru informacija, potrebno ga je tiskati i tako doprijeti do šire publike; tako tražiti potporu; tako promovirati kemijsko-inženjersku struku; tako tražiti još ljudi koji bi bili zainteresirani za pisanje i sudjelovanje u stvaranju časopisa.
 
Kakav je ovo časopis?
Reaktor ideja studentski je časopis kojim se promiče znanost, izvrsnost studenata i profesora, a promoviraju se i događaji vezani uz kemijsko-inženjersku struku i slične struke. Pišu ga studenti Fakulteta kemijskog inženjerstva i tehnologije Sveučilišta u Zagrebu (FKIT), Prehrambeno-biotehnološkog fakulteta Sveučilišta u Zagrebu (PBF) i Prirodoslovno-matematičkog fakulteta Sveučilišta u Zagrebu (PMF), ali i Kemijsko-tehnološkog fakulteta (KTF) u Splitu kao i asistenti, profesori i umirovljeni profesori s navedenih fakulteta.
 
Malo više o časopisu...
Časopis se sastoji od četiri dijela. Svaki dio ima svog urednika.
 

Kemijska posla sadrže novosti s fakulteta iz tehničkog područja 

izvještaje s događaja značajnih za znanstvenike i inženjere poput "Materijali u automobilskoj industriji" (FSB) ili "Dani vina na PBF-u" (PBF)
priče studentima i profesorima poput "Jednogodišnje iskustvo u zemlji izlazećeg sunca" ili "Izdavanje knjige  Uvod u nanotehnologiju", 
izvještaje s konferencija poput "Simpozij studenata kemičara" (PMF) ili "Hranom do zdravlja" (PTF Osijek),
izvještaje sa stručnih putovanja na koje idu studenti poput "Posjet Nuklearnoj elektrani Krško",
pa i poneke motivacijske članke poput "Kako se motivirati i uživati u studiranju"

Urednica Kemijskih posla je ujedno i glavna urednica časopisa, Ines Topalović.

Znanstvenik na jednostavan način prikazuje znanstvene teme kroz znanstveno-popularne članke. Studenti se prvi put susreću s nečim što će im jednog dana biti važno u znanstvenoj karijeri, a to je objavljivanje članaka.

Objašnjavaju se stvari za koje svi znaju, a rijetki znaju kako funkcioniraju u člancima poput "Princip rada klima uređaja" ili "Katalizator u automobilima"
Donosi se pregled novosti iz svijeta znanosti i industrije člancima poput "Slatki uspjeh biobaterija"
Objašnjavaju se fenomeni u prirodi kroz članke poput "Mpemba efekt"
Donose se priče iz života znanstvenika u člancima poput "Thomas Midgley - izumitelj olovnog benzina i freona"
Izlažu se teme za koje su studenti osvojili Rektorove nagrade u člancima poput "Ilegalno pranje goriva" ili "Razvoj i optimizacija one-pot metode"

Urednik Znanstvenika je ujedno i predsjednik Studentske sekcije HDKI-ja, Stjepan Džalto

Boje inženjerstva donose teme iz sveučilišnog sporta.

Objavljuju se izvještaji sa sveučilišnih prvenstava iz svih sportova
Pišu se izvještaji o uspjesima na natjecanjima poput Tehnologijade člancima poput "FKIT šesti put za redom pobjednik Tehnologijade"

Urednica Boja inženjerstva bila je do sada naša grafička urednica Barbara Farkaš, a trenutno tražimo novog sportskog urednika.


Stand-up kemičar je zabavni dio u kojem se mogu pronaći sadržaji za opuštanje:

Šale poput "Koju pjesmu sluša polimer kad prekine s curom? - Pokidat ću lance sve",
Osmosmjerke,
Križaljke,
Zabavne činjenice,
Nagradni zadaci i slično

Urednica Stand-up kemičara je Iva Pavičić
 
Čitanost
Časopis se do sada objavljivao isključivo u elektroničkom obliku jednom mjesečno na stranicama FKIT-a, na društvenim mrežama Studentske sekcije HDKI-ja te na stranici HDKI-ja. Planirano je izdavanje 10 brojeva časopisa po akademskoj godini (jednom mjesečno).
Prvi broj časopisa objavljen je 4. travnja i čitan je preko 500 puta.Drugi broj objavljen je 4. svibnja i čitan je preko 700 puta.Treći broj objavljen je 5. lipnja i čitan je preko 1100 puta.Četvrti broj objavljen je 6. studenog i do sada je čitan 1200 puta. 
Osim u Lijepoj našoj, Reaktor ideja se čita i u Australiji, SAD-u, Španjolskoj, Portugalu, Francuskoj, Njemačkoj, Češkoj, Nizozemskoj, Latviji, Bosni i Hercegovini, Irskoj, Ujedinjenom kraljevstvu pa čak i u dalekoj Indiji. U Indiji nije pročitan sasvim slučajno. Ostvarena je suradnja sa studentima kemijskog inženjerstva u Indiji i o njima je bio napisan članak u trećem broju Reaktora ideja.
 
Što će nam 3000 $ omogućiti?
Otkad je pokrenut časopis, cilj uredničkog tima je tiskanje časopisa i dopiranje do šire publike. Zbog toga smo se prijavili na:

natječaj Studentskog zbora Sveučilišta u Zagrebu na kojem smo dobili 4395 kn.
natječaj Zaklade Adris, ali nažalost nismo prošli.
natječaj Hrvatskih voda, odgovor se čeka.

 3000 $ (otprilike 20 000 kn) dostatno je za tiskanje 100 primjeraka časopisa u boji svaki mjesec, sljedećih 10 mjeseci tj. cijelu 2018. godinu. Trenutno je u postupku odlučivanje je li isplativije tiskati veći broj crno-bijelog časopisa (jeftinije verzije). O tome će svi donatori biti obaviješteni.
U slučaju da ne dobijemo zadovoljavajuća financijska sredstva postoje tri ishoda:

 Časopis će se tiskati crno-bijelo s koricama u boji;
Morat ćemo uvesti pretplate i plaćanje časopisa (napominjemo da je časopis besplatan)
Nećemo moći tiskati časopis.

Ako dobijemo više, to će omogućiti

Tiskanje većeg broja časopisa
Financiranje održavanja radionica Studentske sekcije i drugih projekata

Dodatna financijska sredstva nastojat ćemo dobiti kroz druge natječaje i objavljivanje oglasa u časopisu. Za oglašavanje se možete javiti na inestop1012@gmail.com.
 
Tko smo mi i zašto nas podržati?

Reaktor ideja najveći je projekt Studentske sekcije Hrvatskog Društva Kemijskih Inženjera i tehnologa.
Studentska sekcija osnovana je krajem 2016. godine, a počela je s radom u ožujku 2017. godine. Nadamo se da smo potaknuli pozitivne promjene na Fakultetu kemijskog inženjerstva i tehnologije jer to i jest naš cilj. Rado bismo utjecali i na nacionalnoj razini, ali nismo dovoljno jaki za to.
Ostvarili smo mnogobrojne uspješne projekte:
Predavanja


Kako napisati projekt (15.03.2017.) uz 45 prisutnih studenata. Na krilima ovog predavanja osvojili smo 8000 kn za 3 projekta (Reaktor ideja 4395, Međusmjerovske igre 3000 i Ciklus predavanja o 3D printanju 600 kn)

FKIT-ovci na razmjenama studenata (24.04.2017.) uz prisutnih 77 studenata. Nadamo se da će ovo predavanje rezultirati povećanjem broja FKIT-ovaca koji idu na razmjene studenata.

Što nakon faksa? (17.05.2017.) uz prisutnih 160 studenata. S ovog predavanja dobili smo znanja o tome što rade kemijski inženjeri i čuli smo vrijedna iskustva bivših FKIT-ovaca.

CIKLUS PREDAVANJA I RADIONICA 3D PRINTANJA (21.11.2017. - 19.12.2017.). Ovo je projekt koji upravo počinje i interes za predavanja i radionice iskazalo je preko 250 studenata.

Stručne ekskurzije


Posjet tvornici Drava International d.o.o. u Osijeku (11.05.2017.). Otprilike 25 članova Studentske sekcije putovalo je u Osijek uz potporu prof. dr. sc. Zlate Hrnjak-Murgić.

Posjet Nuklearnoj elektrani Krško u Krško (12.10.2017.). 48 članova Studentske sekcije posjetilo je NEK uz sponzorstvo Elektrane. 

Buddy projekt za brucošeOd ove godine, po prvi put na FKIT-u, provodimo buddy projekt za mentorstvo brucošima. otprilike 50 starijih studenata uključeno je u projekt i svaki od njih dobio je 4-5 brucoša koje cijelu godinu treba savjetovati oko kolegija i davati im upute za razne nedoumice koje se javljaju na prvoj godini studija: "Kako koristiti iksicu", "Kako prijaviti ispit", "Gdje je koja učionica" itd.
Međusmjerovske igre 2017.Održali smo prvi sportski dan Fakulteta kemijskog inženjerstva i tehnologije 23.10. po lošem vremenu. Kiša nije onemogućila održavanje sportskih natjecanja s mnogobrojnim prisutnima i uz opće veselje. Prvih troje u svakom sportu, a igralo se 10 sportova, dobilo je medalje i druge sponzorske nagrade, a najbolji smjer (studij) osvojio je pehar. Ove je godine pobjednik bio KI.
RadioniceOsim navedenih radionica o 3D printanju koje se održavaju od 21.11. do 19.12., pripremaju se još dvije radionice (radionica o Matlabu i radionica o EU projektima).
Projekti promocije znanostiU pripremi su tri različita projekta promocije znanosti.
Djed Božićnjak na FKIT-uSuper tajni projekt u pripremi.
 
Kako pomoći na drugi način

Donacija može ići direktno na račun: Hrvatsko društvo kemijskih inženjera i tehnologa,Berislavićeva 6/I, 10000 Zagreb. IBAN: HR5323600001101367680, Zagrebačka bankaopis plaćanja "Donacija za Studentsku sekciju"
​Recite svojim prijateljima za kampanju
Dijelite objave preko društvenih mreža
Širite glas putem medija
Pišite za naš časopis

Reklamirajte svoje tvrtke u našem časopisu! U četvrtom broju časopisa objavljene su tri reklame, neka Vaša bude sljedeća. Za informacije o oglašavanju javite se na inestop1012@gmail.com

 
Tko je do sada sudjelovao:
Urednici:Ines TopalovićStjepan DžaltoBarbara FarkašIva Pavičić
Grafički urednici:Barbara FarkašZdenko BlažekovićToni LijićLinda KuzmanovskiKristijan Mrkalj

Krunoslav Kovačević, pročelnik Akademskog zbora Vladimir Prelog​Igor KultanAna LekićMislav MatićFilip Matijevićprof. dr. sc. Ernest Meštrović, direktor Pliva d.o.odoc. dr. sc. Tomislav Portada, znanstvenik s Instituta Ruđer Boškovićprof. dr. sc. Vesna Tomašić, profesorica na Zavodu za katalizu na FKIT-uValentina TravančićInes Topalović
Pisci za Znanstvenik:Filip BrkićMartina BudimirIvica Petar Čališ (PMF)Ana-Marija DamjanovićStjepan DžaltoBarbara FarkašAntonija GlavačMihaela GluhakLucija IvanjkoZvonimir Jukić (KTF)Nikolina Lešić (PMF)Nevena MilčićNikolina Nascimento MrakovčićTina PosediRea VeseliMarko Zubak
Pisci za Boje inženjerstva:Ivan BarišićBranka Brčić, umirovljena profesorica tjelesnog na FKIT-uBarbara FarkašMarija FucakAntun Glasnović, umirovljeni profesor sa ZMTPI na FKIT-uMartin GojunAna GudeljDominik KnapićJuraj MilačićAnamarija Mitar, asistentica na ZMTPI na FKIT-uAnamarija MrkonjićJuraj PetanjekMarko RukavinaKristina Sušac
Pisci za Stand-up kemičar:Stipe BaraćDario Dabić, asistent na Zavodu za analitičku kemiju na FKIT-uIva PavičićDominik Varga
......................................................................................................
Reactor of Ideas – the initial motivation and what stands behind the desire of putting it in the press
 
Purpose of magazine Reactor of Ideas (Reaktor ideja), initiated and being run completely by students from Student Section of Croatian Society of Chemical Engineers, is to provide simple path to approach important information which people often overlook, or are not familiarized with them at all. We talk about secial prizes and acknowledgments, different lectures and workshops, and even new projects worth millions of dollars.
 
We usually fail to observe and listen what is happening around us while in the same time we are forgetting that, in order to utilize the advantages of different information, firstly we have to be aware they exist. If we don’t know for a specific lecture, we cannot know if we want to attend it and moreover, we can miss a great opportunity to meet influential people and get the inspiration to create something of our own.
 
A magazine is among the best ways for organizing and spreading useful information. Our goal is to do as much as possible to bring the positive news closer to the broad public and eventually overcome all the negative reports national media serves on a daily basis.
 
We don’t want Reactor of Ideas to get lost in the myriad of everyday publications, we want it to make an impact, to be heard, and that is where putting it in press could make a difference. That way it would reach wider audience, attract new imaginative individuals for further growth and even better ideas, and, the most important, the success in the promotion and support of science would be inevitable.
 
What kind of a magazine is this?
Reaktor ideja is a magazine written by students, but intended for everyone involved in science. It promotes science, excellence of students and professors, and events connected to chemical engineering and similar fields of science. It is written by students and professors of Faculty of chemical engineering and technology, University of Zagreb, Croatia and by students of related Faculties (PBF Zagreb, PMF Zagreb and KTF Split).
 
A little more about this student magazine...
The magazine is divided into four parts. Each part has an editor in charge.

Kemijska posla (Chemical business) contains articles from faculties of technical studies

We bring reports from events important to scientists and engineers like “Materials in automobile industry” (FSB) or “The days of wine on PBF” (PBF)
It includes  inspiring stories from lives of students and professors like “One year experience in the Land of the rising sun” or “Publishing of the book Nanotechnology 1.01”
Here you can find reports from conferences like “Symposium of chemistry students” (PMF) or “With food to health” (PTF Osijek),
Reports from trips to Nuclear power plants, refineries etc.
And also motivation articles like “How to motivate yourself and enjoy studying”

Ines Topalović is the editor of Chemical business.

Znanstvenik (Scientist) presents scientific topics in a way everyone can understand through popular articles. Here, students meet with a concept very important for their careers – publishing scientific articles.

Here we explain the science behind things familiar to everyone in articles like “How does air conditioning work?” or “Catalyst in automobiles”
We bring news from science and industry in articles like “Sweet success of biobatteries”
We explain natural phenomena in articles like “Mpemba effect”
We bring stories from lives of scientists in articles like “Thomas Midgley – inventor of lead gasoline and freons”
We show scientific researches carried out by students in articles like “Illegal gasoline washing” and “Development and optimization of one-pot method”

Stjepan Džalto is the editor of Scientist.

Boje inženjerstva (Colors of engineering) bring university sport closer to people.

Reports of university championships are brought to you by Colors of engineering
Articles about competitions like Tehnologijada in articles like “FKIT, winner of Tehnologijada for the 6th time in a row”

Editor of Colors of engineering is Barbara Farkaš.

Stand-up kemičar (Stand-up chemist) is the part for relaxation where you can find content like

Jokes like “What is the chemical version of the song from the movie Lion king? – HCOONa matata”
Cross-word puzzles
Fun facts
Reward assignments

Editor of Stand-up chemist is Iva Pavičić
 
Readership
This magazine is being published monthly on web pages of FKIT, Student section of HDKI and HDKI. 10 issues are planned every year.
First number of the magazine was published 4th April and was read over 500 times.Second number was published 4th May and was read over 700 times.Third number was published 5th June and was read over 1100 times.Fourth number was published 6th July and was read over 1200 times.
Reactor of ideas is read (besides in Croatia) in Australia, USA, Spain, Portugal, France, Germany, Czech Republic, Netherlands, Lithuania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Ireland, UK and also India.
It is not a coincidence India made the list. Cooperation with Indian chemical engineering students was established and an article about them was written in the third issue of Reactor of ideas.
 
What will 3000 $ provide?
From the beginning, editorial team’s goal was “throwing” it in the press to reach wider audience. Because of that, we applied Reactor of ideas project to:

Student council of UNIZG Fund and got around 500 $
Adris Grup Fund and were unfortunately declined
Croatian waters Fund and we are waiting for the answer.

3000 $ will be enough to provide 100 copies of the magazine every month for the next 10 months (the whole 2018.).
In case we don’t reach the goal, there are three possible outcomes:

Magazine will be printed black and white
We will need to start charging for the magazine (magazine is free now!!)
We will not be able to print the magazine

If we get more than 3000 $, it will enable us to:

Print more magazines
Finance our workshops, lectures and other projects

We are continually trying to get additional funding through other sources, like through publishing advertisements in our magazine. For publishing advertisements, contact inestop1012@gmail.com
Who are we and why support us?
Reaktor ideja (Reactor of ideas) is the biggest project of Student section of Croatian society of chemical engineers.
Student section started with its work in March 2017. We hope that we initiated positive changes in the chemical engineering community because that is our goal. We would love to have a global impact, but we are not strong enough.
We accomplished many successful projects:
Lectures:


How to write a project (15th March 2017.) – lecture with 45 participants. On the wings of this lecture, we won around 1200 $ for three of our projects (Reactor of ideas, 1. Sport day of Faculty of chemical engineering and technology and Cycle of 3D printing lectures

Chemical engineering students on student exchange (24th April 2017.) with 77 participants. We hope this lecture will result by increasing the number of students going on student exchange programmes.

What do chemical engineers do? (17th May 2017.) with 160 students present. On this lecture, we heard experiences from 5 graduated chemical engineers

Cycle of lectures and workshops for 3D printing (21st November 2017. – 19th December 2017) – these lectures will be posted on YouTube and you will be notified

Buddy project for freshmenThis year, we started a buddy project for mentoring freshmen. Around 50 older students are buddies for 4-5 freshmen each. They are giving them advice on how to solve many obstacles that students have on their first year: “How to use student ID”, “How to apply for an exam”, etc.
1st sport day of Faculty of chemical engineering and technologyThis October, we held the first sport day of Faculty of chemical engineering and technology. It rained but that didn’t stop us. We moved the contest indoors and held every sport as planned. It was a new experience for us, but it went great.
WorkshopsBeside from Cycle of lectures and workshops for 3D printing, we are preparing Matlab and EU project workshops.
Promotion of science projectsWe are preparing three different projects to promote science in high schools.
Santa Claus on Faculty of chemical engineering and technologyThis super-secret project is being prepared.
 
How to help in other ways

story:
Short Summary

Kids watch adults make financial decisions every day, whether it’s paying for gas, shopping, or going out to eat. Financial experts agree that talking to kids about money can help them make better financial decisions as they grow up and that these conversations should start early and happen often.

As a financial professional, I know how difficult it can be to talk about money and just how important it is for kids to become money smart. But I couldn’t find a kid-friendly tool for parents and teachers to use.

So I created Liktoon's Boat, an illustrated children's book. Liktoon’s Boat is not only a magical adventure filled with colorful illustrations – it’s also a fun introduction to concepts like earning and saving money for a goal.

Liktoon's boat, uses bright colors, and familiar topics like stories, toys, and friendships to provide introduction to basic mathematical and financial concepts. In addition to helping children with their reading skills, this book introduces the important topics such as:

  • Addition and subtraction
  • Earnings and savings
  • Delayed gratification, perseverance and teamwork
  • Business principles such as entrepreneurship, profits and expenses

It's important to teach our kids to be money savvy, especially during their foundational years so that they can grow into financially responsible adults. 

Abhijit and I see "Liktoon's boat" as just the beginning. We've created a digital home for Liktoon & friends (Liktoon.com). Through Liktoon's future adventures on his boat, we would like to continue to introduce children more money related concepts. 

Here are some illustrations from the book:

Currently we are at a stage where the illustrations are almost done and we are finishing the design of the book. We are also sharing profits from this campaign with not-for-profit organizations that help promote financial literacy. 

What We Need

Please place your order today! In order to complete Liktoon's boat and print the books affordably, it's important to order in bulk. We need to sell at least 500 copies in order to get the books printed affordably and get them to you. 

Your money will go towards making this book a high quality product for your child:

  • Completion of illustrations and copy-editing
  • Book design for print and e-book formats
  • Book publishing, printing and marketing
  • Profits will be shared with organizations that promote financial literacy

Some Acknowledgements

  • Julie Scheina (Editor): This story would not have been possible without our editor - Julie Scheina. Julie's extensive experience with children's book helped us transform the initial manuscript into a well written children's story. Julie you are awesome! 
  • Rose Freeland (Illustrator, book designer):  Rose has not only converted our vision into beautiful illustrations that you see throughout this page, but she has also provided us guidance in traversing the publishing road - be it book designing, printing or copyrighting. Rose you are amazing! 
  • Julia Kleinman: At the very start of our journey, Julia provided so much information about the publishing industry and about the different steps needed to create a high quality book. 
  • Friends and family: We'd also like to thank all of our friends and family members, who read the book's drafts and provided extensive feedback. We are specially thankful to our little readers who read the book again and again and provided us invaluable inputs on how to tailor the story. 

AND we'd like to thank YOU — the person who is reading this page. You probably haven't bought your copy yet, but it means a lot that you're considering it. We are hopeful that you can get involved and join Liktoon and his friends in helping children become money smart.

The Impact

Hopefully, this books helps parents and teachers to have money conversations with kids. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is not reaching our printing minimum. We are so grateful to our readers and supporters — and are hopeful that you'll help us overcome this challenge! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand if you aren't able to contribute to the campaign. PLEASE do share this campaign with your friends who you think might be interested in this topic. We'd be so grateful if we could use this campaign to create a lot of buzz and launch a new initiative towards improving financial literacy.

story:
--- Pre-order books and support the press ---

Golias Books is very happy to launch this November with two amazing titles:

 

Diana Hamilton's The Awful Truth

and

Mark Francis Johnson's Can of Human Heat

 

Both will be available on our site and through Small Press Distribution, but we are offering them here and now as pre-orders for a $20 donation (which includes tax and shipping, of course) as a way of getting the press off to a good start. To order a book, just mouse over the item you want and click "Get this Perk." One hundred percent of what we make here will go toward publishing new books. As you can probably guess, independent publishing is a labor of love and not a cash cow. We're not looking for handouts, though—we just hoped this would be a great way to announce these new books and get people excited.

(That said, we do still have options for donating to Golias if you'd like to show your support without adding to your possessions; if you are excited about the kind of work we are doing, please feel free to click "Back It" above and enter a donation for any amount. [Though we are a registered as a nonprofit, donations are unfortunately not (yet) tax deductible. Render to Caesar what is Caesar's!])

As this pre-order sale progresses, we will be updating the campaign with more pictures and more perks, including some limited edition items to entice your support--so if you want to hold out for the million dollar items please do check back in occasionally, sign up to "follow" this campaign on Indiegogo by clicking on the heart icon above, or sign up for email updates here.

 

--- The Books ---

We are very excited to be publishing two very smart, thought-provoking, and--frankly--quite weird books: The Awful Truth, by Diana Hamilton; and Can of Human Heat, by Mark Francis Johnson. Each of these two authors are very talented and are pushing all kinds of formal and generic boundaries with their poetry and prose.

If you'd like to check them out in greater detail, we have full descriptions of each book (and some choice excerpts) available on our website--

The Awful Truth

Can of Human Heat

--as well as individual author pages for both Diana and Mark, if you'd like to read more about their past publications and accomplishments.

We've been working on these books for the better part of a year, and have put as much care into production as editorial. Each of our books is printed on recycled paper and perfect bound in Michigan by McNaughton&Gunn according to current best environmental practices, and we've special-ordered some beautiful cover stock from the venerable French Paper Company. We're proud of the way they've turned out, and excited to send them out into the world--please consider copies as gifts for any of those in your life who like fine books or good poetry.

 

--- Merch and Special Perks ---

There is more to life than fine books of good poetry, however, and over the course of this "campaign" we will be offering some other items to help raise money to support the press. Not all of the details are set in stone yet, but we're planning for some tote bags, some small-run print artifacts of various kinds, and--very likely--some more books. Please check the "updates" tab as the month progresses for more information about what we are offering.

  • To begin with, at least, we are offering a very sumptuous and desirable tote bag emblazoned with the Golias logo (mascot?), designed by the sixteenth-century engraver François Desprez. The bags are produced and printed in the USA by Enviro-Tote (great company, look 'em up), and are made of nice, heavy-weight cotton canvas. You will appreciate it as a tote that stands out among totes; we'll post pics once the prototypes have arrived.
  • Please check back or "follow" this campaign to hear about any further items as we roll them out.

 

--- A final word ---

We got into this game to support authors whose work we thought was truly remarkable, and if you would like to support either of our authors directly, please contact us by email and we will gratefully help you work something out. We are always happy to entertain suggestions for in-kind or otherwise unconventional support, and we are especially interested in ways to support our authors' travel for readings and book tours.

 

--- About Golias Books ---

Golias Books seeks to promote and circulate poetry that avails itself of a diverse array of registers, modes, genres, and formal possibilities—poetry that traffics in the remoter realms of what has traditionally been called poetics. We are interested in longer poems that develop more extended narrative or discursive arcs than that of the dilatory epiphany, in poetry as argument or architecture or assemblage, in poetry that means and does rather than poetry that expresses. At the same time, while the lessons of the previous few generations' emphasis on experimentation are well taken, we seek to explore an intuition that something of value may have been lost along with the earlier humanisms' concern ethical, political, and aesthetic judgment; therefore, while abjuring reactionary or conservative atavisms, we are interested in revitalizing historical poetic forms that may help us expand the narrow demesne within which contemporary poetry largely confines itself.  

http://www.goliasbooks.com

Feel free to sign up here for occasional email updates about future releases and events.
