Psychotic individuals now lacking any form of restriction took to the streets in mass, and with their march, society fell.
            This new way of life has become the norm in the three months since. Scavenge for food, avoid any mutants you see passing by - beings that had been since dubbed ‘Unleashed’- and hope your home remained your own. If you weren’t among those following this pattern, you were one of the many taking advantage of this world of anarchy, displaying your newfound power in order to make a living.
            The road ahead is a testament to the decay of civilization. Abandoned cars litter the streets, strewn about at odd angles. Some are crashed into one another or abandoned in ditches. A few are embedded into the guardrails. Occasionally, dried blood can be found in the seats and windshields. The bodies didn’t last long. A five foot tall buzzard atop one of the vehicles could attest to that. It ignores the vagabond with the soul of a lion as he passes. It knows better than to attack an Unleashed.
            Hours into his trek, he ventures into the borders of Phoenixville, cringing upon the sight of these all too familiar streets. Sidewalks crumbled, the graveyard to his right now in shambles, and the pizza parlor was reduced to rubble. “Damnit. Really liked their calzones.” An echoing car alarm blares in the distance, only for the battery to die out within seconds, allowing silence to overcome the urban terrain once more. His tired eyes pan to the shattered windows and broken doors, until resting upon the sight of an intact door, surrounded by boarded windows upon a backdrop of faded brick. It was the right half of one of the many duplexes lining this old street. Most of the surrounding buildings appear nearly untouched, almost like the apocalypse never happened. He ventures up to the door and kicks a few pieces of debris, scraps of metal from who knows where to fallen roof tiles. The sounds echo through the otherwise silent streets.
            By the time he reaches the door, he finds it already cracked open. A husky voice addresses him from behind it. “Alright, the hell are you doin here? Be careful with your words. I’m in no mood to deal with any threats.”
            A faint chuckle escapes the vagabond’s lips, leaning against the doorway with his left hand. “You seriously gonna greet an old friend like that, Mason?”
            Silence falls for just a moment until the door’s thrown open to reveal a tall, gangly teen with vibrant white crew-cut hair. Not even as yellowed as platinum blonde, but albino white, contrasting his earthy eyes as they fell upon his visitor. “Scott? The hell are you doing here? I thought you were dead!” He leans in the doorway and sizes up his old friend, his gaze lingering on Scott’s right side for a moment.
            Scott raises his arms in a nearly comical shrug, leaving his right sleeve to hang off his stumped elbow. “Thought I was too for a while. You gonna invite me in, or is that thick head stuck in the doorway?”
            With a roll of his eyes, Mason steps away and holds the door, letting Scott pass through, and leading to a few sighs of relief throughout the living room. His mother wearily lifts herself from her seat and wraps her scrawny arms around Scott in a tight embrace. Her own hair’s grayed quite a bit since they last met, the stress of these past few months having aged her by decades. Despite the constant sagging in her tired face, her smile is as inviting as ever. “Oh thank God you’re alive. When I heard about the massacre out there, I thought-”            “Please, I’m fine, you don’t need to worry!” Scott slowly pries himself from her arms and removes his jacket, seeming rather practiced in functioning without a right hand as he tosses his jacket across the room and onto the coat rack by the door with his stumped elbow. Despite the faintly grim reactions of his peers, he saunters across the unpolished hardwood floor over to a nearby chair and drops into place. The dimly lit home soothes him for a few moments as he takes in the familiar scents of cinnamon and wet wood that constantly permeate this house. In spite of that, he only allows that peace and silence to remain for a few moments before getting to all the questions on everyone’s minds. “So were you all here at home when it went down?”
            Mason nods as he leans back against the wall. “Yeah… My parents and I were the only ones awake when The Breach hit. Father was out drinking.” He crosses his arms and closes his eyes, drifting into memories. “He didn’t like seeing me when he got home. Or Sadie…” He peeks across the room to his youngest sister, curled up on the couch with petite horns poking out of her hair. “Started ranting about us being demons.” He casts his gaze back to Scott. “…Had no choice in the end. He’s buried out back.”
            Scott hunches over and grunts, staring off into empty space. Mr. Bowers’ bigotry was no news to him. “So… How far into hell has this town fallen?”
            They look amongst each other for a moment before Mrs. Bowers looks to Mason with prying eyes. He sighs and paces about the room, roughly rubbing at the back of his neck as the stained floorboards creak beneath him. “Well, it was pretty far at first. People started changing, and half the town started burning. The high school was blown up a few minutes in. Apparently someone with combustion powers put in a little too much effort. Within a few days, things settled down enough for people to hide in their own homes, if they still had ‘em.” He leans against the wall with crossed arms, letting a quick flare of black and white flames surround him for a moment. “I happened to keep this place intact.”
            “Well, that explains the white hair.” Scott shrugs. “Seen weirder shit out of Unleashed before…” Scott leans forward and props himself up with an elbow on the left armrest to his chair. “Pretty sure last week I saw a guy with antennae in his dormant form.”
            Mason groans and lowers his head. “Yeah, well, it’s not as bad as Richie.” Scott’s brow furled at the mention of that name, mumbling ‘Richie Anderson’ to himself. “The dick’s been ‘roided out since The Breach and made a new home out of the bank. Rumor has it when he took over he tore the vault door off with his bare hands and flattened someone with it. But…”            Scott knew the look on his face. That smirk spoke of rebellion. The last time he’d seen it was in the process of unleashing what had to be the best senior prank he’d ever seen, consisting of a homemade mix tape, an agent in the staff, and a misplaced key.
            Mason begins to pace. “There’s a team comin’ together. People from across the state have started gathering here, one of ‘em was even a big player in Paoli’s home team when the first raiding parties arrived. So far, they’re gathered up in a base we set up across town. Well-hidden and kind of out of the way for most survivors here. As long as we approach quietly and watch our backs, we’ll be safe from any raids.”
            Silence falls throughout the room as all eyes fall upon Scott, his own gaze falling upon something imperceptible, glazed yet focused. “Alright then...” He turns to face Mason with stone-faced determination. His limbs are loose and relaxed, yet the steel in his back and fire in his eyes speaks volumes. “Where do I sign up?”
            Mason grins from ear to ear, stepping up and taking Scott’s hand with a renewed passion and lifting him from his seat. “We’ll have to go after sunset, make sure we stay hidden. After midnight would probably be best. So, go crash up in my room for a while, and I’ll come grab ya later.” He pats Scott’s back and sends him off towards the stairs, as Scott gives him a casual two-fingered salute.
            “Thanks. Could use a rest after dealin’ with… I think was about fifteen dipshits runnin’ a gang out of a garage a town over.” Scott snorts as he marches up the creaky steps. “Over half of em bailed in the middle of the fight to save their own asses.” He yawns and trails off upon stepping into a room full of old games and consoles that no longer worked thanks to the lack of electricity. Some ornate weapons hang on the walls, most too dull to be of any use in cutting and all likely too fragile to be of any worth in combat. Chuckling to himself, he kicks off his sandals and collapses into the bed, staring at the ceiling in silence for several minutes. He hears the Bowers chattering amongst themselves below, but having finally found a peaceful place to rest, he drifts off into the deepest sleep he’s had in months.
          ...And thus begins the tale of Scott's biggest mistake and how it eventually both saves and dooms the world. 
 
What is Kairos Publishing?

          My dream for a brighter future in publishing. The current industry is rife with corruption and limits the creative rights of its customers, the authors. What I intend to do is remedy that with a publishing company by authors and for authors. I'll already be making plenty off my own work. Why should I need to take so much income from another author's work? Why make millions off of what isn't mine? I see no need, and I intend to return that income to the authors. A humbler company for a fairer industry.
 

What Do I Need and Why?
          So, here's where your funding comes in.
          I'll need enough to produce a few thousand copies of the physical book for the first wave of sales. My most hopeful but unlikely goal is around ten thousand, hence the fifty thousand goal. Sadly, fifty thousand will not be enough after taxes and other expenses, but it's a good start.          Then comes the costs of producing, hosting, and maintaining a website. This site will, at its core, be for Kairos Publishing, but will include pages specifically for CONTROL and an online store selling the CONTROL book series and other upcoming publications and products. (More on other products later)          Other lesser expenses will also include an improved office space for managing this endeavor and producing later titles, as my current hardware is wearing is a bit thin.
 
What do I get Out of This?
          Donators will be able to recieve the following prizes for their generous donations!

7$ for a pre-ordered copy of the ebook, to be recieved by email. This will be a 3rd party file rather than a Kindle file, but it will be functional on a Kindle device.
9$ for a pre-release copy of the ebook, two weeks before the official sale date!
16$ for a pre-ordered copy of the printed novel in paperback.
20$ for a signed copy! With your help, this series may one day be big enough for those signed copies to be collectors' items.
100$ for a signed copy with a personalized message!

          If I do not receive all of my intended funds, I'll still distribute what I do receive to achieve the closest possible result to what I intend. No matter the results, CONTROL will move on, and Kairos Publishing will be making its debut. What I'm asking for is simply a little help in making my grand entrance into the industry.
 

How Far Can This Go?
          As stated before, CONTROL: Ubiquity of Chaos is only the beginning of a series. Four more main series titles and three side titles are in planning, and the first sequel is already in the works. But, these books preface something even greater.
          From here, I fully intend to provide the services I perform for my own work for many other up-and-coming authors. A few are already lined up, spanning a few other genres. You can expect the next title to be a collection of high fantasy short stories by a fellow West Chester University student and aspiring high fantasy and science fantasy novelist. At Kairos Enterprises, we wont be turning authors down for not meeting a strict moral code or hidden agendas. Creative freedom will be maintained to the fullest, and no author will be turned away due to conflicting opinions. The creators will thrive here, and be encouraged to take their work beyond the literary and into other fields. There will be no arguments over rights here if you want to make a movie. We may even pitch in.
 

What's In the Way?
          The biggest thing in my way right now is funding and advertisement. I have the backing of several experienced and successful entrepreneurs, the book itself is already finished, and the reviews I have received are truly encouraging. As long as I can solve the issues with funding production and advertising my work, it should be relatively smooth sailing from here compared to being an English major at a university with papers due in every class and still managing to find time for my book.
          And those are the two places you are best suited to help. Your donations will cover the finances, and the advertising is even easier. Spread the word about this campaign, reblog it, post it to Facebook, on Reddit, or whatever group chats you may have on Skype or Discord. It's quick, it's simple, and it does just as much for me as your donations. Even if you can't donate, tell someone, and you've already helped enough for me to thank you from the bottom of my heart.          Hopefully, with your help, CONTROL can one day be a household title, and Kairos Publishing may bring the works of many others to such a status as well.

story:
Synopsis

Hello you, my name is Jason and yes, I was that young man. This book is a journal of sorts; my journey from waking up in the Singapore General Hospital, through the extended,  recovery process and finally, literally getting back up on my own two feet to start life anew. In that process, I learned many a thing or two I share throughout the story I hope you can glean from my experience. 

This certainly must have been a life-altering experience you say? Having been found tagged with a "death certificate", being bed and wheelchair bound for 5 months and having visible, unsightly scars from the skin grafting done over the 3rd degree burns you sustained, surely life must be so different for me now?

Well, dear reader, even as I put on a shirt with my own two hands today, write these words with my own voice and mind -- I will admit I still take things for granted from time to time, even when I know I was moments away from losing everything. But that's the beauty of being human isn't. Therein lies the message of this book; we always, always have a choice.

After all, do you need a death certificate before you decide to live? So I hope you choose wisely dear reader, to live in Gratitude, Purpose, and Hope.

Click our show-case website link below to find out more! BONUS : Download the preview there! 

Outline 

 

Chapter 1 : Genesis

The beginning. I open the book with my background growing up and the start of my Cambodian adventure in the Phom Penh airport.

Chapter 2 : 3 x 2 = 6 Degrees of Separation

How I was eventually found after 10 days of zero contact. The interesting thing was, my hero, Israel, was contacted on the same day by two individuals asking him to look for me! Thank you Mark Zuckerberg!

Chapter 3 : It only takes a spark

Here I go into the crazy details of the episode, how it started and came to an exploding conclusion; told by one of the two actual eye-witnesses that night.

Chapter 4 : In-between worlds

Half of me is found! My mind, that is.

Chapter 5 : Airborne

We take flight via a miraculous emergency evacuation to get back to better medical facilities.

Chapter 6 : Fight

This chapter is extracted from Mom's log book of the very rough initial recovery process, the details of the exact conditions and damage.

Chapter 7 : Homebound

Coming home takes on a new meaning.

Chapter 8 : Samulah!

Roughly translated to "Do it again!", I talk about the emotions and process of getting back up on my feet, and back to the wheelchair again, upon completing my second surgery.

Chapter 9 : JASONYOLT

The birth of this project, so I can live out my second chance at life in purpose, gratitude, and hope; my biggest lessons from this experience.

Chapter 10 : You

I'd really like to not make this book just about me, and in this chapter, I detail several exercises you may carry out, so you learn the things I did, so that you, dear reader, can YOLT without a death certificate. ;)

Audience 

 

The intended readers of 'If YOLT' was initially for individuals going through a tough time in their lives, especially trauma patients recuperating in hospitals from major accidents. The explicit details articulated were intended to help those individuals relate to the story and for them to ultimately know, that they are not alone.

As the story progressed and I started sharing my story with others, including active, healthy individuals, I remembered that everyone is fighting their own battles, everyone has their own dark times too; that everyone could use a little gratitude, purpose, and hope.

If you are looking for a little inspiration, a reminder that life is short, yet so beautiful if lived to the full, or you are looking to gift this to someone who could use it, this is the book for you.

What We Need  

 

The $5000 production cost is required for the following : 

  • Professional Copyediting service : To scrub through the entire book, clean up grammatical errors and recommend alternatives to better articulate an idea.
  • Book Formatting : To layout the text and pictures of the book according to the industry standard format to make reading easy on the eyes, and print compatible. 
  • Cover Illustrations : To communicate through the beautiful and purposeful digital painting; the beauty of the story, the beauty of a life lived to the fullest in gratitude, purpose, and hope.
  • Printing : Needless to say, this will take the largest portion of the cost of production. We are currently budgeting for approximately 800 copies. 
  • Marketing : Marketing collaterals like print and some online presence is required to boost sales and awareness for extravagant success!
  • Book launch : The cumulation of this campaign, a small budget will be used to pay for event decorations and light refreshments to  make it as memorable as possible. 

What You Get

 

Kindly refer to the Perks section on the right. Different perks will come with varying pledges. Do take note of the terms listed below.

Various products available are as follows:

  • E-book 
  • Limited Edition Paper Back*
  • Personal Book Launch invite**
  • VIP-access Book Launch Invite 

  • Featured on webpage as Patron

  • Limited Edition 4GB YOLT Thumbdrive 

 

* Set to retail in major bookstores at $24
      + Local Shipping refers to self-collect at book launch
      + Additional charges apply for local delivery

** Refer to "Book Launch Event Details" below

^ Refer to "YOLT Patron" below. 

    Book Launch Event Details 

     

    Location : NLB Bugis, 100 Victoria Street, Singapore 188064
    Time : 7pm - 930pm
    Date : 06/01/17
    Events : 

    • Light refreshments 
    • Book Collection / Purchase
    • Guest speakers' opening
    • Author's keynote delivery
    • Giving thanks 
    • Book signing & Photo-taking

    Personal Invite 

    So long as you have purchased something, you stand to receive a personal digital invite from the Author to the cumulation highlight event, the book launch. We'll see you there!

    VIP-Access

    Anticipating a large crowd, a VIP section will be cordoned off and reserved only for VIPs of the event. These people will include :

    • YOLT Patrons, including purchasers of the $martkyds bundle; as a thank you for your support. 
    • Family members of the Author, to whom a proper acknowledgment and honor had been long due. 

     

    YOLT Patron

    Patron

    ˈpeɪtr(ə)n

    noun

    1. a person who gives financial or other support to a person, organization, or cause

    This is your opportunity to play a large role in visionary projects designed to empower others to live without regret; in gratitude, purpose, and hope. Demonstrate your support for the YOLT movement by pledging this bundle today! 

    Our honored Patrons will receive the following tokens of appreciation: 

       • 04 x Limited Edition Paper Back
       • 100 pcs only Limited Edition 4GB YOLT Thumb drive, each with a copy of the E-Book.

     

       • Featured as a distinguished ‘Patron’, on our website at www.jasonyolt.com

     

     

    #YOLT MOVEMENT

    The youth of today are known as the most disengaged and apathetic generations yet, despite this being an incredible time of technological advancements that makes our lives easier, communications that connect and creates opportunities across the world more than ever. This could be the result of the single fact that most youth, perhaps even adults often choose to be blind to – that we are mortal. This may lead to our taking life for granted; putting important things off and settling for less than what would make us feel truly alive. It could be that some of us may want to do big things, but dare not dream or think that we are “not good enough”.

    As a result, youth may realize that are going down a slippery slope of the default narrative of society, to "do things they do not enjoy, to impress people they do not respect, to get things they do not like". When will they realise that it is a waste of their precious momentary, vulnerable lives - when it is too late? We believe that our youth need to know how to find that one thing, to overcome their darkest nights and fight for a brighter future; hope.

    As a YOLT patron, your contribution will also support The YOLT Movement, which is a year-long project which involves speaking at various secondary and tertiary level schools, to inspire and encourage these youth to live a life in Gratitude, Purpose, and Hope. 

    The Impact

           

    For every book sold, 10% of the proceeds will be donated to the The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund. Another 10% will be donated to the Alongsiders project, which has incredible measured, powerful impact on the lives of marginalized Cambodian children. Read the impact report here.

     

    Timeline

     

    Risks & Challenges

     

    Thankfully, at this point in time, as you can see in the timeline, we have already completed the contents of the book, beautifully copy-edited by Linda Foo and laid out by Loupe Singapore. We are only waiting for several more testimonials before we send it for print.

    Otherwise, everything is set for the big day; the Book Launch on the 6th of January, held at the Central Library graciously sponsored by NLB Singapore. We look forward to seeing and thank you for your support. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Do get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
    • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    Carpe Diem :)

Synopsis
Hello you, my name is Jason and yes, I was that young man. This book is a journal of sorts; my journey from waking up in the Singapore General Hospital, through the extended,  recovery process and finally, literally getting back up on my own two feet to start life anew. In that process, I learned many a thing or two I share throughout the story I hope you can glean from my experience. 
This certainly must have been a life-altering experience you say? Having been found tagged with a "death certificate", being bed and wheelchair bound for 5 months and having visible, unsightly scars from the skin grafting done over the 3rd degree burns you sustained, surely life must be so different for me now?
Well, dear reader, even as I put on a shirt with my own two hands today, write these words with my own voice and mind -- I will admit I still take things for granted from time to time, even when I know I was moments away from losing everything. But that's the beauty of being human isn't. Therein lies the message of this book; we always, always have a choice.

story:
Hello!

I am raising money to fund the second edition of my book, The JOBS Act: Crowdfunding for Small Businesses and Startups. Published by Apress in paperback on October 2, 2012, mine was the first JOBS Act crowdfunding book published. Now it's time for an update. Apress will publish the second edition in October, 2016, as soon as I finish writing it. This is where you come in....

A lot has happened since the first book was published, and I intend to provide a through update.  I will create a series of blogs and websites with infographics, videos, Title III campaigns and other material. We will have the most complete and comprehensive information on the subject. 

In addition to writing the first book on the JOBS Act and crowdfunding, I am one of the people who helped crowdfunding get started. My background is in finance (MBA) and economics (MA), both from the University of Chicago.

This campaign will insure that I can finish the second edition in the time allotted, in a complete and comprehensive manner. I will use several new techniques to write the book quickly.  The book will be published in October, 2016. That's three months.

    What We Need & What You Get

     

    Let's start with that last item. In exchange for your support I WILL PUT YOU IN THE BOOK! You will be listed as a supporter. Or, if you really want to be in, I will let you write a forward or an introduction  (subject to editing and approval, or course...)

    By helping this book get published, you will insure that objective, honest information on crowdfunding comes from an independent, unaffiliated source. This is important since we are already seeing biased, inaccurate information on crowdfunding being promoted by greedy, unscrupulous lawyers and others. (On June 17, 2015, the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit recognized me as a "Friend of the Court" in an action that state securities regulators brought to try to slow down crowdfunding. My comments helped convince the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to allow crowdfunding sooner rather than later. See:  https://www.prlog.org/12499745.html )

    In the meantime, I need money to complete the book. I will have to pay a number of expenses, from cell phone bills, to copies of research documents (yes, some people still actually use paper hard copies...) to expenses related to the creation of specilized graphics, to data on small business financing and crowdfunding. And, of course, McDonald's (gotta eat...)

    And, no, I have not asked Oprah. She's busy. 

    The funding will help make sure this project gets completed in a timely manner, Anything will help, and I'll use every dollar even if we don't reach our entire goal.

      The Impact

      Crowdfunding has the potential to change everything. We have seen the potential impact in communities of color:

      Part of what I think is needed, based on my experience, is more objective and independent information. Unfortunately, the lawyers have tried to dominate access to JOBS Act crowdfunding. The second edition will provide information in plain language. Your contribution will make a difference:

      • We have a successful track record with projects like this. We have been researching the JOBS Act for some time now, so we have a lot of the information we need to complete the update already. 

      Risks & Challenges

      Are there any risks and obstacles I may face on the way to achieving our goal? Yes....

      • I may not be able to finish on time.
      • But, I already have most of the material I need,

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

      • Tweet! Like on Facebook. Get the word out and make some noise!
      • We make it easy to use the Indiegogo share tools!

      And that's all there is to it.

      UPDATE: The book website has been launched by the publisher! See: http://www.apress.com/9781484224083

Published by Apress in paperback on October 2, 2012, mine was the first JOBS Act crowdfunding book published. Now it's time for an update. Apress will publish the second edition in October, 2016, as soon as I finish writing it. This is where you come in....
A lot has happened since the first book was published, and I intend to provide a through update.  I will create a series of blogs and websites with infographics, videos, Title III campaigns and other material. We will have the most complete and comprehensive information on the subject. 
In addition to writing the first book on the JOBS Act and crowdfunding, I am one of the people who helped crowdfunding get started. My background is in finance (MBA) and economics (MA), both from the University of Chicago.
This campaign will insure that I can finish the second edition in the time allotted, in a complete and comprehensive manner. I will use several new techniques to write the book quickly.  The book will be published in October, 2016. That's three months.


What We Need & What You Get
 
Let's start with that last item. In exchange for your support I WILL PUT YOU IN THE BOOK! You will be listed as a supporter. Or, if you really want to be in, I will let you write a forward or an introduction  (subject to editing and approval, or course...)
By helping this book get published, you will insure that objective, honest information on crowdfunding comes from an independent, unaffiliated source. This is important since we are already seeing biased, inaccurate information on crowdfunding being promoted by greedy, unscrupulous lawyers and others. (On June 17, 2015, the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit recognized me as a "Friend of the Court" in an action that state securities regulators brought to try to slow down crowdfunding. My comments helped convince the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to allow crowdfunding sooner rather than later. See:  https://www.prlog.org/12499745.html )
In the meantime, I need money to complete the book. I will have to pay a number of expenses, from cell phone bills, to copies of research documents (yes, some people still actually use paper hard copies...) to expenses related to the creation of specilized graphics, to data on small business financing and crowdfunding. And, of course, McDonald's (gotta eat...)
And, no, I have not asked Oprah. She's busy. 
The funding will help make sure this project gets completed in a timely manner, Anything will help, and I'll use every dollar even if we don't reach our entire goal.


The Impact
Crowdfunding has the potential to change everything. We have seen the potential impact in communities of color:
Part of what I think is needed, based on my experience, is more objective and independent information. Unfortunately, the lawyers have tried to dominate access to JOBS Act crowdfunding. The second edition will provide information in plain language. Your contribution will make a difference:
We have a successful track record with projects like this. We have been researching the JOBS Act for some time now, so we have a lot of the information we need to complete the update already. 

Risks & Challenges
Are there any risks and obstacles I may face on the way to achieving our goal? Yes....

I may not be able to finish on time.
But, I already have most of the material I need,


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Tweet! Like on Facebook. Get the word out and make some noise!
We make it easy to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.UPDATE: The book website has been launched by the publisher! See: http://www.apress.com/9781484224083

story:
ABOUT THE AUTHOR

My name is Luka also known as Luksina the Dragon, I come from Bosnia & Herzegovina, and I have been writing fantasy fiction since I was 12 years old. Later, I went into the waters of writing erotic furry fantasy fiction, specializing in dragons, where I even managed to gain a humble following from the furry community. I successfully thrived despite the repression I received from my culturally degraded society, friends, and even my very own patriarchal parents. My creative will was not to be bound to the backward patriarchal society I live in! Still...they are people too, just like me and you, therefore, it is my duty and I hope your's too, to help them accept the freedom which every person deserves.

My furry profile:https://luksinatriks.sofurry.com

ABOUT THE BOOK

"The Naughty and Nice Sides of Dragons"  is a conceptual illustrated collection of short stories about dragons and their adventures, some of which are erotic and some that are not. The genre is fantasy fiction with a touch of furry erotica. The entire book is filled with the original illustrations made by my fellow furry artists, whose contact info are linked below in the text.

Illustration by Puffy

The plots are ranging from a young dragon seducing an elf princess to a pregnant dragon being saved by a human family.  As you may have guessed these topics are controversial in my country and as such, the mainstream publishers are not interested in promoting this liberal book of mine. That's why I will need you to join me in my battle against closed-minded conventions of my homeland.

Illustration by Chansey


Contact info of illustrators:

Inusan -https://inusan.sofurry.com

Starlight Nova -https://starlight-nova.sofurry.com

Puffy - puffy_the_flame@yahoo.com

Evan Cousine -https://furrynation2013.sofurry.com

Chansey - taca_maca92@gmail.com

FUNDING 

How The Funds Will Be Used

·  Printing: I need at least $500 for humble publishing of my book (for the initial printing; any subsequent printing will be funded with the profits from the sales of the book)

·  Marketing: The price I asked for is the bare minimum that is needed for printing, but the most important thing to me is that liberal ideas, which I expressed in my book, reach the wider audience of my anguished homeland. Therefore, marketing is the key factor in this humane and creative cause of you and me, and that’s why every extra penny that crosses the goal is equally important to me. In case we breach the main goal, I would put all the additional money into the promotion of the book and the spreading of ideas and values of freedom, peace and tolerance. (approximate price of various promotions over the native TV and radio stations, as well as the local newspaper, etc.)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to aid me, but you happen to be short on money, I completely understand you. Not all of us are in a position to donate, but hopefully, you could tell your friends or share my project on your social media accounts which I would very much appreciate.

FAQ

1.  Why don't you publish your book in USA and worldwide?

 - Because the main goal of my project is to spread the furry culture and democratic values in my undeveloped country.

  2.  Why don't you run a local campaign?

 - Because the people of my country are not economically nor culturally able to support me, and so I must turn to you, my foreign friends :)

  3.  Why print the book? Why not just publish it online?

 - The reason I intend to publish a hard copy of my book is solely because internet isn't nearly as widespread here as it is in more developed countries, therefore my book in the printed form would reach a larger audience.

  4.  Why didn't you put a physical copy of the book as one of the rewards?

 - Because I am ashamed to ask of you for the amount of money it would cost to ship a physical copy of the book. The postal service of my country is outdated and expensive.

my undeveloped country.
 
2.  Why don't you run a local campaign?
 - Because the
people of my country are not economically nor culturally able to support me,
and so I must turn to you, my foreign friends :)
 
3.  Why print the book? Why not just publish it online?
 - The reason I
intend to publish a hard copy of my book is solely because internet isn't
nearly as widespread here as it is in more developed countries, therefore my
book in the printed form would reach a larger audience.
 
4.  Why didn't you put a physical copy of the book as one of the
rewards?
 - Because I am
ashamed to ask of you for the amount of money it would cost to ship a physical
copy of the book. The postal service of my country is outdated and expensive.

story:
What We Need & What You Get

 

  • I'm asking for $30,000 USD.  This amount includes the cost to edit and publish my book, Unmasking (in the various Ebook formats, Paperback, Audiobook, and Hard Copy), as well as for a website, training, education and the ability to attend and speak at relevant Tradeshows/Conventions.
  • I'm Canadian, so $30,000 will translate to roughly $40,000, however, selling books isn't a lucrative thing. Here's an example of a breakdown of what I'll actually receive from this crowdfund:
    • $20 USD for a paperback book - $5 USD to the printer, - 11% to Indiegogo (who include the shipping charges in the crowdfund amount, so $28 USD) = $12, - 10% to the not-for-profit = $10.80 USD towards the crowdfund. 
  • I'm self-publishing because I don't want the majority (as in 90%) of the profits from the book going to a big book publisher, and I don't want a big book publisher having the right to edit out important parts of the book.
  • The big book publisher also chooses the printer, and I'd have no control over what a person would have to pay to get the book.  As it sits now, I have great rates for both printing and shipping the book to most places in the world.
  • I've already received three professional reviews and I'm confident the value the book delivers will exceed expectations. One more professional review is expected by April 15, 2017.  ​To read the full reviews I've received so far, please go to http://www.RayneDowell.com.
  • Here's some reviews I've received so far:

"An inherently fascinating, exceptionally candid, consistently compelling, thoughtful and thought-provoking memoir, "Unmasking: A Journey" is deeply personal and ultimately inspiring." - MIDWEST BOOK REVIEW

"Beautiful and scary and ungainly and soaring and everything else that goes into a meaningful life." - BURT KEMPNER,INDEPENDENT WRITER/PRODUCER

"Anyone interested in uplifting reads about the nature of personal transformation and the paths leading to it will relish Unmasking's candid and intricate focus on how one thing leads to another in life. Few autobiographies adequately capture the process of transformation as does Unmasking." - DONOVAN'S LITERARY SERVICES

  • Self-publishing means I can invest more in the training and education I need to spread the message of hope, passion, strength, positively, truth and perseverance. 
  • Self-publishing also means I can give more to my not-for-profit, The Doorway. 
  • This is a breakdown of where the monies raised for the crowdfund will go: 

​

  • I have the passion, but I know I'll need some public speaking training because I want to deliver the truths of "Unmasking" in the most understandable, straight-forward way. 
  • The Training and Education costs also include costs associated with travel, accommodation and sign up fees for Trade Shows and Conventions in North America.
  • I've got some unique perks!  
    • A Contest to win an Audiobook,
    • A one-to-one "Pick My Brain" phone call where I answer 3 of your questions! 
    • A Contest to "be" one of the characters (voices) for the audiobook!
    • Free Ebook and Audiobook giveaways!
    • A "Gift" - go to https://www.raynedowell.com/ to claim "The 8 Step Beginner Unmasking Formula"!
    • Plus, for Book Collectors: a small number of a limited edition, one-of-a-kind, embossed and foiled, personally autographed, hard cover copies of the book, Unmasking.
  • If I don't reach my entire goal the funds will go to the book editing and publishing processes (Ebook, Paperback, Audiobook, and Hard Copy). At the very least, I want the book available in different formats.

 

The Impact

 

  • Your contribution will not only help you, if you decide you'd like to transform your life by Unmasking and Unchaining into a Unparalleled, Superpowered, Unstoppable You! but if you're good to go, you probably know someone who can benefit from this book.
  • You'll be supporting The Doorway, who support young adults who're making positive life choices and taking positive steps forward in their lives.
  • The impact this book will have is incredibly positive, for many people, in many stages of their lives and increasing the positivity in others lives means, we all benefit.

​

Risks & Challenges

 

  • I'm a first time Author, so this is new to me. It's challenging to find the best pricing and quality from printers and learn how to do the majority of the work myself, like;
    • how to format and upload an Ebook, and where to upload it,
    • how to format a Hard Copy book for the printer, and get the best price for the reader,
    • how to narrate, record and upload the Audiobook, 
    • how to format the Paperback and get the best price for the reader.
  • The thing is, I don't quit, and I won't stop. This book will  be published - one way or another. Because I'm that dedicated to sharing the important messages in the book. Besides the thousands of experiments I've conducted, I've also dedicated the last year to writing, editing and researching how to publish a book.
  • I've surrounded myself with a dedicated team of amazing supporters who want to see this book reach the world and the word "grateful" simply doesn't describe how I feel about all the support I've received so far and continue to receive. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you can't help out monetarily I want you to know, your support is hugely important, valuable, and appreciated!

You can show your support by helping to get the word out by using the social media sharing tools here on Indiegogo. Use the hashtag #YourUnmasking in your shoutout so I can personally thank you for your effort, it means a lot!

 

The Why - Unmask and Unchain into an Unparalled,

Superpowered, Unstoppable You!

 

    My name is Rayne Dowell and I'm a Canadian who has been secretly conducting many, many tests and experiments for over fifteen years, experimenting with energy, emotions, and spirituality and  how they impact our every day lives. 

    My test subject has been myself.

    Why?

    Because I've struggled in the past, and every day I see many people struggling. I wanted to know what solutions are available and how it all works. Life.

    How it really works, not how I've been told it works. 

    Much of what I've learned has a lot to do with how our emotions affect us. These are the emotions I see negatively impacting people's lives daily, the same emotions that used to impact me negatively, robbing me of the life I was meant to live:

    • Anxiety
    • Anger
    • Overwhelm
    • Feeling Stuck
    • Stress
    • Resentment
    • Frustration
    • Guilt/shame

    My campaign is about raising funds to edit, publish and get the word out about the solutions I've  discovered, solutions that will help you!

    The book, Unmasking, provides superpowered, emotionally intelligent solutions for people with emotional pain, helping them dissolve it, so they can free themselves and begin living a life of purpose, peace and happiness by using the lessons and solutions inside.

    This is important to me because showing people how they can access their own positive energy, to transform and improve their lives, means... we all win. 

    • Understanding how we can positively impact our own and others lives means increasing what I call the "thrive" factor in our personal lives - which positively affects our families, our communities and our environment. 
    • This is a win-win-win, because a portion of the proceeds for this crowdfund and the ongoing book sales will be going to The Doorway, www.TheDoorway.ca, a local not-for-profit I support.

    Thank you for being involved, in whatever way you can, to spread positivity and hope!

story:
Bedazzled Ink is a medium-sized publishing company with a mission. Founded in 2004 with 150 books published to date, we are dedicated to literary fiction, nonfiction, and children’s books that celebrate the unique and under-represented voices of women.

We’re interested in fiction with female protagonists and nonfiction from a female perspective that appeals to all readers. In other words, we publish books that are equal in acceptance to books by male writers.

And we’re facing a tough uphill battle.

 

  • Women account for only 30% of the writers in the average publishing house
  • While women read books by either gender, men tend to read books only by male authors
  • Three-fourths of the reviews by major review publications are for books by men.
  • Amazon lumps all women authors in “women’s fiction” regardless of what kind of book it is.
  • Amazon’s marketing keeps female writers from finding their core audience “not to mention from entering the larger more influential playing field.” (New York Times)
  • A woman writer gets points if they include the “male” world in their work and lose points if they don’t. (New York Times)
  • No Pulitzer Prize winner from 2000-2014 was written wholly from the point of view of a female.
  • Women authors use initials or male pseudonyms to gain credibility in the publishing industry.

Woman authors who write outside acceptable “women’s” genres are forced into inappropriate boxes by their agents and publishers and are incorrectly marketed by booksellers. Women authors have a greater chance of being overlooked by reviewers.

It’s time to step up and reassert that women’s voices are equal and have a right to be heard, now more than ever. Bedazzled Ink is in the unique position to give women their voice through the written word. We’re starting this fight with the books we are publishing in 2017.

Unfortunately, this mission takes funding beyond the modest means of an independent publisher. Since we emphasis women’s literature, it doesn’t matter how many books we publish and how well they sell, we will never experience the profit margins other mainstream publishers because of the endemic male bias. Because of that, our budget is very tight and any unexpected expense can sink us. Our survival depends on breaking through the publishing glass ceiling.

We hate to think inside the box and tend to kick boxes and anything resembling boxes out of our way, so we created our Angels for Books Campaign. We know there are people who would love to have the opportunity to support the literary voices of women authors and give them a place of equality and respect in the publishing industry today. Your small contribution will make a big impact on a book’s success in knocking holes in the male-dominated walls.

We hope you choose to become a Book Angel give our upcoming books the Wings they need to reach their full potential audience and take their rightful place alongside books by male authors.

 

What We Need To Do

Since we do not sign books that follow genres or formulas and each of our books celebrates a unique female voice or story, the only way to succeed in our mission is to treat all our titles equally.

This means we have to market all our titles at the same high standard to keep us continually visible within the publishing industry.

We've learned that each time we get a review by a major reviewer and each time we are shortlisted for or win an award, our status rises within the publishing industry. We can't let up now. We have to keep raising our visibility with advertising, reviews, and awards to meet our mission of making women authors equal to male authors in acceptance and respect.

Unfortunately, it takes a lot of effort and expense to get even a single review or an award.

Even with discounts offered by our distributor, IPG, advertising still takes a good chunk of the budget for just a single time ad in major trade publications. Trying for reviews involve preparing Advance Reading Copies three to four months before the publication date, printing review copies, preparing information sheets and press releases, and mailing out the review copies.

Awards not only validate a book's worth, but they help solidify a publisher's reputation for putting out excellent, high quality books.

Distribution plus major reviews and advertising equal greater sales. Greater sales equal greater visibility, which creates even more sales. Greater sales means turning enough profit to give us the ability to give Wings to all our new books, which, in return, gets us closer to receiving equality in the publishing world.

We are now preparing our books for 2017 and need an extra boost to our budget to ensure all our books receive equal advertising, reviews, and awards. Like any parent, we hate to be forced to pick favorites among all our equally gifted children so we offer all our titles as perks. You can read about each of our titles at Bedazzled Ink Publishing.

Thank you for becoming a Book Angel and helping woman authors to break through the publishing glass ceiling.

story:
Short Summary

Bonjour! My name is Rudy. I'm a filmmaker in Montréal Canada.  Most importantly, 13 years ago, I became a full-time single dad. DADDY KNOWS LESS is my daily journal raising a boy.

First and foremost I would like to speak to the parents, the dads in particular.

No you are not alone !

Raising a kid, especially as a single parent, is alienating, exhausting and terrifying. And how do you know you're doing it right?

Trust me, you will be okay. If I can do it, anybody can.

 I have been raising a boy while learning how to be a man myself. It has completely revolutionized my life: it has  been a ride and a joy and a terror.

I wish to share this experience with my fellow parents... particularly fathers who do not have forums or myriad self help books to guide them.

Parents who have read excerpts on my blog, have commented on how it moved them and made them feel less alone as a less-than-perfect parent.

SOME READERS' COMMENTS
"...Both son and father are witty,funny and touching...The chronicles of their daily life is a delight!" - H.R.

"Daddy Knows Less makes me smile , cry , laugh out loud but most importantly it makes me ponder on the huge job we have as parents to help our little ones navigate through our messy world. I looked forward to reading it every day."-F.B

"Raw, honest, unfiltered, hysterical and sentimental....Daddy Knows Less is human and so absolutely relevant. Father and son will steal your heart as you cry and laugh and follow them on the ever so epic journey of day-to-day life. So excited to see this in print!!" -Masha G.


I have seen no other book of this nature, combining painful truths and insights with the humour of day to day parenting... from a male perspective! Yes, there also is sex...or rather my ceaseless quest for some, complicated by having a
kid looking up to me full-time.

The book is not a guide or a resource center... it is a slice of life, but like books such as Love Eat Pray, it inspires and creates real comfort.

The contributions I've requested would allow me to work on the 800 pages of journal entries that I now have, in order to edit them into a publishable book.
 

What We Need & What You Get

The contributions are basically 2 months of subsistence while I edit the manuscript as well as covering the costs of readers and editors and printing to prepare it for presentation to publishers in North America and the UK. 

It's an expensive and time-consuming endeavour.  Without these contributions, Daddy Knows Less will likely remain a project that I may never find the time to complete...after all I gotta feed my kid.


AN EXCERPT FROM DADDY KNOWS LESS

March 30th

Horsing around ...with Sagittarius

“Yeah, so, it’s really cool. This is how it is.”

My boy sounds so authoritative. Whenever he says ‘this is how it is’, I hold my breathe. A lifetime of attention to discover how it is that things are what they are, and I’m still not sure. Maybe he knows.

“Yeah, so, the horses they poop in bags that are stuck to their butts. Did you know that, dad?”

The mysteries of manure. Hmmm, where’s the metaphor?

“So like it won’t be that gross, because like we’re spending the whole day with our horses. Yeah, this is how it is…”

Here it  comes… the universe explained.

“There’s going to be thousands of horses.”

“Thousands?”

“No,no, no hundreds, or maybe like a dozen or more.”

I just hope it won’t be a few tired nags.

“Yeah, so we choose our horse and we spend all day with him. Imagine how cool, dad. I, uhm, feed him and brush him and then I riiiiiiiiddddeeee. Hee-haw, giddyup….I wonder what his name is going to be?”

We’re walking to his school for an activity day at a horse farm outside the city. The expedition leaves real early. It’s 7h15. Normally, at this time, I’m searching for clean underwear…so I’m even less awake than usual. But it’s prime time for Noah.

“If only his name was Fire. I could say Go Fire Go. That would be awesome!”

He gallops ahead a few feet, then gallops back.

“Dad, you know that I’m a horse like that’s my Chinese symbol. Yeah, and the best of all is that I’m a Fire Horse, yeah, because you can be fire or water in Chinese symbols. Cool huhn. I love horses, they’re my favorite real animals. Dad, would you prefer being fire or water?”

“Depends on what exactly that means. Each has its properties, so I don’t know.”

Doubt, I think, is a function of age. Or having been bitch-slapped.

“I’m happy I’m Fire…it’s way cooler.”

“Or hotter.”

Wow, a whole mess of neurons fired on that one.

“Good one dad. What’s your Chinese symbol?”

“Rooster.”

“Hah, that sucks! And if you’re a water rooster it’s even worse. Imagine, a rooster in water.”

A wet bird. Sounds good to me.

“Yeah, Noah, but my Western sign is Aquarius, the best sign…it’s the age of Aquarius, Aquarius, Aquariuuuuuusssss.”

I’ve been singing that since primary school…still waiting for the coming of that bloody age that is supposed to be mine.

“Awkwardddddd.” Noah’s new fashionable word for dismissing the ‘uncool’.

“I’m a Sagittarius, right dad? Yeah, it’s cool because he’s a centaur and a centaur is half horse, half man, so it all makes sense… you see? I’m a Fire horse and a Centaur and I love horses best of all.”

A Centaur is like a horse’s ass with an asshole’s head. I wouldn’t be that proud.

“Dad, what does an Aquarius do?”

“He’s the water-bearer.”

“Awkwaaaarrrd.”

“You know, oh arrogant little horse-butt, Aquarians are free, smart, generous, open and damn sexy.”

“But dad, how is that possible? Like, I thought you were an Aquarius.”

“I am…oh you little gas factory, you got me. Good one.”

“Haha…I’m on fiiiiiiirree. Like you couldn’t be an Aquarius because of what you said Aquarius was. Funny huhn?”

Kill it by explaining it.

Today, I meet the psychologist for a detailed analysis of the tests that Noah has done over several weeks. She has already told me that there’s something there that is a little off, that may explain his lack of focus, his stomach pains etc… today I may know more. Explaining it.

We turn the last corner before his school. He charges off.

“Go Fire Go!”

Maybe it’s just that my little Sagittarius is a Horse with fire in his belly.

“Go Fire Go!”

Raising a kid, especially as a single parent, is alienating, exhausting and terrifying. And how do you know you're doing it right? Trust me, you will be okay. If I can do it, anybody can. I have been raising a boy while learning how to be a man myself. It has completely revolutionized my life: it has  been a ride and a joy and a terror. I wish to share this experience with my fellow parents... particularly fathers who do not have forums or myriad self help books to guide them. Parents who have read excerpts on my blog, have commented on how it moved them and made them feel less alone as a less-than-perfect parent.SOME READERS' COMMENTS"...Both son and father are witty,funny and touching...The chronicles of their daily life is a delight!" - H.R."Daddy Knows Less makes me smile , cry , laugh out loud but most importantly it makes me ponder on the huge job we have as parents to help our little ones navigate through our messy world. I looked forward to reading it every day."-F.B
"Raw, honest, unfiltered, hysterical and sentimental....Daddy Knows Less is human and so absolutely relevant. Father and son will steal your heart as you cry and laugh and follow them on the ever so epic journey of day-to-day life. So excited to see this in print!!" -Masha G.

I have seen no other book of this nature, combining painful truths and insights with the humour of day to day parenting... from a male perspective! Yes, there also is sex...or rather my ceaseless quest for some, complicated by having a kid looking up to me full-time.The book is not a guide or a resource center... it is a slice of life, but like books such as Love Eat Pray, it inspires and creates real comfort.The contributions I've requested would allow me to work on the 800 pages of journal entries that I now have, in order to edit them into a publishable book. What We Need & What You Get The contributions are 
basically 2 months of subsistence while I edit the manuscript as well as
 covering the costs of readers and editors and printing to prepare it for presentation to publishers in 
North America and the UK.  

It's an expensive and time-consuming endeavour.  
Without these contributions, Daddy Knows Less will likely remain a 
project that I may never find the time to complete...after all I gotta 
feed my kid. 
AN EXCERPT FROM DADDY KNOWS LESS
March
30th
Horsing
around ...with Sagittarius
“Yeah, so, it’s really cool. This is how it is.” 

My boy sounds so authoritative. Whenever he says ‘this is how it
is’, I hold my breathe. A lifetime of attention to discover how it
is that things are what they are, and I’m still not sure. Maybe he
knows.
“Yeah, so, the horses they poop in bags that are stuck to their
butts. Did you know that, dad?”
The mysteries of manure. Hmmm, where’s the metaphor?
“So like it won’t be that gross, because like we’re spending
the whole day with our horses. Yeah, this is how it is…”
Here it  comes… the universe explained.
“There’s going to be thousands of horses.”
“Thousands?”
“No,no, no hundreds, or maybe like a dozen or more.”
I just hope it won’t be a few tired nags.
“Yeah, so we choose our horse and we spend all day with him.
Imagine how cool, dad. I, uhm, feed him and brush him and then I
riiiiiiiiddddeeee. Hee-haw, giddyup….I wonder what his name is
going to be?”
We’re walking to his school for an activity day at a horse farm
outside the city. The expedition leaves real early. It’s 7h15.
Normally, at this time, I’m searching for clean underwear…so I’m
even less awake than usual. But it’s prime time for Noah.
“If only his name was Fire. I could say Go Fire Go.
That would be awesome!”
He gallops ahead a few feet, then gallops back.
“Dad, you know that I’m a horse like that’s my Chinese
symbol. Yeah, and the best of all is that I’m a Fire Horse, yeah,
because you can be fire or water in Chinese symbols. Cool huhn. I
love horses, they’re my favorite real animals. Dad, would you
prefer being fire or water?”
“Depends on what exactly that means. Each has its properties, so
I don’t know.”
Doubt, I think, is a function of age. Or having been
bitch-slapped.
“I’m happy I’m Fire…it’s way cooler.”
“Or hotter.”
Wow, a whole mess of neurons fired on that one.
“Good one dad. What’s your Chinese symbol?”
“Rooster.”
“Hah, that sucks! And if you’re a water rooster it’s even
worse. Imagine, a rooster in water.”
A wet bird. Sounds good to me.
“Yeah, Noah, but my Western sign is Aquarius, the best sign…it’s
the age of Aquarius, Aquarius, Aquariuuuuuusssss.”
I’ve been singing that since primary school…still waiting for
the coming of that bloody age that is supposed to be mine.
“Awkwardddddd.” Noah’s new fashionable word for dismissing
the ‘uncool’.
“I’m a Sagittarius, right dad? Yeah, it’s cool because he’s
a centaur and a centaur is half horse, half man, so it all makes
sense… you see? I’m a Fire horse and a Centaur and I love horses
best of all.”
A Centaur is like a horse’s ass with an asshole’s head. I
wouldn’t be that proud.
“Dad, what does an Aquarius do?”
“He’s the water-bearer.”
“Awkwaaaarrrd.”
“You know, oh arrogant little horse-butt, Aquarians are free,
smart, generous, open and damn sexy.”
“But dad, how is that possible? Like, I thought you
were an Aquarius.”
“I am…oh you little gas factory, you got me. Good one.”
“Haha…I’m on fiiiiiiirree. Like you couldn’t be
an Aquarius because of what you said Aquarius was. Funny huhn?”
Kill it by explaining it.
Today, I meet the psychologist for a detailed analysis of the
tests that Noah has done over several weeks. She has already told me
that there’s something there that is a little off, that may explain
his lack of focus, his stomach pains etc… today I may know more.
Explaining it.
We turn the last corner before his school. He charges off.
“Go Fire Go!”
Maybe it’s just that my little Sagittarius is a Horse with fire
in his belly.
“Go Fire Go!”

story:
The publishing world is one of the most organically changing industries today. Amazon changed the face of the way authors and publishers see the world, whether it's for the best or not is highly disputed. However, Half Light Publishing doesn't believe in resisting the changes this industry brings, but embracing those changes. This is why we call ourselves the publishing house of the 21st century.

We realize that Amazon is a monster that can't be contended with and with a forward-thinking executive team in place, we have found ways to use Amazon and the indie publishers of the world today to help propel us into tomorrow.

Whether it's finding a hybrid genre that readers yearn for or the unique author that has a voice and style yet unheard, we are the innovative publishing house that has long been sought after.

- Tina Williams, Founder of Half Light Publishing


Half Light Publishing has been in the making for some time.

With a strong executive team and fresh experience, we aim to bring something new to the publishing industry. 

Already in place: 

Two professional editors, a proofreader, submission director, marketing expert, and graphic designer for covers and book trailers (Catch his work in the video above)! 

What type of authors will we represent? 

We are looking for the authors that bring something unique to the table, whether it be through a hybrid genre or a unique writing style. In 2016, we will be looking to represent 3 new authors. 

Half Light already represents many titles! 

Half Light publishing will be representing all titles from author T.M. Williams including The Twisted Fairy Tale Series and Clusters: Case of the Missing.

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS COVER:

Stage 1: 

  • Website/Blog Launch ($150-$300) 
  • Logo Design ($50)
  • Set Up ($300) 
  • LLC Formation ($700) 
  • Set Up for Worldwide Presence and Distribution  ($150-$200)

Stage 2: 

  • Submissions sponsorship ($1500) 
  • Marketing ($300+) 
  • Advance to Authors ($3000-$5000) 

PLANS MOVING FORWARD: 

Creating unique booth experiences at select conventions. 

Marketing and promotions both on and offline through traditional media, bookstore events, Amazon, and other retailers, Goodreads, and outreach to bloggers for tours and special promotions.

Book Launch Events

'On Writing' blog to help aspiring as well veteran authors hone their craft.

Online events that fans near and far can participate in!

How to get involved:

Even if you can't contribute to this campaign, you can help! Here are some things you can do, that really can help to make this project a reality:

  • Read and share our content! Follow us on Twitter, Facebook and other social media channels as we open them.

  • Get the word out about our campaign. Whether you like sharing things via social media, email, or in person, please tell others about us and what we're trying to do. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share right from this page, or any way you can think of to shout it from the rooftops, but please tell your friends and family about the Half Light Launch project.

  • Give us feedback. We LOVE feedback because it’s important to us that this launch is a success and that we are providing a campaign that YOU want to be a part of. So tell us what you think of the campaign, the perks, or anything!

Thank you for reading this! And thank you so much for your support, whatever that support may look like. We really do appreciate you!

story:
Download the finished book for FREE!

You can download this finished book for FREE at the following location: https://www.ideapropulsionsystems.com/books/create-your-own-ready-reprap


You can download all the digital assets for the project, including 3D printable models, firmware, and instructions here: https://github.com/dhartkop/ReadyRepRap/

This 3D printer project was originally begun as an educational workshop in 2015 at the Pueblo City-County Library District as part of a STEM workshop series that I created. That printer was called the RepRap Libro, which was then developed further into the Ready RepRap. This book was to be completed through a crowdfunding campaign launched on Indiegogo in 2017. Though the campaign was not a success, I finished the book anyway and opted to simply release it and all related assets into the open source. 

Please feel free to download, build, share, sell, or modify the Ready RepRap! It is a great 3D robotic platform. It can be easily scaled up or down, and provides a great starting place for all kinds of larger format 3D printing or CNC work. So enjoy Create Your Own Ready RepRap by David Hartkop, published CC BY-SA 4.0 2017

 

The Ready RepRap has:

->The fewest 3D printed parts (25 total)
->The easiest to find hardware (electrical conduit and boxes)
->A big build volume (8 x 8 x 12 inches or 20 x 20 x 30 cm) 
->The lowest over all cost to create (right around $250 USD )

Welcome to the world of open-source 3D printers!

There are many different open-source 3D printer designs out there. Many are published at RepRap.org. Though many plans and resources are available, the task of organizing the project can often be too daunting to accomplish in the classroom. Create your own Ready RepRap is intended to pull all of those resources together into an accessible course curriculum for makers, educators and students.

The Ready RepRap is unique among open source printers because it has the fewest parts, requires only hand tools, and is easy to setup. Furthermore, all of the designs and software for the Ready RepRap are available online for free.  

Supporting this campaign will allow me to publish a high-quality step-by-step guide that provides a practical introduction to the world of open-source 3D printing, electronics, and software. 

Inspiration

My inspiration for this project stems from my job as technology trainer for a Colorado public library district. I wanted to conduct a STEM activity that involved making a 3d printer, but all of the open source designs were too complex or too costly to accomplish within just a few classroom sessions. It took weeks just to decide what parts to order, and months to assemble the hardware because it was so finicky. 

The Ready RepRap is easy to build. You don’t need a workshop, just table space and some basic hand tools. Basic to the design is reducing the number of required parts to an essential few. There are still a few special parts to order, such as the stepper motors and Arduino microcontroller, but we include an easy online shopping guide. 

Positive learning opportunities presented by the book include the following: 

  • 3D printing concepts and practices
  • Teamwork and organization of tasks and materials
  • modular design thinking
  • introduction to microcontrollers and robotics concepts
  • basic electronics
  • hands-on assembly with basic tools
  • problem solving

 

Experience

I am a technology designer and educator. My previous jobs have been as technology trainer for the Pueblo City-County Library District, as creator of the Mini Metal Maker 3D metal printer, and as faculty for the Pueblo Community College School of film & television.

 I have also published numerous open source projects through Makerbot Thingiverse and Tinkercad.com. I have over seven years of experience with 3D printing technology and ten-plus years of professional experience as a 3D modeler.

My last 3D printing endeavor was the Mini Metal Maker, which creates with metal clay. That fruits of that project are available online as a DIY book and as a professional level 3D printer.

With Your Help

If you are an educator, a parent, a student, or an inspired maker, please consider donating to this project. With your support, we will complete and publish Build the Ready RepRap, a truly comprehensive beginner’s guide to creating an open source 3D printer. Good instructions make all the difference on the path to positive learning outcomes!

story:
Chi siamo

“Gazzetta dei Trasporti - IlPendolare Magazine” nasce nel 2007 come progetto di testata on-line con l’ambizione di inserirsi ed affermarsi nel panorama dell’informazione di settore offrendo un innovativo punto di riferimento per chiunque abbia desiderio di essere informato su quello che accade nel panorama della mobilità e del trasporto pubblico in modo obiettivo, puntale e professionalmente corretto.

Nel 2016, dopo una lunga e lenta gestazione ed in vista del decennale, da semplice webzine “Gazzetta dei Trasporti diventa un magazine su carta con uscita mensile. Una scelta in controtendenza a conferma della crescita professionale maturata nel corso degli anni positivamente premiata dal gradimento dei lettori nel corso di questo primo anno. 

Realizzati da una redazione giovane e dinamica, coordinata con professionalità ed attenzione, i contenuti di “Gazzetta dei Trasporti rappresentano una novità nel panorama dell’informazione nel settore della mobilità e dei trasporti per il diverso approccio alla notizia. 
Non la ricerca dello scoop a tutti i costi, ma un attento lavoro di analisi e ricerca per spiegare in modo dettagliato quanto accade ed offrire ai lettori uno strumento di approfondimento serio e di facile lettura.

Ed ora vogliamo continuare a crescere con nuovi prodotti di informazione crossmediali su tutte le piattaforme disponibili. Oltre al web ed al cartaceo, anche video, social, sistemi di informazione in tempo reale (Whatsapp e Telegram).

In base alle vostre offerte sapremo, e potremo, dare luogo ai progetti futuri. Noi ci crediamo, e voi?

Cosa offriamo

In occasione del decennale è in realizzazione un volume che ripercorre attraverso immagini questi dieci anni trascorsi assieme. Verrà realizzato in edizione limitata, numerata e nominativa. Ognuno di voi possederà un volume esclusivo, il primo di una serie di libri che realizzeremo grazie anche al vostro sostegno.

Questo è l’omaggio che abbiamo intenzione di donare a chi vorrà inviarci un suo contributo.

Fino ad oggi siamo andati avanti in completo autofinanziamento, ma ora, per poter crescere, non basta più.

Proprio per questo veniamo a proporvi il crowdfunding: per raccogliere i fondi necessari a far partire un primo step di interventi necessari inizialmente al restyling del sito ed aggiornare parte della strumentazione, foto e videocamere, apparecchiature varie, in uso, così da poter avviare, entro breve una seconda fase di nuovi prodotti editoriali. 

Ci siamo posti un target. Auspichiamo di poterlo superare grazie alla vostra generosità.
Se fosse possibile, ed ognuno di voi ci offrisse l’equivalente di due caffè, completeremmo la raccolta in poche ore, ma è necessario avere una certezza dei fondi. 

Per voi nessun rischio. Chi ci darà la sua fiducia con un contributo avrà garantito, in ogni caso, l'invio del volume fotografico. Non ci saranno sorprese nè ripensamenti, l'importante è lasciare tutti i dati necessari per l'invio al termine della campagna. 

Domande ricorrenti (FAQ)

A chi sto donando i miei soldi?

Stai donando la tua quota alla testata giornalistica “Gazzetta dei Trasporti | IlPendolare Magazine”. L'assicurazione della nostra serietà è nel sito web (LINK), nel quale trovate traccia delle pubblicazioni realizzate e del lavoro che svolgiamo.

Perchè vi servono 1800 euro?

Si tratta di una quota necessaria per la realizzazione, elaborazione e stampa del volume, incluse, per gli invii destinati in Italia, le spese di spedizione.
La cifra non è relativa unicamente ai costi materiali. Con la donazione contribuite alla possibilità di acquistare nuove apparecchiature, in modo paerticolare foto e videocamera, per poter svolgere al meglio il nostro lavoro e, soprattutto, avviare nuovi prodotti editoriali.
Maggiormente riusciamo ad avvicinarci al target, più probabile sarà l’opportunità di dare il via al nuovo corso

Non riesco a donare e/o ad accedere all'acquisto dei gadget: come faccio?

Ecco a te la procedura guidata!

La prima cosa è andare sul link:
www.igg.me/at/decennale-gdt
Nella prima pagina si può ascoltare il video/appello della redazione. Se si condividono le motivazioni e si vuol dare un sostegno concreto allora si clicca su "Contribute now". Così di accede alla prima fase:

  1. Contribute - In questa fase posso scegliere se avere il regalo finale ("Add Perk") e allora devo per forza attenermi alle cifre impostate e inserire i dati di e-mail, oppure posso scegliere di non avere il regalo ("No Perk") e quindi la mia offerta diventa libera (da 1 euro all'infinito...). Per facilitare l'acquisto dei gadget nella pagina principale sono inseriti dei banner che mi consentono donare avendo già nel carrello il ricordo desiderato: dovrò comunque controllare che il sistema abbia inserito correttamente ciò che intendo acquistare.
    Con "Contact Information" posso scegliere di identificarmi tramite Facebook (per chi lo ha) oppure inserire la mia e-mail.
    Dopo la scelta di quanto contribuire si passa quindi alla seconda fase:
  2. Pay - clicco su "Go to Pay Pal" e mi appare una schermata dove mi si dà la possibilità di scegliere se pagare con Pay Pal (se io ho una carta di credito associata a un conto Pay Pal) oppure con una qualsiasi carta di credito. In questo secondo caso, che penso sia per la maggioranza di noi, cliccandoci sopra mi chiede, lo stato, la lingua (e qui le cose diventano più facili dato che posso scegliere l'italiano) e i dati della carta (numero, data scadenza, numero segreto...). Un'unica accortezza: togliete la spunta sulla casella che dice "Salva questi dati su un conto Pay Pal".
    Così abbiamo completato l'operazione con la terza fase:
  3. Share - posso vedere il mio contributo che appare tra i "Funders"

Temo che la piattaforma non sia sicura per i pagamenti online: ci sono alternative di pagamento?

No, la campagna Indiegogo è l'unica modalità. Per fugare tutti i dubbi, ti assicuro che si tratta di un canale già testato con successo in altri contesti e perciò scelta a ragion veduta.

In che modalità verrà consegnato il volume?

Il volume verrà inviato per posta attraverso “Raccomandata” al termine della campagna.
I Funders riceveranno una mail (importante pertanto fornire una mail valida) il risposta alla quale dovranno comunicare il recapito dove si intende ricevere il perk richiesto.

Ho altre domande!

Saremo lieti di risponderti! Puoi contattarci liberamente utilizzando la mail: donazione@gazzettadeitrasporti.it
